text: Usually a great place, classic joint in Chicago. In a city with an abundance of great food and service, Tavern should step back to great service. Female bartender Saturday nite was not on par with the restaurants history or the city's level of service.

Came here because I was in the neighborhood and was looking for a tasty brunch, and was extremely underwhelmed.  The space itself is pretty, and looks very fancy, and was quite full.  I ordered an egg scramble for my meal-- and truly, I could've made the same thing myself at home.  Service was also extremely slow. I wanted ketchup with my home fries and had to ask 2 servers to track my server down to get some. We ended up staying much longer than we wanted to because we couldn't get a hold of our server, and when we asked for the check they gave it to the wrong table.  Not impressed, especially when there are much better places for brunch in the area.

I was very impressed with the food at ToR! I was expecting it to be generic and just a step above frozen food, but this was not the case. They do have the best seats for people watching. The menu items are moderately priced, and the wait staff are friendly. I won't be running back here, but it is good for what it is.

Tavern on Rush is just an average dining experience when looking for a fancy dinner out.  The downstairs bar is not swanky but instead loud, crowded and uncomfortable. Focusing on the upstairs dining room, I had a very awkward waiter who both gave me a fist bump and also asked to shake my hand (for no apparent reason).  The service was overall just average - by the end of our meal our bread basket was still on the table and the crumbs from the different courses were never swept up. I ordered one of their "top tier" bottles of wine - a 2013 vintage of Stag's Leap.  I am well versed in wine and was not ordering based off name recognition, but instead of my knowledge from wine collecting.  However, when the bottle came, it was a 2011 vintage.  It was a birthday dinner and I didn't want to be annoying and send the bottle away, plus at that moment I was not aware of the quality of the 2011 and assumed it was fine.  When I got home and researched the 2011 vintage, it is nowhere close to the 95 points the 2013 is rated - thus Tavern on Rush took advantage of me with a "bait and switch" thinking I would not know the difference. I did email the restaurant to voice my displeasure, and after one week they have not responded so I can also confirm they do not care about their guests. The food was pretty good - but food is good everywhere in Chicago so that alone is not a reason to come here.

Our group had an amazing experience here.  The food was perfectly done and the service from our waiter Jason was even better.  His presentation of the specials and description of the beef choices was one of a kind.  Very attentive and quirky personality...ask for Jason and you'll be happy you did.  Best filet I've ever had!

A group of us went here for dinner and drinks, and all really enjoyed the experience.  The bread was very good; it was so good, in fact, that we didn't even order appetizers.  I had the Alaskan crab legs, which were slightly overcooked, but still good.  Others in our party ordered the pork chop, steak, and jambalaya, which were all very good.  We ordered sides of twice-baked potato, baked potato, broccoli, and mushrooms, which were all very gapped, also.  We had chocolate tiramisu for dessert, and everyone enjoyed it.  Service is what brings this to a "4 stars" level for me; our waiter was rude to some members of our party, although he was very polite to some of us.  We aren't sure what caused this.  Overall, however, this was a great meal, and I look forward to returning.

So this is not a typical place for me to usually visit, but I was in the area with a group of girl friends and the patio was calling our name.  The service was overall good and the drink selection was pretty good as well.  It was a great place to people watch and enjoy some Summer Time Chi.

This is a place to get a cocktail, people watch & then go to the dining room.  The bar was friendly, and even though it was tough to get a seat at first, the bartenders were VERY quick and super attentive, despite how busy it was.  Then, we were seated upstairs in the dining area, but on the patio --- HIGHLY RECOMMEND ASKING FOR THIS SEAT ---- not only is it great people watching outside, but you also get to experience the serenity of the dining room.  I WANTED TO POST 4 STARS (instead of 5) but this place gets 5 because THE SERVICE WAS AMAZING.  Not only did our server get every single detail correct, but he even gave us a complementary Tiramisu desert!  T About the food: - GET ANY STEAKS ON THE MENU - The filet mignon was fantastic - Get the chipotle mac & cheese - Get the tiramisu There's something special about the steaks here; they are not cooked sous-vide, so it's incredible how tender they are.  We absolutely loved our server, and he's the one that made this experience 5 stars.

Chicago, IL Well, I need to tell you, I have mixed feelings. You have this triangle filled with restaurants, along with some pubs in the surrounding area.  Loved where this restaurant was located. Great vibe. The hosts strange to say we're very pleasant. The restaurant was cramp packed. It had a classy atmosphere. My waitress with lots of tattoos, was very pleasant. They had indoor, and outdoor seating. Very cool place. It made you want to hang out.  This is my aunts neighborhood. She had a Margherita pizza, it looked not so good. NY style. Could have tasted amazing. I don't know, I did not try it. Spinach salad, was bitter, and I added Salmon. It was the saddest looking piece I have ever seen at a restaurant. It looked like something you would get out of a grocery store. One of those mini, precooked meals. Ends were burnt. We ordered a drink everyone was drinking called pineapple xpress. Wow that was the most bitter, undrinkable drink that I have ever tasted. Not because of the alcohol contain. Because the strange combination of mixes. It did not work. Also noticed other people did not finish their drink either.  Had to have a few Blue Moons to wash it down. Which is never a bad thing in any situation.  Great prices.  Compared to most places, you can order a lot, without the huge bill at the end.  Hopefully their quality of dinner will get better. Never complained while I was their. I had a lot of catching up with my favorite. It's bin a  long time. Hate leaving negative reviews.

Ate here last night after having a wonderful experience last year. I'm sad to say it didn't at all live up to our expectations.... The lemon dill humus was delicious! The veggies tastes a little old and we're dry. The pitta tastes shop bought. The calamari was the worst I had ever eaten in my life. The waitress acted like she's never eaten calamari when I told her it was bad. My friends daughter said she's eat it. If it were mine I'd have sent it back! My salmon burger was average, my daughters soup was good and the wine was delicious. Our  waitress was lovely apart from the calamari incident. Won't be going back. Expensive and not worth the money.

Normally I don't like to give ratings on service but when something is as bad as this, I have no choice. I got to the restaurant at 11pm and was told to order as the kitchen was closing. Once we ordered it took some time before we received our food and drinks which I was fine with. The outside seating was full and I was in no rush so didn't mind waiting. What I was not fine with was that shortly after receiving our drinks and food, we were told we needed to leave. We were not even close to finishing. We boxed up our food and left our wine at the table. When I tried to tell one of the staff that I felt that this wasn't right. He stopped me mid sentence, said it was city rules and walked away as I started speaking again. Zero customer service. Zero understanding. Spent over 100 dollars to get a box of food that was never eaten.

Staff was very friendly and attentive the whole night. The tuna tartare was pretty good, although not anything special compared to the tartare at any other restaurant. The turkey teriyaki burger was an incredibly large portion, and probably bigger than my face. Colleagues quite impressed I could even make a dent in it, it was seriously five inches tall. Tasted very good, although the fries were soft and less appealing. Piña colada sorbet was a nice finish to the dinner. Decent restaurant if you're in the area, but not somewhere I would go out of my way to dine in.
Nice place to take a break and drink coffee or other beverages. The food items are of good variety. If you are in the vicinity, definitely a good idea to visit.

We had a disappointing experience at Tavern on Rush, specifically due to poor service. We were celebrating a special occasion (birthday) and were pleased to get a table outside in the wonderful summer weather.  Our server, Jacqueline, was rude from the start. Dropped off menus without a glance or waiting for drink orders. Our questions about the wine list or food seemed to just annoy her. Silverware between courses was dropped on the table with a clang. In short, not good service, but we carried on with our meal.  The situation worsened when there was stone/grit/foreign particles in my side salad. Our server was not apologetic or interested in finding out what could have gone wrong. There was no acknowledgment of this when our bill arrived. When I questioned her about this at the end of the night, her immediate response was - "Well you didn't pay for the salad, it's free." Two things - (1) The salad is not free. Its price is baked in to the price of the entree. (2) I am not looking for a free salad or a free dessert (which was offered later when I asked to speak to the manager) - I am looking for acknowledgment from the wait staff that something unexpected or unpleasant has happened, and for suggestions on how they can improve my experience (either on this visit or the next). The manager, Joe, did come speak to us when requested. He gave us his card and asked us to present it the next time we dined here (I am not sure what presenting the card is going to do, however). I hope the restaurant understands that if you describe yourself as an "upscale" restaurant, customers have a certain expectation regarding the level of service. During this visit, this level of service was not received. I do want to emphasize that the service from the other staff - those who brought water/drinks and cleared our plates - was friendly and pleasant.   Please train your staff (consistently) on how to take an interest in the experience of your guests. If an error or incident is pointed out, the first response shouldn't be "Well it was free" - you served me food with stones in it, this deserves some acknowledgment.  Last suggestion -  it would be really nice if silverware was replaced between courses, instead of dropping the dirty silverware back on to the tablecloth. This would help with establishing the upscale environment the restaurant is going for.

I experienced the WORST service here ever the other afternoon and I was stunned. To begin, we ordered drinks and appetizers and neither arrived before they brought out my burger without cheese and did not even bring my boyfriend's meal. Also while waiting they did not bring out the drinks, the bread basket, or appetizers. So my boyfriend signals the waiter over & inquires about the already ordered drinks & appetizers as well as the bread basket. 5 minutes later an ice cold break basket arrives and 5 minutes after that cold crab cakes as well. We sent everything back to the kitchen to be reheated but by that point my appetite was ruined. Please do better TOR.

Wow ! 1) the food overall on multiple occasions is 100% outstanding  2) the service from the Bar, the tables and outside is 100% outstanding  3) drinks great + cold  4) the only thing we have not enjoyed is the calamari, it's been chewy on a consistent basis. 5) you simply cant go wrong if you want fun, atmosphere, great food, kind respectful service and a great Chicago experience !
Joe has got to be the greatest server on the entire planet!!! High energy, informative, likeable and just all around awesome!! Thanks for the wonderful meal! We will be back!
Tavern has a great brunch on the weekends! Lots of options, but the burgers and steak sandwich are especially good.

Came for an early dinner on Saturday. We LOVE Tavern and have been coming here forever.  That night was different.  I would have given 5 stars, but the bartender was one of the rudest young gals I have experienced in a long time.  Didn't say hi, made us sit there for a good 7 minutes before she even came over to us.  She was too busy flirting with the gentleman bartender.  When we were done with our drinks, we sat another 10 minutes while she flitted around (not waiting on anyone,  just talking with the bar backs), we had to flag her down for the bill and that took another 5 minutes.  It was a joke.  Not the Tavern way at all.   HOWEVER,  Bennie gave us a great table, our server was impeccable, and as always and our dinner was to die for!  We had a nice bottle of wine and the most wonderful evening!  Everything was spot on and service was like a fine oiled machine!  Just fantastic! Thank you Chef for the wonderful meals!

This applies only to the outdoor seating. I can't think of a nicer place in Chicago to sit, relax, have a drink and a light meal, and people watch.  My wife and I love the place and go on a regular basis.  It's easy to blow the kids tuition money if you're not careful, but if you're on a budget you'd be surprised by how good the food can be without spending a bundle.
We had brunch here and it was great! The service was not good. Waitress forgot about us several times but it was busy so we didn't mind too much. Food was delicious though.

Great lunch spot! Enjoyed the Bloody Mary so much we stayed for lunch! I had the Sonoma chicken wrap with French fries and my friend ordered the angus sliders. Everything was yummy! TOR is the perfect place for al Fresco dining and people watching. I heard the outdoor area upstairs is fabulous but it was closed when we went. Fast, attentive service. Will definitely return!

We had the loveliest lunch here on Monday. It's such a beautiful area. We got the table outside and it was perfect.  The service was great, friendly and fast.  I got the veggie burger. It was fantastic! No buns, lots of raw veggies and an avocado dip.

The service was ok. They were busy but I had the flag down our waitress several times. I got the vanilla yogurt with granola and fresh fruit. The fruit was very good and fresh and the granola was good too. The skimp you on the vanilla yogurt though! I Also tried my wife's bacon and it was good and crispy. The patio is nice but kind of crammed.

I really wanted to like this place, but there were problems on so many levels.  It's divided into two levels that are nicely decorated, plus extensive patio seating. We sat upstairs, which is horse racing themed.  The menu is extensive, and the kitchen is fast, if not particularly talented. Lemon hummus was quite good. Tuna tartare was pedestrian and the tuna was tired.  My Bellevue Salad was described as coming with rock shrimp, but they were just small, regular, flavorless shrimp. The kitchen also forgot the balsamic vinagrette dressing.  The sliders were fine, but the kitchen forgot the cheese.  These problems could have been corrected had our server been available more often than once every fifteen minutes. But with as almost two hours invested in a forgettable lunch it didn't seem worth the effort.  Incidentally, the wine list is nice and fairly priced.
Worst service ever.  The hostess and the manager are rude. We have been here multiple times and have had good service. On Saturday the worst and so rude. Will never go back.

Decided to give this place another shot after a previously botched dinner experience and struck out yet again.  Ordered the eggs Benedict which came out cold and my girlfriend ordered the fruit and granola.  Fruit and granola, how could one mess that up you ask?  Well let me tell you.  The granola was just a nature valley bar (green one) that the chef must have stomped on in the back before scooping it out on a plate and the fruit was mushy and all tasted the same.  Sort of like when you go to the grocery and buy too much of everything and then you don't want to be wasteful so you find a big bowl and put everything in there but then you forget about it for a few days and next time you bite into a strawberry it has the consistency of cotton candy and it tastes exactly like its pineapple neighbor.  Needless to say, I wouldn't order the fruit.  On the bright side the service was just slow which is a step up from incredibly slow so they have that going for them.
Eggs Benedict meat was a bit fatty, eggs too soft, and hollandaise fine but I've had better. Potatoes excellent and crispy. Service great and friendly. Location nice and comfortable.

My party of 4 arrived at 4:30pm on the 4th of July and was able to immediately get a seat outside.  They have a large wine and cocktail list with reasonable prices. They waitress was not able to tell me the difference between the two rose wines (other than to say one was more popular... The more expensive one). Typically at a place like this, they can tell you if one is drier, sweeter, etc. The tacos were nothing special and didn't have enough meat to make them worthwhile but ok for a bar snack.

As a fan of this restaurant, having dined here several times, I am sad to say my family and I will not be returning. We made a reservation and I specified in the comments that we would like patio seating. I was unaware that they did not take reservations for outside, and was told "I saw you specified it in the reservations but we don't do that." Although it was my mistake that I did not double-check this, a call from the restaurant letting me know that that reservation could not be honored would have been nice. When I spoke to the outdoor hostess, she told me that the wait time for a table for 3 would be 20 minutes maximum, which I was fine with. We also were able to check our place in line with the Yelp app, which told us how many people were in front of us.  Long story short, AN HOUR AND TEN MINUTES after I put my name in, the app told us that we were next. We stood in front of the hostess stand and watched party after party get seated before us. We also heard that manager tell people who just arrived "I'll get you in - five minutes" and sat them immediately. We were as patient as we could be, and when one of my party guests talked to the manager who was at the hostess stand, he was unwilling to take the blame for bumping other parties ahead of us, rolled his eyes, and was extremely rude. We were legitimately dumbfounded by how we can go to next in line, to watching several parties sit before us, and have a 20 minute wait extended to a 90 minute wait.  This was so disappointing because as usual, the food was absolutely amazing, and our waitress Heidi was incredible. I wish I could give this a 5 star rating for the amazing food and wait staff, but the preceding factors ruined our whole (very expensive) dining experience.

Had the best table. Weather was amazing! Staff was extremely polite and officiant. I had the stuffed French toast !! Amazing! Scrambled eggs with cheese very tasty. Cut potato fries! Spot on! My girlfriend had the breakfast Burrito with chicken sausage! I took a bite filled with amazing flavor!! We had some champagne sparkling water. You have to come eat here!! I would give more stars if I could! Site outside during the summer!!

Went back on 6/24 and the matre de remembered us from the "chicken fiasco...:)" a few weeks ago.  We didn't order desert but he sent a platter with three desserts when we asked for the check.  Totally unexpected but showed a lot of class.  Dinner and service was, as usual, excellent.  We had the pork chop, some filet's and pasta.

One of the best places for a steak in a nice setting in Chicago. The daytime manager Ronny is one of the funniest, kindest gentlemen I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. The nighttime manager Benny is also an amazing host who made me and my date feel extremely special. The food is to die for and the steaks are a special treat. Finish with the tiramisu and you are good to go!

Great bar in a great area! Drinks are pricey but you got to pay for the location, they are good drinks though, and that costs money too. Their pizzas are all that, I highly recommend you try any of their pizzas. We usually find parking within a block or two, parking has never been an issue. Go there to see and be seen.

Although my steak was very good, not quite as good as Gibson's; hence the four stars...lobster diablo was pretty good, but not as spicy hot that I like. The crowd is so-so. We sat outside and people watched...and hey whatzup with all those tall  servers and hostesses? Wow! They're all stunning modelish types! I'd come back often!

Everything about our dining experience was amazing. Prime steak and tuna tartar were both prepared perfectly.  The service was over the top, professional and available, but not overbearing.  The lively atmosphere gives the place a nice feel. People were there to have fun and a great meal. High scores on both.

Quite possibly the biggest charcuterie board ever! My husband and I had a couple of drinks and 2 apps. The charcuterie board was HUGE! Came with 3 types of meat and one type of cheese. Would've liked a cheese variety but there was a substantial amount of what we got. Crusted bread and pickles topped it off perfectly! They could probably put a fruit type spread on there to counteract the sodium but WOW! Was skeptical but well worth the price! Also ordered the Cajun shrimp. Can't remember the last time I needed 3 bites to finish a shrimp. Nice n big, great flavor. Natalie was our server and she had a nice smile and nice demeanor the whole time, despite how busy it got. Fun vibe, always enjoy our time there!

They kicked us out 30 mins before the restaurant close. We didn't even finish the drinks. I don't mind leaving early but they were rude about it. The manager shout at us saying that, "leave right now" while we had half bottle of champagne.

I came here with my boyfriend around 12pm on a Saturday for a quick lunch, and was seated quickly.  We told our server that we were in a bit of a rush, and she told us it was no problem at all!  We ordered the grilled calamari to start, and then I ordered the Bellevue salad, and my boyfriend ordered the burger.  The grilled calamari was REALLY GOOD!! it was cooked really well.  The salad and burger were also pretty good, although nothing fantastic.  The service was great!! I'll probably be back for the calamari!

A Nigerian and a Colombian walk into this restaurant and had a disgraceful experience. My friend has been to this restaurant many times, and loved it and so she suggested this spot for dinner. Today's experience was particularly alarming for me because today was the first time I've experience this level of poor customer service mixed with low-key discrimination. We wasted an hour waiting for a table. A table for 2 at that. At first when we arrived, we were told about a 30 mins wait for the patio area. We put our name and number in and we were told that we would be notified via text. No problem, we understood it was a busy restaurant and were willing to kill time at a store nearby. We came back a bit over 30 mins later inquiring about the wait time. We then were told by one of the girls that she had texted us and we replied with a "no" back to her. This was far from the truth. In fact, we never received a notification hence why we came back asking for a time estimate. It truly seemed like the girls at the door just didn't put us on the list because we were "just the perfect mix" to be discriminated against, at least thats the way we felt. She then said she would look to see if any outside seating was available. We had shared with her we wanted to sit at the front section prior to putting our names in so we were hoping we could be seated right away. From our view, there were many open tables in the front of the house. Mind you, the restaurant doesn't take reservations for the patio area however as we waited, people were readily been seated at these spots. Which made us wonder, what's really going on? Could they possibly be picking and choosing who gets seated where based on a criteria? Do we fit that criteria? When we asked how much more we had to wait, and even though there were tables free, they wanted to take us to the back of the restaurant like "let's put the people of color in the back of the house" We asked - why can't we have one of these open tables right there in the front. I literally witnessed these girls work so hard to make up an excuse, that they changed the version of their lies 3 times. At one point another male employee came over and gave a different reason why we couldn't be seated at one of the openings out front. My friend and I understood exactly what was going on and expressed out dissatisfaction. As POC, we know when micro-aggressions are directed towards us. All in all, we will not be coming back and I will not recommend this establishment to anyone. Honestly, I've lived in Chicago almost 10 years and have gone to many restaurants and this is the first time I've been treated this way. My suggestion to Tavern- Get it together! OR at least do a better job at turning people away. Most importantly EVERYONE should feel welcome in your establishment and should have an opportunity to seat at the front of the house. Do better and train your staff to treat everyone the same.
Horrible service horrendous food. Would not recommend it.  It took 30 minutes for my server to offer me a drink, the steak was horrible and no flavor what's so ever.

This place is amazing.  There are two floors.   At ground level, there is a bar area, great place to mingle with others and for friends to just come over, dress classy and drink next to the bar.   If you are looking at a place to eat, walk upstairs and get a table.  You see the setting change to a quiet eating are with an open view of the kitchen.  The first thing that sticks out is the big oven for the pizzas that they have.  Everything on the menu seemed really nice, but at the time i went there, i was craving a burger.  I got the Ribeye Steak Sandwich, ordered medium rare. The burger was by far my second favorite burger i have tried in Chicago, next to Au Cheval.  The rib-eye was soo juicy and the mushrooms in the burger just blew my mind. If you go here, you must try that or the chicken,  Our waiter recommended the Grilled abodo chicken breast and added a lemon sauce to it which made them all sound as if they were in love with their food.   Do check this place out when ever you get the chance in river north.

Not worth the hype.  Burger was super dry and over cooked.  Bartender has no clue about drinks. Only nice part is the outdoor seating that allows you to people watch.  They also have some pretty hot hostess.  Save your money

On a nice day, Tavern On Rush is the place to be for lunch. They have bistro tables and chairs outside surrounding their restaurant and I swear, you feel like you're in Europe sitting in one of those cafes.  Not only the ambiance is fantastic, the food was very good! We order their salmon BLT and their Tavern prime burger with bacon jam. It was so fresh and so delicious! I would recommend this place to anyone who wants not only great food but great ambiance as well.
1) best people watching in the city 2) decent food 3) great people watching 4) a full bar 5) great people watching  6) did I mention the strange and unusual people walking around here?

My wife recently attempted to book a private room at Tavern on Rush for a graduation lunch for our son.   The lady she spoke with said the room was available and took our information.   She said that there should be no problem, and that we would later get a confirmation email.   Later that evening we received an email stating that we could not book the room because there was a 15 person minimum and we only were booking for 12.   My wife suggested that we simple state that we have 15 and show up with our 12 guest.   I wanted to be honest and figured we could work out something with the restaurant.   I called back to Tavern on Rush and explained the situation and asked if there was a food/drink minimum and what would happen if we booked it and less than 15 people showed up.   She said there was no minimum and we would still be accepted, but at that point she refused to allow us to book the room even though I said we would invite more guest!   I guess the moral of the story is dishonesty is the best policy...

One of my favorite spots to go to and sit outside With great service. The manager Eric made sure we were taken great care of and was very professional and polite. The staff was great. Would definitely recommend to friends. Wonderful service

I always want to like this place,  I really do. The  location is good, the environment is great, the service SUCKS. Went tonight for a nightcap,  sat at a table for 15 minutes with zero service. Not the first time it has happened,  but definitely the last.

Tavern On Rush is a Gold Coast staple for meals, cocktails and nightlife.   The restaurant proper is upstairs but the full menu is served in the bar and out at the sidewalk tables. I've enjoyed various salads, fish entrees, pizza and desserts. I was really surprised at how much I enjoyed the pizza. When I'm hungry for a big entree salad, I always think of TOR! Service is always good, provided by exceptionally attractive trixies in between their modeling gigs. They are knowledgeable and attentive without being intrusive.  I would suggest a window table upstairs for a quiet meal with a view of Rush Street. If you want to be apart of the action, the see & be seen crowds are always in action. Fancy cars and beautiful people are always present. Warm weather makes the tables outside worth their weight in gold! There is valet parking available ad a small parking lot around the corner.

I visited Tavern on Sunday with my boyfriend for late lunch, early dinner. The place was extremely busy. I noticed that even the patio was completely full even though it was 50 degrees out (with Chicago winds.) The ambiance was great, very, very loud though, so if you're looking for a more quiet lunch or dinner, this is probably not the place (UNLESS you dine on the second floor, soft music, bread and butter on the table type.) Food was really good, drinks however, definitely needed some work, the taste was a little off (like who gets Moscow Mule wrong?!). Overall good experience. Will come back for the food!

I have been a loyal Tavern on Rush patron for many years and have celebrated my birthday there several times. I am appalled by the reception I (or lack thereof) I received this evening. I recommended that my friend and I enjoy the nice weather by having dinner outside there. We both ordered a meal but no alcohol because we both have busy days ahead of us. The server took forever to take our order. Once we got our food, we didn't see her again until she brought the bill. She took my plate to wrap up my leftovers and again disappeared for 10 minutes. I didn't think I was going to see my leftovers again. I paid the bill and literally 5 minutes later, the host (or manager?) walked past my table. Our server, who was serving the table next to mine, looked from the host to my table and then rolled her eyes. My friend and I, who are both doctors, were made to feel like absolute trash. We had been there way less than 2 hours and don't deserve to feel unwelcome at a place that I have always loved going. I will now only go to the neighboring establishments, which will hopefully be more respectful of all customers, not just the ones who are spending $100s on food and drinks.

I went here last night for a late night drink with a friend to kickoff my birthday week - my waitress was Gabby (who was awesome and gave great suggestions when I had questions on the menu). The cool thing about this tavern is that it is open until midnight on a Sunday - you don't find that type of thing back out in the suburbs. To start the night we had the Blackened Cajun Shrimp which was delicious. My friend thought they had put too much spice on the shrimp - however I highly enjoyed it with the two dipping sauces they served with the shrimp. For the main meal I chose the Jambalaya which was delicious. The first time I had mussels didn't go over too well - however the way they prepared the mussels here at Tavern on Rush was fabulous. My friend opted for a large bucket of french fries as she was not that hungry. To finish off the night we ordered a cappuccino and a Chocolate Marble TIramisu which was silky in the texture and the mousse was whipped to perfection in my opinion. The plating of the Tiramisu was well done that I almost did not want to eat it due to how pretty it looked - but boy oh boy it tasted like heaven. For drinks my friend got a Mimosa which was good, however she stated there was no sweetness meaning the ratio of champagne to orange juice was greatly leaning towards champagne. I got the Strawberry Blonde Martini which was delicious and it tasted very fresh with each sip which was nice. Another super plus to Tavern on Rush is that valet parking is only $16.99 which is great for the city in my opinion. I will come back to Tavern on Rush  to spend some summer nights dining outside that is for sure.
Came for lunch had the Bison Burger just phenomenal.  My wife had the filet burger freaking amazing to say the least.  This place is a must visit.

It was tuff to give a 3star bc its an amazing place and we have been here before on many occasions, but the 3star is reflecting on one of the Manager's poor attitude. My husband and I were here this past Saturday night around 9:30pm. We ordered the Pineapple infused vodka and we were not satisfied with the drinks. We have had many infused vodka drinks at other very reputable establishments in Chicago and never had a problem with our drinks.   The drinks that were brought were straight pineapple infused vodka on the rocks. They were very weak that it tasted like water on ice with a splash of pineapple. So we asked Katrina, our waitress to send them back bc we were not happy with them.  A manager came over to our table and immediately challenged us on our explanation for sending the drinks back. When we explained again that we have  a great deal of experience with infused vodka and these drinks were very watery, he argued that they do not water down their drinks. Our concern is simply the beligerante attitude and continued argument by the manager. We are not sure if the lack of personable experience (since he was pretty young) or if that is just his way of handling any situations.  Fortunately our waitress, Katrina, brought over two old fashions that met our expectations and we continued to join our evening. We were gonna head out and cancel our order bc of this manager's way of handling this, but our waitress was very attentive which is why we decided to stay. We also had 3 friends from out of State that called us to see if we were still there, and when they arrived they seemed to e joyed it so after all it was a good night.

Never. Ever. Again. I couldn't even make it past the appetizer. We got there at 5:53pm....the music was so loud I had to shout to talk to my friend. Everyone around us was loud and obnoxious- and there was a girl crying in the bathroom downstairs. Our waitress was bouncing from table to table, taking drink orders, laughing and flirting, but because we were not drinking, she paid very little attention to us. We ordered the seared Hawaiian tuna and it was terrible. It was drowning in the ginger soy sauce, salty as hell, and I knew exactly how it felt. We quickly got out of there and my ears didn't stop ringing for a while, a lot longer than the time we spent in there. The louder the music, the louder the shouting, on....and on. Nope. Just nope.
Bad service, I won't be back. My food did not meet the hype and the maitre'd was very rude!

Go here if your trying to drink rosé outside during the summer or find some serious type of sugar daddy. They'll pry all over you if your hair looks decent, you dress nice, and drink high end tequila ! 5 stars for sugar daddies and the outdoor patio

Food is mehhhh .... kind of average leaning towards bad but the service is excelente and it's very lively and crowded enough to have a good time any given afternoon.  When the weather allows it , they have patio tables  The menu is vast but pretty generic  Tartare , salads , oysters , burgers and a few desserts  The waitresses wear super right and short red dresses and are pretty attractive so this is no place for a date !!! Lol.  Nice area close to upscale stores  Opens till 2 am
Great atmosphere, the food is outstanding I haven't had something from here that I didn't like

Went outside to have a cigarette. Went to go back in and the so called older doorman said, No! Time  to go!" For no reason. Still had my purse & drink inside where my friend was. He grabbed my arm as I walked in to at least grab my things. Was very disrespected! Very rude!!! I've been here before will not go back after such an angry, aggressive man who is supposed to represent a nice establishment treats their female paying clients in that manner.

My friends and I got this place recommended by our hotel's concierge and we loved it !! We were warmly greeted by the hostess and got a table upstairs by the window. The server was very fast in welcoming us and offering the daily special which all sounded amazing. Of all the dishes that we ordered, my favorite was the salmon BLT ! The server recommended it being cooked medium rare, and Im so glad I took her recommendation. The salmon was very thickly cut, and the portion size on the dish was very big. For the price, it was definitely worth it. All the other dishes were very good as well! Will definitely be returning :) Give this place a try when you're near Oak st. Area !

I went to Tavern on Rush twice in one week, my first and second visit! I was so impressed by the Lobster Cobb salad (a 10!) and the House Made Chips (the best chips I have had in my entire life) that I was anxious to return. The second time, I ordered the chips, split the Lobster Cobb Salad, split a fabulous lemon something bisque a crab meat that was absolutely fantabulous and split the Blackened Halibut w the most succulent Orange, Lemon Butter sauce (?). OH EM GEE!  I was in flavor heaven! Layers of flavor! The meal and experience from the moment I walked in the door, (server and hostesses) everything was perfect. I am convinced that there is nothing at this restaurant that isn't a culinary delight!

Great location on Rush st , overlooks the famous rush street we were seated in the dining area in the second floor , the lounge was at the bottom floor , my friend and I who happened to have been familiar with the restaurant since it's early years some 17 years back was here on their anniversary, I didn't take a full look at the menu as we just stopped by for dessert but we will update this review , plus our server in the top floor was nice

Sad to say that after years of going to eat the most delicious, tender and well seasoned steaks we won't be going back.  Recently dined in and while the service was great, our meal was less than perfect. The steaks were poorly cooked, had no flavor and slathered in oil and onions and garlic.  For two people - at lunch, including 2 steaks, a coke, a water and a cup of soup, our total was $150 plus tip. Not impressed.
Overall a great dining experience.  Great muscles, shrimp.  My wife loves their steak, they have a great atmosphere with terrific service. We eat there regularly.
Had a nice Saturday night dinner. The steaks and crab legs are fantastic. I suggest a reservation as the place is packed.

Food was great. Hip atmosphere. The bussers/server assistants were great. And they deserved our tip, as our server had a dry personality and never cracked a smile once. She seemed bored and annoyed that she had to be at work that day. She was also training someone else. Our server did nothing but take our order and then right before bringing our check, she asked if there was anything else we wanted.
Taver on Rush did not disappoint. Our service was excellent and our food was prepared perfectly. We will be back.

Impeccable service.   From start to finish our waiter's (Dennis) timing of the beverage and food was such that we were not rushed through the meal. He made sure we had ample time between the courses.  The martinis were great.  The filet mignon was perfect and the seafood pasta was very good. It is also a plus that many main dishes are offered in appetizer portions.  A wonderful dining experience.

Very lively and fun place.  Great drinks/bar, food even better.  Staff prompt and friendly, even on a packed weekend evening,  Excellent location with a relaxed atmosphere.  Experience at Tavern even made an already good night, great.
Love to go to this place to hang out! I wouldn't recommend for dinner, but definitely drinks and some appetizers/snacks. Their pineapple vodka on the rocks is great!

The past few times I went to Tavern on Rush was for drinks before grabbing dinner somewhere else. I love the atmosphere of the place and the bar area. However, this last time we were there the waitress was rude and took a long time to serve us. Once she finally came over we were able to order some drinks. We were waiting for a dinner reservation so didn't want to order any appetizers, but asked for a bread basket. They had this bruchetta like bread in it that was AMAZING! I was surprised to see that they did not charge us for this since we didn't order any other food.  While on my past trip we also went to their Sunday Brunch. My brother had raved about their menu and it did not disappoint! I started off with a mimosa (which I was surprised to not see on a menu at all). We then ordered the homemade chips and French onion dip. Not your typical brunch food, but so good!! I had been eyeing the crab cakes benedict on the menu since I looked it up online and was looking forward to eating it. Every bite of it was amazing. I had a hard time eating everything and left full, but it was the perfect way to end a weekend in Chicago. I am happy to say the service was better at brunch.

Tavern on Rush is such a great spot. It is perfectly situated in the city, has great food, great service and a great atmosphere. Ive been here twice and loved my food both times. I ordered the turkey burger recently and it was not disappointing at all. Very juicy and flavorful. My dad ordered the pizza and it was equally as amazing. I was especially impressed with my side salad. Side salads are hit or miss. Sometimes they have flavor and other times they are watered down and tasteless. In this case, the balsamic dressing was a 5/5 and the salad itself had leaves other than stalk. I was pleasantly surprised for sure. Another interesting thing about Tavern is that they give away a free pair of Louboutin's weekly. They showcase the heels and then draw a winner. How cool is that?

This was our first time here and there very accommodating when I had to change my reservation time. It was a Saturday night so it was very busy but it was a good sat night dinner/drinks atmosphere. We got drinks at the bar and We only had to wait a few min for our table. The food was really good and the wait staff was very attentive, the only thing that happened was they forgot to refill the bread when one of our friends asked but it's ok :-)
Thanks for the food poisoning  we got really sick after having this Hawaiian tuna. We will never go back...

What an awful experience we had today. We had booked an 11:15 reservation and all seemed to be going well. We had a party of 6 plus an infant  and were seated and taken care of by wonderful waitstaff. We ate and drank our entire time there, which ended up being around 4 hours. No one said anything to us about a time limit or needing the table for another party. Instead we had to hear the manager talking to another party of 2 about how "unfortunate it was" that our party was still at the table. Once again, no one addressed us or asked us to wrap it up. The party of 2 then proceeded to give us death glares for the remainder of the time that it took us to finish our drinks and get our bill. When I approached the manager later, who I hadn't seen approach this couple, but others at my party attested that he was the one, and expressed my dissatisfaction he simply offered my friends and I a "Monday Ladies Night", after pretending he knew nothing  about the situation( although he was the one to initiate it) As my party started to leave the building, which we were also asked about if we were locals(which we are), the others attested that he was indeed the manager that spoke to the couple and proceeded to throw his waitstaff under the table instead of taking ownership.

I've wanted to try Tavern for a while. They had an extensive wine and beer selection, which for me added an additional star. My only issue is the fact that the food was far too salty! I was happy with the portion size of my cavatappi, but it was improperly seasoned. Not sure if I'll return.
I came by for dinner with a few girlfriends while visiting Chicago and was impressed by how busy this place gets. It's very loud, which isn't a bad thing for me. The food and drinks were tasty.

Great breakfast and excellent service! We ate here because the Pancake House next door had a long wait. We were glad that we decided to eat here instead. I had a salmon benedict here with coffee, and it was delicious. The outdoor seating is great when the weather is nice.  The restaurant is located on a busy street, and it's a perfect way to spend a day having a meal while watching the people. The staff is friendly and quick. The music isn't overpowering, so it's easy to have a conversation.

I've been to Tavern several times and have always loved the food and service. They went above and beyond this time. I made a very large reservation for New Years Eve. Not only did they not charge a NYE "cover fee", they accommodated 18 people for dinner without blinking an eye. The food was great as usually but I will say the lobster bisque tasted a bit "tomatoey" and the lobster was nonexistent this time. I have had it before and didn't have this experience- maybe it was an off night.  Kudos on the service and creating a fun NYE for us!

Out for the family's annual NYE lunch.  Decided to go to Tavern on Rush instead of Joe's to try something new.  Maybe not the best choice.  What is usually an awesome meal was disappointing.  The angus burger and rib eye sandwich that my sons had was excellent.  Everything else was really bland.  I know when I have come here in the past I have enjoyed it.  The calamari needed salt.  The lobster bisque was watery and bland. My son ordered a ceased salad that never came. The dressing on our split Caesar salad  that was not split, tasted like there was no dressing.  It was all on the bottom of the plate and bland.  We ordered the bone in rib eye with the Cajun seasoning.  Steak was cooked perfectly but with out the seasoning.  They did take it back to season and seer it, but then it was over cooked.   Disappointing.
Most amazing lump crab cake.. The tomato bisque is also delicious and the service is superb. Very attentive and a lovely Christmas environment, especially on the upstairs floor.

We are from Seattle and 3 couples celebrated our friends 50th birthday in Chicago.  We decided to have the birthday dinner at Tavern on Rush.  I had visited this restaurant on a trip in the Spring and the outdoor patio is the best I have found in Chicago.  Planters full of gorgeous planters separate the tables for privacy, yet still so great to be where all the action is.  We could have sat out there for hours.  The food and drinks and service were all amazing!  Once again on my second visit I was not disappointed and the birthday boy had a fantastic time.  Drinks were fresh and fun, wine list was fantastic.  Steaks were phenomenal, the sword fish was quite nice too.   Service was excellent, they even brought out a dessert sampler dressed up with a personalized Happy Birthday message and candles.  Such special evening, couldn't have asked for a better birthday dinner.  Location is great too!  Don't miss this place if you are in Chicago, you will not be disappointed!!  Make sure you book a reservation in advance :-)

This is still a terrible option among so many great ones nearby. The one bright spot was our waitress. She was funny and sweet and definitely deserves a better venue for her skills. My salad was fine, honestly. I thought it was stupid to charge $7 for shrimp but they definitely added lots of shrimp, so that's cool.  So many little things make this place just so not worth it. My cup of coffee had a hair in it. WTF? I am not sure it was removed from my dad's check. This is unacceptable.  The food is just fine but it's at prices that are honestly obnoxious. Hugo's charges similar prices, but their food is actually quality stuff and goes beyond merely pedestrian. There are two bathrooms on the top floor, and to access any more, you basically go through a maze and down steep stairs into the basement, where you're greeted by a bathroom attendant. It's a place that thinks it's that ~*~nice to need one. Give me a break.

We had a reservation for 8pm.  We got there around 7:15 to have a drink at the bar.  We told the hostess we were there and we would come back close to our reservation time.  We went back to her around 7:50.  She said they were running behind schedule and will call us when the table is ready.  We went back to the bar and waited another 45 min.  At this point we asked to speak to a manager who basically yessed us to death and didn't give us any solution.  Told us to sit and he'd tell us when the table was ready.  As we sat there we noticed empty tables with a "reserved" sign on them.  When we asked why we couldn't sit there he said there was a reservation for 9pm. Really??? We had a reservation for 8pm and there was no table reserved for us!!! We immediately left and went to eat a Gibson's steakhouse across the street.  We sat at the bar an had an amazing meal!! Best steak I ever had!!!!  Sorry for the negative review but the customer service there was horrible!!

Very disappointing. My GF mom categorized this meal as the worst she's had in Chicago (she's visiting from Belgium). The service was not good.  My dish had old-soft salad served next to it.  My GF asked for medium cooked filet mignon.. When it was served it was dry and extremely overcooked.  We asked for bread, they forgot. Brought it after reminding them twice.  My caprese chicken was tough and overcooked as well (didn't feel fresh). My GF said the kitchen looked dirty and the floor as well. For all these reasons ..This place is one I won't visit again.

This place is nice to seat and watch the people on a good weather day. Food is good, we had angus burger and chopped salad and 3 drinks. Bill came to be about $80.00. Will be back on the next sunny day in Chicago

Cool vibe it's been a long long time since I've been to this place and I'm talking about years ago it's nice to come back and see the same old faces working they're same ol  smiles and badass drinks.  The Louboutin shoes on the display in the middle of the bar is pretty nice touch even though it cost me $600 a pair of Louboutin shoes bet with my girl!!!  Its ok tho. Well worth ed

Great spot for both drinks and people watching. I've been here a few times with my girls and service was always good. If you're looking to have a conversation avoid monday nights because it's super busy/ loud here then for their shoe raffle.

Reliable drinks with pretty decent unhired entertainment. Ordered: Southside, Strawberry Blonde, pepperoni/anna bella pizza,  CLIENTELE:  My favorite part was the unhired entertainment. A really drunk white dude singing songs loudly and walking around trying desperately to hug every woman in the place. A pair of two young, smartly dressed women who were in command of a harem of men competing desperately for their attention. A young working gal in a green sparkly dress who was trying to seal the deal with a John, any john. Excellent crowd. 5/5.  DRINKS: Drinks were okay, not super strong, but they get the job done. The strawberry blonde was very smoothie-like in texture, which was a bit off-putting. That's due to the strawberry puree. But they made up for it with the Southside. The Southside was nice and boozy.  FOOD: The Pizza was very good. Very hot, and very cheesy. I went on both Sunday and Monday, and the pizza was certainly hotter the second time around because the trip from the oven to the table was shorter.  SERVICE: Very friendly service both upstairs and downstairs. The woman upstairs was super funny and very open. The ladies downstairs were beautiful and helpful.  ATMOSPHERE DOWNSTAIRS: Dressy, but certainly not formal. I was wearing a cream catsuit and knee high boots and didn't feel out of place at all. I would have felt out of place in gym shoes and a tshirt.  ATMOSPHERE UPSTAIRS: Much more restaurant style-- think bread and butter on white table cloths.

Live in the neighborhood, stopped for lunch. Crab,pesto pizza. I could only eat 3 small pieces, the whole thing was burnt !! Couldn't believe the server brought it to me! I was so hungry. When we left two other tables had it and it looked great. I don't know if they don't train their lunch staff! Uneatable!!! Go next door to Luxe! Better trained staff. My daughter had soup and pasta and loved her food. Lucky her.

Had reservation but we were late they didnt honor our reservation anymore but the host did bring the manager to speak to us, weas able to seat us outside... Waitress came to take our order but either she was busy, having a bad day or too tried...wasnt really professional! Ordered King crab, very very good! tuna were great as well oyster were super small in size, not too fresh.... the veiggie side dish was overly cooked! there other side dishes we order were so-so

Great atmosphere and great food. I came here on a busy Sunday and had the option of waiting 15min for a table outside or immediate seating inside. The waiters and waitresses were all very friendly and continuously asked us if the food was good and if we needed anything. The menu itself is large, only thing I wish there was more variety of was the appetizers. Most of the appetizers were seafood related, and I, personally, am not the biggest fan of seafood and would have appreciated a little more variety. Since the appetizers were so limited, we had the humus, the pita bread is great! And that's saying a lot because I'm picky with my humus and pita bread. My brother ordered the chicken breast which came with a garden salad and throughly enjoyed it. I ordered the rigatoni pasta alongside the chipotle Mac and cheese. Clearly I'm a pasta lover and it's my goal to try every single Mac and cheese option out there! The rigatoni was the bomb! I ordered the smaller portion and still couldn't finish it all. The chipotle Mac and cheese... Mediocre to be honest. Not worth the price tag just because I've had much better for the exact price elsewhere. But would recommend the rigatoni pasta! All in all, great service, great food and a great atmosphere.

Walked In, sat at a table in the somewhat empty bar. Sat there with my husband on our 20th anniversary for over 10 minutes. No one approached us with menus or a drink order. Then this beautiful blond bombshell, in a very tight dress, walked to the table in front of us that came in long after us. Two guys waiting for three more. She totally ignored us. Finally we asked the busboy for service. She comes over and says they are down a girl. EXCUSE ME!!!!  Were we invisible? Never had a drink. Never had a bite of food. Got up and left. Try Dublins across the street. It's not fancy. But the service and food are awesome. Happy anniversary honey.

This place was a joke. As my friends and I followed the hostess to the table, I tripped over a water pitcher that was on the floor that the hostess clearly saw and walked around but did not bother to pick it up, tell me to watch my step, or apologize. We were the only ones on the floor dining for lunch but somehow it took forever for the waitress to take our order and come out with the food. My friend found a fiber from a sponge in her salmon burger so she sent it back for a new one. 20 minutes later she received her new meal. And the waitress challenged her on an add to the bill. Top notch service I tell ya! Wish I could give this place 0 stars...

Consistently good and awesome outside space in the spring / summer.  Always a tall gorgeous server at the place.  It's on what the call the "Viagra Triangle."  You can figure out why. The best here are the tacos and fries.  Good bar food and a great place to meet after work.

Long wait. The hostess's outside were horrible. They were more interested in looking at people walking by then attending to waiting patrons.  I took two friends there and our waiter was new and wasnt the best but he did ok.  The food was ok. Nothing great here as far as Ive seen on the menu.  The resturant cant manage the crowd in front of the building- its definitely a fire hazard. You get a hole in the wall vibe because of how congested the sidewalk gets while you wait an hour and half for average service. I recommend going somewhere else- in my opinion this place is worth avoiding.

Infamous for old dudes and young girls. I stopped here with my wife and two kids, and the demographic looked like something I'd see in Vegas. Though I do love seeing 50's baby boomers wining and dining 90's millenials.  Nonetheless, the service I witnessed here was quite poor. Sat down, and perhaps because we were out of their standard customer makeup, we were served accordingly. Long, long waits, followed by a very raw chewy calamari appetizer and mediocre burger.  I am hoping my experience here was an outlier, but definitely not impressed with the overall value and food here.

I understand it is hot ouside and and air conditioners are running over time but you don't sit a group on 7 under a dirty dripping condensating vent and then just say "oh yeah it's just a little water". Are you kidding!! This place is way to expensive to not get better service!! Unbelievable I will never come back....food is okay but don't come to this place for the service!.... Just notified the manager and he didn't care either. WOW!! So many other good places to eat!

Food - Great!  Time to go - Mondays for Ladies night!  What to expect- A busy semi pretentious crowd full of good looking people.  Quite a few gold diggers and eager men to indulge them. Come for the food and  drinks but go with a group of friends. Meeting people there is a gamble.

Came here straight from the airport!  We came here for lunch before heading out for the Architecture tour as it was our first time in Chicago.  The server was pretty quick and presentable.  John Fox from the Bears showed up behind us which was pretty cool.  We got calamari and a few other apps which were all on point.  For lunch I ended up getting a grilled chicken sandwich with bacon, avacado and some sort of spicy mayo on it which was delicious!  The dinner menu looked a little pricey but the lunch menu was just the right price for the quality.

Pretty dope spot in Chicago. As soon as we got seated John Fox of the Bears walked in. Really solid menu, especially the sandwich/burger section. There is one burger that has 3 different types of meat. I added a fried egg to it, and it was absolutely delicious. Server was very personable, food came out fast. One of the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had. Can't go wrong with this place. Outdoor seating is fantastic, but kind of hard to get around lunch time.

This place is all about the patio (that is- if you can get a spot, more on that later). to see and be seen is definitely what this place is all about.  The food is pretty decent. I believe the best meal they serve here is brunch. It's relatively affordable and pretty tasty. The crab cake Benedict was great! The burger is also very solid.  Tavern loses stars for me on the service. The outside hostesses seem downright confused with how the whole thing works. Once, I was told to wait inside and then learned they just "lost" my reservation. Another time I was first in line for a patio table and almost left before I grabbed another hostess and asked if we could be seated (and we were). The waitstaff isn't too attentive, either.
I love this place. It's very cool restaurant. The waitress are nice and good looking girls. And I think it's only place that serve grill calamari.

Really great experience here all around. We had made a reservation that got lost in the mix and they made a point to take great care of us in the meantime. They seated us in their VIP area and provided a complementary round of drinks as we waited. Once our table was ready the staff was incredibly attentive and the food was great. We had a seafood tower, tuna tar tar, and each enjoyed an entree.  Really awesome service, delicious food, great location especially in the warm weather with patio seating, and fun cocktails. Check it out!

Service was great!! 5/5 Went here with a girlfriend because I wanted to check out the "viagra triangle" and I'm so glad I did. I know they make it seem like this is where older men go to meet younger women but honestly that's what you get in most upscale establishments anyway.  This part of Chicago felt very similar to Beverly Hills Ca. It is great for people watching and the mud pie was amaze-balls! 5/5 With desert we enjoyed Baileys and milk, kind of hard to screw that one up. 5/5.  At the bar we had ordered a cocktail which was suppose to have fresh raspberries in it, but it tasted more like a syrup, very processed and high in sugar.  1/5.  I will definitely be back for dinner next time I'm in Chicago, wish I had discovered this area sooner.

Food is incredible!! Seafood tower and filet mignon Oscar (the one with the crab meat on top) r to die for!! Plan on an expensive night....but u won't regret it!! All of their deserts are perfect. I think i had something with a brownie last time, cheesecake the time before. I like the upstairs for dining. They have cute window seats overlooking rush street. Servers are very knowledgeable, professional, and personable. This place never disappoints and food is always consistent. Always MAKE A RESERVATION FIRST, just in case. This place gets packed quick, especially on the weekends and around the holidays.

Absolutely love Tavern on Rush! I had a burger. I cannot remember the name of it now but... It was a bison burger with cabaret caramelized onions, goat cheese, arugula and maybe a cherry bacon jam...?? It was A M A Z I N G !! It comes with French fries, chips or cole slaw. I had the fries of course.  Service is great and prompt. I sat in a window at a high top table with my mom looking out into the sidewalk. I live anyplace with huge open windows to let in some fresh air.  This street corner on Rush is my favorite little nook in the city.  P.S. They serve glass bottle sodas!!

If it werent for the fact that I have been here numerous times before, with decent to good service, I wouldve rated TOR one star. The key to good service is consistency and my experience here last night was terrible. I brought my cousins who were visiting.. I thought it would be a good kickoff to our evening.. I was wrong. It was fairly busy but I was still surprised when it took 20 minutes for our server, Molly to return with our drinks. We then placed our entree orders. My cousin ordered skirt steak, I ordered a ribeye sandwich with no chipotle mayo and a side of au gratin potatoes, my other cousin ordered the ribeye sandwich and a side salad. After 20 or so minutes, Molly comes and serves our order. Immediately, I removed the bun and its just slathered with mayo. We check Kim's to make sure they didnt get mixed up, but sure enough, mayo there too. We wait for Molly, finally she appears and I inform her of the issue. No empathy, no apology, she just whisks the plate away with a promise to return with a corrected version. Less than 10 minutes later, she appears with a new sandwich. This one didnt have any mayo on it.. but it also didnt have the carmelized onions, had literally four shreds of fontina cheese on it that werent melted and the bread wasnt even warm, much less toasted or grilled..  I called Molly over and expressed my dissatifaction. Still. No apology , no acknowledgement that my party is almost done eating while I havent begun. She asked if I wanted her to take it back, I told her to just go and bring me some fontina. When she came back, I realized that the sandwich was so cold, the cheese wouldnt even melt. Molly never even came back to check on our table. The next interaction was a busser who came to clear our table. He asked if I wanted a box for the uneaten terrible sandwich, I said no. After the food was cleared, Molly K came with check.She is clearly not cut out for customer service. Yes, its the kitchens fault that the food was poorly prepared but its the servers responsibility to insure that the customer is happy.

While crowded during a naturally busy Friday night, Tavern on Rush did not fail to impress. While it took us awhile to find a table by the bar, we were quickly seated by an incredibly helpful bus boy and our server was equally excellent. Our drinks and food came incredibly fast, especially with how busy it was. I cannot recommend the angus burger enough. The prime beef burger that my girlfriend had was also great. Even the pickle was great! Excited to come back in a couple of nights to have more delicious food.

Looking for a new place to try so when we walked past and noticed they had outdoor seating we gave it a try. The hostess seated us and we had to wait a while before we were offered water. Mind you it was 96 degrees outside. After we asked the hostess she got our waitress. We ordered our food and it seemed to come out in a decent amount of time. We ordered the calamari which was good and we ordered the lobster salad. The size was very small considering there were 5 small pieces of lobster on the salad. (See picture) and the salad itself was small. The ranch dressing was warm which scared me considering it was a 96 degree day. I noticed several odd pieces of lettuce in my salad (see picture) and when I mentioned to waitress her reply was "it's organic".
I've eaten at most of the restaurants on Rush St and this has been my fav. Steaks are amazing and service is great. Fun atmosphere so you'll most likely have a great time.

I have mixed feelings on this one! The food and service was great (got the Azteca salad & a sausage pizza) but the music was ridiculously loud and it was so crowded in the bar area that it was a trek just getting to the restroom. Don't get me wrong, I love good music & crowds on a weekend but it was a bit too much for a Wed night dinner. Will definitely be back on a Fri or Sat night!

One of our favorite restaurants to eat at when in the city! Make sure to get reservations early as it is a must.  The filet was out of this world and would definitely recommend.   Service was wonderful as always. Nice bar downstairs.   After dinner, the area is a great location to walk around and feel safe.
Best restaurant in the city! Amazing food and you can't beat the location . Never had a bad experience 5/5

3 stars is the average of 1 star for todays experience, but usually 5 stars since its our go to place for moscow mules in the city.   today we went and the mules were off.  all 3 of us got 2 rounds of mules and all 6 drinks tasted different.  out of the 6 mules, there was 1 that tasted right with the right amount of alcohol, the rest were pretty weak for a $15 mule.

Great food, known for their steaks. My filet was awesome. And what make this place so special is the excellent service. Jerry is the best. Very personable, friendly, and knowledgeable. Don't miss this restaurant or Jerry in Chicago!

I have been here a number of times and I'm never disappointed. My favorite dish is the filet oscar. The steak is always juicy and cooked to perfection. The crab meat is fresh and the hollandaise sauce is amazingly creamy. Their side dishes are great to share and even their salads are spectacular. Great wine list and oysters too!
Wonderful service and food! Great people and atmosphere is pleasant! I would love to come back!

Want to thank Tavern on Rush for their GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE last night. For taking great care of my special request. Especially to the concierge who spoke with me many times over the phone & the manager (Marty ?) for your patience and attention to detail! Most of all thank you for helping my girl and all her friends have a great night, all night at Tavern as they always do !

This place is amazing. Perfect for people watching if you sit outside. Dress to be seen, y'all! The bar and bar area is fabulous and packed. You can eat a full meal at bar if you choose. Onto the food and service, impeccable! I had the salmon with the mash and veggies. I always order mine well done, yeah, I don't like pink food, ever. They didn't disappoint. Flavored so well. It's expensive, but worth it.
The steak is amazing, and I love the ambience of the restaurant! Definitely one of my favorites, I would highly recommend trying the oysters as well (eastern)!

The food was tasty---the homemade chips were delicious. Howevet, the service could be a lot better.  When the waitress approached or table, she asked the 3 of us if we wanted anything to drink. I gave her my drink order, my friend gave the waitress hers, but she completely ignored my other friend. We never received a bread basket and she seldom came to check on us.  To make matters worse, she took it upon herself to assume that the $46 in the check folder which was accompanied by 2 debit cards, was her tip.

My sister and I had a wonderful lunch here in April. You can eat inside or out, we chose inside. The atmosphere is great & the music is not loud do we were able to catch up. We each had salads with chicken, the spinach & garden & both were delicious. Also the wine was tasty. Lindsay was our waitress. She was very friendly. Our table gave us a great view of Rush.

Tavern on Rush, 5 stars This is about their valet service CAPITAL PARKING. Horrible!! We frequent this area often, no problems with Hugo's valet or Gibson's. My son parked here last week, picked up car about 10pm, when valet driver pulled up with car, he quickly jumped out and went over to stand. Odd, they usually hold the door open and thank you, my son walked over to him to tip him. The drivers bizarre behavior made my son feel something was off. When pulling into our driveway, he got out and examined his car. Front driver side bumper SCRATCHED. I called Capital Parking, it was late, no answer. I called the next morning, only to get totally brushed off!! I was told that customers should inspect cars before leaving, really!!!! I've never seen anyone walk around the car to do that. I guess it's too much to expect YOUR employees to be honest enough to say something. Totally disgusted with your lack of honest and customer service!!!!! Don't trust them with your car.

Will never come back here again. I just left 10 min. ago. The hostess was so rude and ignorant. I walked up and the hostess completely ignored me and my boyfriend. We thought she was just so busy in conversation with a woman and a younger gal so we were patiently waiting for her to finish her conversation which had nothing to do with her job. Someone else walked up and she stopped her conversation instantly, acknowledged the man and seated the man for four.  I will NEVER visit this place again. I have a feeling it was a race issue and I am completely against that.  I am currently at a neighboring restaurant so no loss here. I'm sure Tavern doesn't care since they are always busy anyway but it's just a sad thing.

Yesterday amazing lunch and service...today service was horrible don't  know about  the food because we  did not stay...ughhhhh...sitting  at Hugo Frogs within seconds on the patio and within a minite we have a waiter and water....much better choice
Had the steak burger and it was the best hamburger I have ever eaten. Staff was friendly and helpful with the menu.

After an hour and a half wait in a loud and very crowed bar we were placed at the worst table in the house. After asking if we could have a different table the condescending woman told us we could wait another 40 mins for another table. Rude rude rude. So we sat crammed by the kitchen door. Our waiter was very nice and did try his best but our food was terrible. My chicken caprese was oily and disgusting. Never again. I can't say anything good about this place go anywhere else.

Chicagoans and tourists alike-beware. DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT. It dirty, full of 60 year old some drunk women, loud, and the food is mediocre at best. The staff is rude and extremely unfriendly. Tables are cramped and you have no room to move. Disgusting place unless you are a trashy elderly woman wearing a bodycon dress when you know you shouldn't. If that describes you then enjoy!!!

What a lovely place to enjoy a relaxing afternoon lunch on the patio. Great service, excellent food!  We had reservations and my guess is that's probably a good idea. They have valet parking, too. I had the wedge salad that is probably an entire head of lettuce. Bring your appetite or share with a friend! My friend ate a wild greens salad with added filet mignon that she said was cooked to perfection.  We also shared the roasted corn side dish that was fantastic!! I look forward to coming back and trying more from their menu!
Amazing bloody mary.  The food was pretty decent too.  Nice ambiance.  A good place to have  brunch.

Please ignore my initial review in favor of this one. About one year ago, I went to Tavern on Rush for dinner and had awful food poisoning from a turkey burger. This shouldn't happen at a nice restaurant. Again, this happened last May, and I thought it necessary to post an update.

My fiancé and I waited over 20 minutes before we walked out - it was a beautiful Sunday morning and we wanted to sit outside to eat breakfast.  We were seated and no one even looked at us to take our order. I asked the bus buy twice if a waiter could take my order and he said, "the waiter will be there soon."  Such garbage service and no sense of urgency to deliver great customer service, especially when you charge $20 for breakfast.  Will NEVER go back.

I went to Tavern on Rush with 8 guys planning on spending around $500 on food and drinks. We spent more than that the day prior. We put 3 tables together in the bar area and the manager "Jen" came over and told us we couldn't put the tables together. She then began to berate us and said "you can't just come into a restaurant and move tables." The service and attitude here is horrible and clearly a reflection of the management. With the restaurant show in Chicago going on and so many restaurateurs in town checking out the great places - I'm shocked at how the attitude of this place was "we really don't need your money." We did go to the bar next store. If there was ever a manger who needs to learn the word hospitality, it was this one.

This would not be a Chicago recommendation for me to you.  The food is decent, but nothing great.  I'm not sure what is going on with the staff, unfortunately they all look sad or angry.  I wish I could have brought my wait staff a brew to help their night go by a bit better.  If anything, sit on the porch and watch people.  It's the best.

Gem of a restaurant in the heart of the Viagra Triangle. I ordered the corkscrew pasta in vodka sauce, and it was delicious. There was enough sauce for every bite, but not so much that the pasta was drowning in it. The appetizer portion was the perfect size. My husband ordered the bone-in filet, and it was juicy and flavorful. Loved it so much that he was tempted to suck the marrow out of the bone. The waitstaff is attentive without being overbearing, and our glasses stayed filled. Will definitely return!

Pretty awful service. My filet was overdone. My bottle of wine came after my steak...then sat on the table unopened while the server attended to other tables...then was finally opened with one bite of my steak left. What was worse is that there was no acknowledgement from our server that things were subpar, it's like this horrible of service is normal for them.

Spotted this place on our walk through the city and made a note of it as it looked like a nice spot. However, it was expensive and pretentious. We ate in the more casual dining area but the service was very slow, especially considering it wasn't that busy. The burgers were good, but it's not a place that I would go back to. The waitresses were all dressed in tiny, revealing black dresses and I just found it to be distasteful.

Absolutely unhappy with my visit, even though I was so looking forward to it. I was always so fascinated by the smells and the looks of the place! So last week I reserved a table. I appeared on time to find out that there was a plenty of free tables outdoors, and I was almost agitated - as I was with a stroller, and it's always easy to stay outside. Wee, not so fast. The outdoor staff sent us inside, where I discovered steps. Even to get to receptionist I had to climb. The receptionist, however, wasn't rushing to sit us. She was hanging on the phone for quite some time, while I was obstructing the path of all the waiters with my stroller. Finally, the receptionist noticed us - and sent us to the second floor. Seriously, such a breeze to climb again! Upstairs we were notified immediately that soon there would be a large party of people. I don't know how we could mess with that, but our waiters were more than willing to show us that our prolongated stay is so unwelcome. They were serving us really fast, but oh boy, how quickly they started taking our leftovers from us! They didn't even ask if we were still working on our appetizers. I clang to my salad to finish it - and still they managed to take my knife from me! The food itself was not so good. The calamari is great, but the burgers are plain and not delicious. My salad was served in a tiny plate, so I had to be super careful not to mess with it. Overall, I was expecting much more from this place. I think we won't be back here.

Unfortunately, the outdoor staff is incredibly rude. I understand that it's a popular outdoor spot and that lines can be long but there are plenty of other great spots in the city to enjoy a nice day. Also, pet owners take note, NO DOGS ALLOWED! Truly a shame for this area of the city.

I know that the food is awesome but I really like the bar at Tavern on Rush. I can't wait to go there again and have my delicious pear martini. I like the atmosphere and the fact that you don't have to wait to be seated at the bar!
