I can't believe I haven't written a review for this spot yet! I went here again with a friend this pass weekend. The weather was beautiful and we opted to eat outdoors. I got the Cajun Chicken sandwich and I thought it was delicious, so were the fries it came with. The fries were perfectly seasoned and they give you a decent size portion for the price. Great place to come to people watch as well! Right in the heart of the "triangle" :)

Amazing. It's great that the kitchen is open late. Great music late nights on Fridays and Saturdays. The calamari is so fresh. The steaks are perfectly cooked. Like they understand the meaning of medium. Service was courteous and fast. Recommend a seat outdoors in the spring. Great for people watching.

This is hardly just a "tavern."  This is one of a handful of classic restaurants on Rush Street.  Tavern is an upscale, contemporary steakhouse with an extensive menu of prime steaks, chops, & seafood.  From their decadent bread basket to their delectable desserts, Tavern provides top quality meats, fish and produce excellently prepared.  Everything is marvelous.  Awesome martinis, excellent oysters, splendid fried calamari and delicious salads are all the prequel to our mains of an 8 oz. Filet Mignon, Pork Chop, Halibut and Ahi Tuna.  Tavern is the place to go for an elegant, delightful dinner.
The HH drink/food menu for ladies night was a good deal! Also on ladies night they raffle off shoes!! Only down fall is the place gets packed and older gentlemen that think they are hot.
This review is based on a quick stop at the bar - crowded and lively.  You can get better drinks but you can't pay more - $16 for a Manhattan (using Bulliet and was sickeningly sweet).

Amazing!!!! Everything from the service to the food and the portions.  It's a great location on a great street, valet parking is $17 which is good price for downtown.  Service is always great place is always clean the food comes out quick and the atmosphere is always on point.

I went to Tavern on Rush with my family today for Easter Brunch. Making a reservation was super easy through OpenTable since they still had plenty of time slots open about a week ago. I chose Tavern on Rush because I'm not into big Easter brunch buffets that are like $50/per person and just wanted to go somewhere with an awesome regular brunch menu.  When we got there, the patio was poppin'. The weather was grrrrrrrreat today! We checked in with the hostess and were seated immediately. Our server was mostly attentive until it was time for the bill. It took a little while for him to bring the bill to the table, but I think he had a bunch of tables that were sat at the same time that he was trying to take care of so it was no biggie at all. Really, he was excellent.  My parents and I all ordered pretty simple dishes - two eggs with meat and toast for my mom, an eggs benny for my dad, and a smoked salmon eggs benny for myself. All the portions were pretty hearty, and we ended up taking home a lot of food. For appetizers, we ordered fried calamari and oysters. The calamari was good, but I was not a fan of the oysters at all. I actually had to spit some of them out because I felt like I was getting parts of the shells in my mouth. It was not a good experience.  I think I would come back for brunch since our main dishes were good, but I would definitely stay away from the oysters next time around.
Rude manager! Awful place!  They kicked us out way to early before closing time.  Not coming back!!!!
Great way at to start a little pub crawl. The riblets were to die for. Seared tuna is a must. The wine selection was amazing also. What a great night.

Just got board an came out for a drink to enjoy the weather.  Had a double shot of Don Julio on the rocks with a splash of lime and a splash of water great setting to just sitting out watching people walk by

I was visiting Chicago last weekend and stayed at the Thompson Chicago. We looked for a brunch spot for Sunday and didn't want to travel too far from the hotel and settled on Tavern on Rush. I now wish we had just stayed at our hotel.  No wait for a seat at 11am on Sunday. The decor was typical tavern/pub style with dark wood, tall pub tables, and checkered tablecloths. The bar counter top looked at as though it could use a little sanding and refinishing. I was a little intrigued by the flashy Louboutins on rotating display in the center of the bar (hostess later explained this was for their ladies night).  We began by ordering a glazed donut that looked to be advertised from a local bakery. It was very doughy and tasted as though it had been prepared the day before. Not the fresh, light and airy glazed donut I was hoping for. The table next to us also ordered a donut, this one being chocolate, and they didn't eat more than 2 bites.  Next we ordered Bloody Mary's which were another disappointment. If you like your bloody mix to be very watery with no flavor or spices, then this is the bloody for you. If you, like me, enjoy a Bloody with texture and flavor, do not order from here. ZingZang makes an amazing Bloody mix and they would seriously improve theirs by switching mixes. I ordered the crab cake eggs Benedict and my friend order the regular eggs Benedict. Both were OK. No bad, but not good. The crab cake itself seemed tasty, but the Hollandaise sauce was everywhere so it was hard to get a good taste. It was all on top of the largest English muffin I've ever seen, which was weird because normally the crab cake takes the place of the eng muffin. The side potatoes needed salt and pepper badly.  All in all, I wouldn't ever go back nor ever recommend to someone in the area.

I went to Tavern on Rush with my girlfriend for a late lunch. We were seated promptly but the waiter took so long to get our bottle of wine. Once he pour the white wine, I asked him to keep it chilled which he never did. Then we proceeded to order our food. Under eggs and omelet, I order smoke salmon and egg dish thinking this is served separately. It was an omelet and tasted awful and salty. Who puts smoked salmon in an omelet??? Gross!!! So I sent it back and ordered their staple spinach salad with grilled steak. So the salad now cost $18 and what I got was unacceptable. For a joint known for their steaks brought out grizzly, diced, leftover meat that looked unappetizing. (SEE for yourself, PICTURE I posted as worst steak salad ever!!!) I was flabbergasted and asked the waiter, what this is and he had the audacity to lie to my face that this is how the establishment always serve their steak salad!!! It's not like this was my first time to this restaurant. I was incredibly disappointed by the food they served and incredibly offended that the waiter treated me like an idiot who never dined at this place before.   Seriously, if you don't want crappy steak salad, I suggest you head to Gibson, at least there, they have pride over what they serve.  If I can, I would give them a negative stars.
Jason and his team made this top tier Chicago staple the highlight of our trip. Food and service  are always super prime and never disappoints.
Great for people watching, several other restaurants in the area have as good if not better for fraction of the price, but the people watching is awesome

Just had an incredible dinner tonight and needed to write a review. Everyone went above and beyond from the minute we walked in. Our server Jason S. and his assistant made us feel like family and treated us like kings! First class is an understatement and I now know why this is a Chicago staple. Never been to a restaurant were everything was so delicious. You will not be disappointed and yes, great people watching. Kudos!!!

Celebrated an early Valentines Day. 5:00 reservation was ready when we arrived. Sat upstairs next to the window.  Most of the window tables were occupied while the tables and booths away from the windows were vacant. No reservations were available so we assumed that they don't staff for a full restaurant until later. The maitre d couldn't have been more gratuitous to us as he was taking us to our table. The rose given to my gf was a nice touch. The window tables overlook the busy street scene below as a backdrop. Service was prompt and attentive without being overly intrusive. I, of course, ordered what they call a Kansas City strip. This is a bone-in NY strip. Not bad. A sharper knife would have helped but shame on me for not asking. My gf enjoyed her filet. Both were cooked as ordered. For sides we tried the Adobo roasted corn, mashed potatoes, fries, and asparagus. The waitress warned us that 4 sides might be too much for 2 people but we wanted to try them. The corn and mashed were the standouts. The fries could have been crispier and the asparagus was...well, just asparagus. So all in all a nice experience and the menu offered plenty of options. What we liked most was that the overall ambiance is very classy without the stuffy attitude.

TOR is a great place for people watching because of its reputation of connecting upper crust men with much younger attractive women. Experience it and you will better understand.  Aside from the entertainment, the food is quite good. Entrees are traditional steak or seafood options. Brunch is pretty wide ranging and features a selection gourmet donuts brought in from a popular establishment.  Specials  Monday night is Ladies night in the bar area and features drink specials, appetizer specials and half off bottle of wines. I also recall a pair of Louboutin's being raffled. It is Gold Coast after all. ... Funny but true story. Met some business acquaintances after work (all were men). As we left, the ladies night DJ said "Make a few friends, have a few drinks and make a few mistakes... It's only Monday"! Talk about hilarious. Only in Viagara triangle. Dining Room - Upstairs  Upstairs is very nice and a much quieter dining experience. I had dinner upstairs a few times and found it to be great for date night or brunch with friends. During warm weather, it has patio seating downstairs which usually has at least an hour wait if you are not a regular.  Scenery  Most diners tend to put their best foot forward when dining here. The hostesses are attractive women usually in form fitted clothing so they set the bar pretty high for other women.  Valet Parking available for $14. If you have a real fly ride, they will leave it out front.
Great hummus plate. I haven't been to Monday's Ladies Night but hear from my best friend that it's really fun!

It's a VERY fun spot. I love the concept of their " Ladies Night" every Monday night. You will receive 1 free raffle at the bar for a chance to win a fabulous pair of Louis Vuitton or Christian Louboutin shoes. They said  if the shoes don't fit you, you can bring them to the store for exchange/store credit, what? This is so awesome!  2nd place prize will get $250 Tavern On Rush and 3nd place will get a bottle of Dom Perignon Champagne.  The service last night was excellent. My Filet-mignon was the way I expected, nice and juicy. They have a big menu and the portions of the food there are "Huge" BEWARE, if you want to save room for dessert!  I believe all the servers are female and they all so gorgeous and very fun to look at. They made my dinner more enjoyable. love it! LOL

$24 for a jack and water!!! I know people go here to see and be seen and it is a cool place with very nice bartenders but that is insanity!!! It was after 9pm and lots of people were ordering pizza's at the bar.

The best thing about this place might just be the location, scratch that maybe its the gorgeous servers that work here, might just be the hottest in the city. One thing is for sure its not the cocktails. The old fashion here was prb one of the worst I have ever had, and the Manhattan followed suit, surprising for a place in this area. Didn't try the food, cuz we came from brunch. As people said, it's great for people watching, and you will prb enjoy the environment here because it is often packed. It relys strongly on its location (Viagra Triangle) and clientele (Rich Viagra Users) to keep its long reputation, but can you blame them? In the end if you take away the location, the beautiful girls and flash you got a place with little substance, maybe the "Rob Kardashian" of "Taverns".

A great place to people watch the older generation and have some fun chats. The cocktails are good , especially the Moscow mule is worth a try. Can get bit busy , especially around the bar as the evening goes on. I have always enjoyed a fun night here so worth a visit.

I live up the street from here and love that it is in the neighborhood. Walking by the outdoor patio in warmer months can be quite entertaining as it's tends to be over the top, fabulous people watching. Meeting friends here for drinks on a snowy winter evening is my favorite though, as they make amazing martinis and a wide variety of high end bar food, think wood fired pizzas and truffle fries. If you keep your eyes open you will eventually score a high-top table around the bar area. Ample TVs, wealthy people, and heavy pours make this a fun night out. Try the vodka infused pineapple, it will knock your stilettos off for sure.
I love this place, every time I visit Chicago I have to come in for the tomahawk! Great service and ambiance.

How can I possibly write something original that hasn't already been said about Tavern? Viagra triangle? Check. Gorgeous people and great people watching, check. Hectic, busy and bright, I always have fun here. Stellar and strong cocktails, great bar and seating area downstairs, plush dining room upstairs with floor to ceiling windows. Food always good, too. The chateaubriand and the sea bass are great choices and favorites.  A compliment or two from an older gentleman is always good for morale, too. Tavern has stuck around here forever and the reason is clear, because it's good. Every time I come here it's busy, loud, fun and just a good time. Stop by for a drink or dinner and you won't be disappointed!
Best people watching out in the city. Their tomato soup is to die for!! My husband loves their bone-in filet. Don't pass this place up.

In good restaurant in my options salad always shut by perfect and chef of kitchen must now how to connect all things together  and hear Tavern on Rush is one of the best if we talk about salad. Short shoot a+++ what a combinations of Teast !! Thank you !! I visit many times this place and very time I was happy of what I choice and eat . Place is huge and always super busy ! 2 floors , bars , patio in summer time . Stuff now what to do with you and your menu . Highly recommend this place in down town !!

This is one of my top three dinner spots for my family, they occasionally have ribs which are amazing! The steak is great, never fails to impress me. Evrything is great, upstairs is more layback and quiet, downstairs is full of pizzazz and social  gatherings. I like sitting on the terrace although it could be a bit tight and uncomfortable.

I ate here with my cousin and husband one evening in March '11 and will never forget it - it was the best piece of meat I've ever eaten! We dropped in after taking in the Art Institute as it wasn't far from the Hilton Suites where we were staying. My cousin is an old-hand Chicago visitor but this was our first trip from the UK, so we were really impressed with the decor, service and general ambience - very Chicago to us out of towners! It's a little spendy but so worth it - the meat really was cooked to perfection and melted in the mouth. The stuffed potatoes also were awesome and onion rings out of this world! Would definitely recommend it for a special occasion - we ate in the bar area, the dining room might be a bit more special though.
Nice spot to hang out.  The are was perfect.  The service, on the other hand- was horrible.  Took 1hr+ to get our pizza and never got our humus.  When we inquired, the waiter was argumentative.

This is a great place for a large group. We had a party of 16, and there was plenty of room and the service was timely! The menu is good, and you can't beat the location. Will definitely be back in the summer to sit on the patio (great people watching!)

I will admit, this is a review per my father, Dr. William Yates. "I've been going here for the past 10 years. As a Chicago native, they treat the tourists better than the locals, which i think is insane. Every great restaurant will always give preference to locals who will support your business through thick and thin. Overall, over the past years I've seen the food on a downward spiral as far as quality. Im happy another quality establishment such as Maple & Ash has opened up nearby to provide good food in the area. I would suggest to the owners of Tavern and Rush to treat their loyal following in a way the rewards their loyalty".

Very nice dinner with two colleagues, as we were from out of town. We ordered their Oysters on the Half Shell (they were delicious). Their steak presentation was impressive but I ended up ordering one of their specials, the pork chop. We also ordered some wonderful sides including a wonderful Mac and Cheese, and a fantastic Fire Roasted Brussel Sprouts. Along with the cocktails and fine wine, it was the perfect end to a busy work day. The food was excellent, GREAT DINNER and service. I'll be back!
Went here for brunch...food was good. Had the filet Benedict..very good! My wife had the French toast..she loved it. Our service was poor..hence the 3 star.
Its a class steakhouse, in my opinion, close to the Smith and Wollensky style.  Great menu with lots of choices.  Able to easily accommodate someone gluten free! Service was very attentive.
AMAZING breakfast! The absolute best cinnamon French toast I have ever had! The filet eggs benedict is to die for! GO HERE!

Tavern is spectacular. The food is top notch. Highly recommend the sliders (Angus or filet, I prefer the Angus). The fries are great and the atmosphere is phenomenal for summer or winter alike. Any brunch/dinner item is great.  Bloody Mary's are decent but not the best in the city. If you want those: go to River Roast.  Ladies night gives away Lou Vitton shoes.

I've only been here once when a friend was in town for a conference.  We were seated right away, and the hostess and waitress we had were very nice. Just be prepared because the prices here are sky high.  We came here for an early/light dinner, so we just stuck to the appetizers, but even the prices for those were pretty high. We had some drinks which were very good, but the food was really mediocre, especially given the prices.  Also, I wasn't crazy about the decor of the restaurant inside. I know other friends that have been here, and they are not too high on the food.

Had a very good dinner here with a friend.  However, all of the tables were table tops and were crammed together.  We were getting bumped all throughout our meal, which was a continuous distraction.  Excellent food and service, but the seating situation isn't for me.

Ambiance in the best Chicago style. Too bad the food isn't. Thanksgiving dinner special, Cold Turkey dinner, uncooked veggies, stale bread, no butter, bad service all for just $56 !!! I'm quitting cold turkey!

This place is enjoyable, not so much for the food, although I enjoyed my burger, but mostly for the crowd in the heart of Gold Coast/Viagra Triangle. You'll see folks dressed up, having a good time. Brunch is nice here, too.

Tthhhiiss place.  Okay so on a Friday night this place is jam packed!  Like seriously. No room really anywhere,  not sure if much dancing happens at this place but there basically wasn't any room for that.  So it appeared that most people here were crowding around the bar in giant groups and talking (the music is pretty loud though so maybe sit outside if you are here for dinner)  It was also a lot more sophisticated than I expected. The avg age was probably about 40, and it was mostly business attire (I may have been under dressed)  Firstly our waitress was terrific (it's the type of place where I suspect it is extremely rare to get bad service)  They have a pretty good selection of drinks,  and quite a selection of expensive liquors and cocktails (which is to be expected).  In the bar aspect I'd imagine they are more or less on par with other places of the same calibre.  But I was pleasantly surprised with their menu. They had some delicious offers.  I was very happy with our pizza choices.  We got several and one of the best ones that came out was the Margarita pizza.  It was on a great thin crust and all the ingredients tasted terrific. I'd definitely come back for the pizza.  Also there is an upstairs. But I can't really say what that's like. Also, might I add that this is a terrific place for people watching if you are into that sort of thing,  many characters were in full swing at this place (apparently the corner it's on is know as the Viagra triangle,  haha) .  Gave us all a laugh really.

I like this place! Despite being crowded on both occasions I was able to get a table outside. The servers were very attentive and my water cup was always full.  I love love love their brunch and drink menus. Today I went a bit later in the day and ended up getting a small Caesar salad. It was filling and refreshing. My cousin loved her Apple pie that came with ice cream. I had a bite and was amazed- they know their desserts! My coffee wasn't the best, felt super milky. However, I didn't really come here specifically for a coffee so it didn't change my opinion on this place. Will definitely be back.

I used to be a regular here years ago. My husband and I were meeting some guests from out of town at another bar but we thought we'd have a drink at Tavern before heading out to meet our guest. I hate to give 1 star but from the time we walked in and sat at the bar it was downhill. The bar staff looked miserable. It took quite awhile to take our order. Who ever the blond haired girl behind the bar was on 10/29/2015 was the rudest person I have encountered there. She took our order, asked if we were running a tab. I said yes and gave her my card. She looked at me and wouldn't take the card and started doing something behind the bar, so I placed it on the counter. No big deal. We ordered 2 glasses of wine and 2 glasses of water. She came back and refilled my husbands glass and the man next to him, but not mine. (Does she want a tip or not?) Lastly, we were ready to leave and I asked her for the check. She came back and said my credit card was declined twice. I asked her to manually type in the numbers and she said "no" because she already tried twice. Clearly she is trying to embarrass me. I use this card on a daily basis and I used it after we left there and 3 times for business the next day! My husband ended up paying the tab. This was very unprofessional and at this point I'm not sure I would ever want to go back in there with staff like that.

Took awhile for them to get a table cleaned off so we could sit down, but once we sat down service was pretty quick and staff was really nice. Food was really good, maybe a bit pricey. Overall a solid experience.

Absolutely delicious, great service, and fantastic food. To be fair - I'm not a local, just in town for a conference. I had an 8 oz. Fillet Mignon, a glass of pinot noir, and a side of asparagus and mashed potatoes (yes, sides are each a separate charge, but price isn't bad at all for the quality of food or service!). Both the hostess and wait staff I had were extremely welcoming and a pleasure to deal with - and the steak and sides were fantastic. Highly recommend if you're in the mood for a great place for some traditional fare - and their wine selection is fantastic as well.

Chicago at its parting finest!  I was surprised on how good the food is here. The service was good and the atmosphere was off the charts fun...we stayed for hours, which only ran up the tab. I can't wait to return for another fun filled and delicious evening.

I live close to the restaurant and it used to be a good spot to take out of towners mainly because of its prime location.  However lately the service has gone down, the waiters take a really long time to get back to you and take your order- our waiter in particular was gone for like 25-30 minutes that eventually had to just ask another waiter we've been waiting to put in a food order.  For the price you pay the service should definitely be a lot better and the food is meh okay nothing too exciting or refreshing- just comfortable american bistro.  Maybe in the future i may give it another chance but there are way to many up and coming restaurants in the gold coast area where it won't hurt me not to return.

We have been coming here for 20 years. Always some fun action in n the hood, even if it is scary girls face injections and cheek lifts with their "sponsors".  But today pushed us to the limit.  I judge a restaurant by its restroom, cause if you can't keep that clean, how is your kitchen?  The stairs to the restroom are so filthy and smelly, they are just a precursor to how awful the restroom is.... The deterioration of the lower level is beyond words, I don't ever want to eat here again.  Have a drink, watch the show, save yourself from the filth.

3ppl, Saturday night, 10pm. I'd love to be able to tell you about the meal but we never saw our waiter after 30 minutes. I watched him carve up a Chateaubriand for 3ppl at the next table, he could not be less interested in his job, he was slopping the vegetables on each plate spilling them onto the tray and putting them back on the plate, he cut the steak into 4 pieces, they wanted it in 3 pieces. He was putting dirty plates on the tray with the food he was delivering. After a busy saturday night of service the place was bit worse for wear as expected. We left the restaurant without so much as a question, interest at all as if we were never there. So sad to be in such a great location and to big to fail.

Came here with my boyfriend on a busy Friday night with great weather. Used open table to make reservations, and probably had the best booth in the house located upstairs. For an appetizer, we chose the lobster bruschetta which was seriously amazing! For dinner, we ordered the rigatoni pasta in vodka sauce and a steak. Portions were very big and delicious! The atmosphere is trendy and elegant. The staff was very friendly and knowledgible. Perfect for a date night, will be back!

Grab your girlfriends and come here for a boozy brunch. The patio is always busy during the nice days but it's totally worth it. Or come here for date night and sit inside in the dimly lit bar. Either way, the food is decent but the main reason I would come here is for the drinks and atmopshere (mainly the patio)!

I returned to give it another go... and had a similar experience but this time the food was not just mediocre but mediocre and bland. My drinks tasted watered down and both me and my partner's food wasn't worth the buck.

Very nice atmosphere and excellent service . Ate with a large group started with the tuna, potstickers , and calamari. All were good except the calamari which was excellent . So I expected a lot from the entree, but was quite disappointed. I had the Kansas City steak on the recommendation of the server . Ordered it medium and it came well done.  The server and manager corrected immediately. This time the steak came on the rare side, which was OK with me. But the steak was surprisingly tough for a nearly $50 prime steak. Certainly did not melt in your mouth. Maybe just bad luck as no one else in our party had an issue with their steak . But at these prices these sort of problems should not occur. My wife got the Jambalaya, which was OK but not great . Lots of rice and sausage but not a lot of seafood for the price. All the dinners came with a small salad which was average. We ordered a number of side dishes including sweet potato, cheesy potatoes, and veggies all of which were tasty. Had the big chocolate cake for dessert and our chocolate lovers were very pleased- portion large enough to share by 3-4! Overall a mixed experience

I was skeptical on trying out with this with the mixed reviews, but I'm glad we tried it.  We went there twice.  Once for drinks at the bar and the next day, we went for brunch. The service was really good for us.  I wish I remembered who served us, but she was very attentive and nice.  The food came out pretty fast.   The food was good.  I ordered the salmon omelet that came with potatoes.

I feel the need to revise my original review.  yes the hostess' were uppity and pretentious, but if you expect that going in and blow it off instead of taking it personal then you are in for a treat. the receipt shows our servers name was Neb. He turned the experience around for us. His level of service was amazing. He checked in us just enough, but not too much to make it overbearing. the meal was wonderful. my steak was done perfectly and my wife (who can be picky) kept bringing up the next day how unbelievable the food and service was. by the time we left we had all but forgotten about the mean girls casted hostess' and bathroom attendant whose ish don't stink (or pee for that matter because they ice the urinals...great idea by the way).

The food wasn't that good. The ribeye steak sandwich was more like a fatty steak. So much fat was on the steak I thought it was meatless! The waiter was very rude. The service was very poor. It felt like we were being discriminated. Our waiter had very poor Manners. I will NEVER go back there again
Sunday brunch was incredibly good and the weather was perfect for patio seating and people watching. Server was sweet and attentive. Will definitely come back next time I'm in Chicago!

Been here sooo many times ! Sometimes can be hit or miss but tonight it was sooo good. Their steak was perfectly grilled and their thin crust sausage pizza paper thin and crispy with fresh toppings and then had their warm brownie with hot fudge and Ice cream that can easily be split in two or three. Amazing food and ambiance on the patio. A chilly night but they had the warmers overhead. Great time !
Great bloody's and great people watching!!!! Go here if you want a good breakfast before shopping, it is on a corner so the people watching is just great if uh sit outside!

Great food beautiful surroundings bustling atmosphere and our waiter Sean was on point from wine knowledge to help with menu choices and he was just very hospitable and welcoming to my girl and me. Sean is one of the best servers I have had in a long time at not only tavern but other high end places in the city. Thank you Sean we will be back to see you soon. You are the epitome of what top notch service is.

We stopped for lunch and even though the place looked full we were seated immediately and outside. It was pretty and colourful with all the flowers around us. The service was very nice. Our waiter was friendly and polite and attentive. I had noticed that the portions were huge so my friend and I ordered the Griddled crab cake for an appetiser which we split and the Aztec salad for our entree which we split as well. Our server did not make us feel at all uncomfortable doing that. In fact he provided us an extra plate to split the appetiser and then had the kitchen split our salad before he served it to us. The crab cake was delicious as was the salad which tasted so fresh. Just the right amount of great tasting food on a hot day. They did not rush us and so it allowed us plenty of time to chat to catch up with each other. The only problem we had was that with so many lovely flowers there were a few bees around that was a little bothersome and it would have been good to have ice in the water. The meal was a bit pricey but it was good and the ambience was relaxing and very pleasant.

My friend and I went here on a Saturday night and enjoyed the lively atmosphere. There was a long wait for a table but we sat in the bar area and had a great time. Try the rumchata coffee and the Irish coffee if you need some perking up. The women's bathroom is unique. If you are here on a date and need some refreshing-check in at the bathroom. You'll find everything you need! Fun place to hang out, catch up with a friend, and people watch (if that's you're thing).

My daughter and I dined at (tavern) on rush yesterday.we both had a (tavern) burger which was mediocre and a glass of wine. The waitress I felt was quite rude(maybe she didn't want to be working on a Sunday) but she could have showed a little enthusiasm  doing her job. We probably won't return , there many other good places to eat in the area.

Tavern on Rush was recommended to us from a friend who used to live in Chicago. It's part of the "Viagria Triangle" which has a few restaurants with a big old school Chicago feel. We made a reservation which was good because the place was packed. The server was prompt, explained the menu to us, and showed us all of the different steak options using actual cuts of meat (not sure if they were real or fake). We ordered the beef carpaccio to start- it was fantastic! After careful consideration I went with the Kansas City strip steak and my boyfriend got the porterhouse steak. The Kansas City strip was recommended by the waitress. It's a strip steak with a bone. It was NOT something I would order again. I haven't met a steak I didn't LOVE until I ordered that. It wasn't juicy or flavorful, instead I felt like it absorbed the taste of the grill. It tasted charred which overpowered the meat. The porterhouse was excellent!  I would recommend this restaurant. I would not recommend the Kansas City Strip unless you like the charred taste from a grill. It's not something I prefer.  The restaurant was clean, classy, and staff was friendly and attentive.

This has a fun atmosphere and it's in the center of Rush. The wait can be a while if you are waiting for a table outside. We just found a table near the bar and it was fine. The rumchatta coffee was delicious along with the Irish coffee. Cocktails were great! The service was also fine and we weren't rushed to drink our drinks or anything. It seemed like a fun place to hang after work or to people watch.
Only stopped in for a drink on the second floor but was very impressed with the specialty cocktail menu, attentive service, and views. Definitely will be back to try the food!

This has been on my list of restaurants to try for a very long time & last night I finally came here. I am not sure why there are so many negative reviews about this place as I thought my entire dining experience was immaculate.  Right from the start, our waiter was attentive & friendly. We were a large group & he accommodated all of our requests. I ordered a dirty martini to begin, & oh man, SO GOOD. My expectations for the food were not insanely high as I feel like the concept of this restaurant is so common in this area & River North. However, everything was amazing. Not one person I was with had any complaints about their food. I would honestly say this was the best service I have had in Chicago in quite some time. Along with the amazing waiters, the great food & drinks will definitely have me making this place a regular.

Friends, let me be direct.  When I saw mixed reviews for Tavern on Rush, I debated whether or not to go.  The answer is a solid NO, it is not worth it.   My boyfriend and I arrived at 12:30 for lunch and were immediately seated inside at a high traffic table near the kitchen and bar, where someone had just dropped a bloody mary on the floor.  There were plenty of other tables available, so this struck us as strange.  The scantily clad hostesses and the paintings of naked women everywhere made us a bit uncomfortable, too.     We had the dumplings as an appetizer, which were mediocre and came with mayo (odd).  We ordered a burger and egg sandwich and waited, waited... and waited some more. Once we asked for our food, it magically appeared, but the burger bun was burnt and the food was not hot.  The quality of the food overall was not good, either.   We were not pleased given the prices at Tavern on Rush and the other strange encounters we'd had already during our visit.  We gently explained our dismay about the wait and burned food to the waiter and he coldly responded, "well do you just want another bun?"  He offered no apology (or anything else, for that matter).   When I go to a nice restaurant, I expect good service, good food, and a nice atmosphere.  You won't find any of that at Tavern on Rush.

SO GOOD. Very good food, somewhat pricey. I got a soup and salad, and I highly recommend their tomato soup. Great lunch spot. My only complaint was that my group was at the smallest table ever considering the place was empty.
The burgers and sandwiches were really Good, service is nice, space was clean, and waiters/waitresses all look like models :)

Really enjoyed my late lunch here. First timer there and thoroughly enjoyed my lobster bruschetta as an appetizer, fruity cocktail, and spicy sausage pasta. The portion size was perfect for the pasta!

I have been here a couple times over the years but this was the first time for lunch. Stopped by this past Saturday with a couple friends and ordered the smoked salmon club with fries, a garden salad with ranch dressing and a Strawberry Smoothie spiked with Tito's Vodka. The drink was refreshing but was rather average. The salad was a good size with fresh veggies and the sandwich was gigantic and delicious! Fries were above average as well. Our server, although friendly whenever he was at the table, was MIA most of the time. Quite irritating. Had to ask him several times for breadsticks. Took forever to get the check. We ate outside and the tables are smashed together. Claustrophobia was kicking in a bit for us. :) Food is very satisfying here but there is some room for improvement. xoxo

This establishment is outstanding.  The service was impeccable and the food was perfect.  They offer many diverse options for every taste bud and take pride in everything they serve.  I'd highly recommend this place for almost any occasion.
We were there for late lunch; they set up table for 5 in shade--felt like al fresco.Excellent salads with special requests, pizza, onion rings, fries, service.  We will be back!

Great place to have a drink and people watch. It's entertaining to watch the older men hit on the younger ladies and Cougars try to snag a young guy. Food is decent. I had the firecracker pasta once, but won't get it again. It was almost inedible because it was so incredibly spicy. However, the fish dish I had the time before was delicious.
Like Gibson's, Tavern sort of costs on on reputation, but it definitely does taste better overall. It's like upscale diner food and a relaxing place to chill late at night.

My boyfriend and I went out of our way to visit Tavern on Rush for their fantastic oyster special last night. Although there was a long wait for a patio table, we grabbed a high top in the bar right away. After sitting at our table for a solid 10 minutes, our server finally appeared and took our order. She seemed nice enough and we put an order in: 10 raw oysters, 4 baked oysters, and drinks while we thought about dinner. To sum up the evening, we never got the baked oysters we ordered and the glass of wine I ordered never made it's way to the table, although I was seeing our waitress deliver drinks to other tables around us and had reminded her twice. The oysters were great, but it was absolutely ridiculous that we sat there for 30 minutes, were served 2/3 of the oysters we ordered, and never received my drink. We asked for the check and left crabby and hungry. I won't be returning.

The food was great. I had a pizza, my wife had gluten-free pizza and they were both delicious. The food came quickly and our server was very friendly.  Two reasons it only got three stars... 1. No beer on tap, but $5.50 for a bottle of Miller Lite 2. Dining room was very crowded. They should take out a few tables so that the people walking through the restaurant don't knock into people trying to eat their food.

Nice atmosphere, good food. Hummus appetizer is great, really liked their beef chili. A couple of missed service related things but not significant to spoil the experience. It was a beautiful day, perfect for al fresco dining.
Decent food. I had the Calamari and a salad which was delicious. Went for lunch the  place wasn't crowded.

The food was just ok, the service was average, but the atmosphere and people watching was excellent. I got the tuna avocado tar tar which was flavorless and had hardly any tuna. It should have been called Guacamole with tuna. My friend wasn't happy with his meal either. He got a steak (dry) and Cajun shrimp. The drinks are overpriced for what you get. So if you want to go someplace where you can sit back and observe, this is your place. Just don't expect much from the food.
They said it would be a 30-45 mins wait and it ended up being an hour and 15 minutes... great to sit outside and people watch. Food was pretty good, but not great.

I was at tavern on rush on a Sunday at the bar servers by Tom and Nick. Best service I have gotten in the city. It was a packed bat and they made a point to be personable with every costumer. Great service and great drinks. The manager PJ also came over to check on how the drinks and service was, which was extremely refreshing! I give tavern on rush 5 stars for food, drinks, service and overall experience! I will come back here again on to sit at the bar with Nick and Tom!

Sometimes I go to certain places, close my eyes, and pretend I'm back on South Beach among the Miami elites. At Tavern On Rush, I don't need to close my eyes as this is JUST like being in the heart of my snobby 305 hometown.  Beautiful people, beautiful outfits, beautiful prescription Viagra pills in pockets galore. There are hot, suited-up, older men everywhere ready to spend their hard earned moola on gorgeous younger women. Though this usually isn't my thing, it's nice every once in a while, when you want to get dolled up and feel appreciated for doing so.  The drinks are bad here (and a particular bartender named Jen is to be avoided with her super rude attitude) but the place is poppin' and the vibe is chic. I'd go again, for sure! Just order a basic drink - vodka/soda, whiskey/ginger, etc.

We came for a late night martini after arriving in the afternoon and it was perfect! They have bleu cheese olives (thank you!), outdoor sidewalk/cafe seating, and an upbeat atmosphere. It was the perfect spot for a couple of out of towners to chill, people watch, and enjoy a delicious cocktail!

Brought some friends here for a late night dinner on monday. Though the downstairs area was a scene from a nightclub the upstairs was really nice and calm. I wanted the roasted chicken but the kitchen was closing soon. Melinda our server suggested the Chicken Breast with Jalapenos on a bed of mashed potatoes. It was a very tasty meal...really exceeded my expectations! I'd come back in the day time. I hear their brunch was really good.

Wish they had more organic, grass fed/free range options. Not as pricey as I thought it would be, but certainly more on the upscale side (so why not have high quality ingredients?). Good cocktail. Sat quickly when opting to skip the patio.

Fun date night with the Captain. Jason was the best server ever! (Worth requesting him)  He made this great dining experience, FABULOUS! The food was amazing. We both had the fillet and the flavor was so good.

Every time I Think about Tavern on Rush I Always get a big smile on my face. Because this is a really good restaurant where it is fun to eat. Both bar and dining room... they are just great (and fun). The cocktails are stiff, steaks delicious and the waitress recommended really good wines for us. Don't miss order their Blackened Cajun Shrimps, one of the best appetizers I ever had. Service is top notch and the restaurant is great for people watching
Great spot to chill and people watch ... the grilled calamari is very very good .. we ordered burger and it's just blah.. very ordinary .. other than .. it was a nice afternoon of chillin. .

We called for a table, talked to a Witney, were told to come right over. We changed our plans, dropped everything and went. When we got there in 5 minutes, we were told it would be 45 minutes, and to wait in the bar. Decided to leave.

Great service and excellent steaks. Epitome of a Chicago steakhouse. Dry aged ribeye was phenomenal and drinks were exceptional. Highly recommend for its upscale vibe and great food. Call ahead because this place is HOTTTTT...

Great food-perfect location and excellent service.    U can't go wrong here.  I love the Bellevue salad, and oysters and bloody are perfect!!!  My husband always has the seared ahi tuna and filet and this is tasty and perfectly done.    Great spot for a Sunday champ night!

Love tavern on rush!!! Jared is the best waiter there. Definitely ask for him whenever you come.  Jared is the kindest, most sincere waiter because he smiles and is so positive all the time. I will come back to Tavern on Rush because of him.
Tavern on Rush is a lively spot for good food and fun times in the heart of Chicago. Very good service too! I'll definitely return.

The atmosphere here is split between the first and second floors. The first is a lounge area, I would say more so for a young professional crowd. The upstairs portion is white table cloth style, dim romantic lighting with very good service.  Overall, I believe the food was not that good for the price but it was a nice place to entertain a mature crowd.

I can see why this restaurant does so good since its at a great and busy location where there is a lot going on. I went there for an easy lunch with my parents and I ordered the grilled cheese. It was nothing special but averagely good. It seems like it would be a fun place to go to on a weekend night with friends.

Tavern on Rush was this great looking restaurant a short walk from our hotel.  They have a terrific system for notifying you via text when your table is ready.  There is a nice mini park across the street with tables, chairs and benches which turned out to be the perfect place to wait for a table to come available.     Once seated, I ordered my most favorite brunch item...eggs benedict.  I was not surprised that the restaurant did not get my order correct as at least 75% of restaurants do not get this right even when I specifically ask that the whites be cooked (runny egg whites are so disgusting!).  What did surprise me and what set this restaurant apart from the many others was the lack of service.  Our server did not come by to make sure we received our orders and that they were correct so after 10 minutes, we flagged him down.  He took my dish back to the kitchen but it was another 10-15 minutes before I saw it again.  At that point, they had microwaved the heck out of it.  Not only were the egg whites cooked but the eggs were hard & rubbery and the hollandaise sauce had turned hard.  At this point, my sister had long finished her food and I had yet to receive something I could eat.  We flagged down the server (again), explained that my dish was inedible and asked for the check.  No apology from the server.... no offer to get me something that was edible... no service!  (the receipt said that Rippy was the server)   The low rating is obviously for the disappointing service and the fact that I spent over an hour at this restaurant and never had the opportunity to taste their food.   With so many amazing restaurants in the area, I will not waste my time coming back here the next time I am in Chicago!

2 stars only because of the two hostesses in front! My friend and I just finished a drink at Gibsons and wanted to grab a dinner here, the hostess said its about 30 minute wait for the table! I turned around and at least 3 tables were empty in front, but oh well we decided to wait across the street, as we were waiting we were looking if she will give those table to anybody else, since we are 25 yrs old maybe we didn't match with the rest of the crowd  ( over 50) that were sitting in front! She let 5 parties before us, all over 50, and finally after one hour she texted us that our table is ready????  We went back to Gibsons, got a table right away and acctually had some nice food!  Hostess attitude big 0 Food 2  Patio 3 ( too tight)

I've always enjoyed my dining experience at Tavern on Rush and today was no different. While the service wasn't the best I've experienced at Tavern, the food was delicious. The fried calamari was cooked perfectly and enough for two people with wicked hangovers to share. The onion rings were good and crispy. And the Ribeye Sandwich gets two thumbs up. The meat was tender and juicy and combined perfectly with the onions, melted cheese and chipotle mayo. I highly recommend this sandwich.

Spinach salad was pretty good but I can only give 2 stars due to the service. My sister ordered eggs benedict and specifically asked that the egg whites be fully cooked. When they arrived runny, it took forever to flag down the waiter.  She just asked them to pop them in the microwave for 1 minute. About 10 minutes later, after I finished my salad, her eggs benedict arrived completely dried out. When we brought it to the waitor's attention, he seemed totally unconcerned. So we are leaving  the benies behind and Rippy is not getting a good tip!

Came back to tavern once the out door patio opened. Upon arrival we went to the hostess outside to let her know it will be two of us. In a beyond rude manner she stated ( more like talked at me and not to me) that its going to be an hour and a half wait. I replied OK, I personally don't care of the wait time and I wasn't hungry I just wanted to put my name down and grab a drink at the bar, and I was fine waiting that time for dinner. She reiterated that it was an hour and a half wait, as if I misunderstood her. I repeated saying I heard her and to take my name already.  Our table was ready after 30 min  and had the misfortune of being seated by the miserable unhappy hostess. Our waitress on the other hand was the great, friendly and personable. It's unfortunate that for such a nice place they cant take the time to train their hostesses to be friendly, those who hold a front facing role should not be that moody and miserable.
Place is loud and busy with all men. Bar is dirty but the tenders are fantastic which makes everything else pale. Go with large party and drink your a,, off.

Inconsistent food quality. We had 2 dishes. One was the smoked salmon egg benedicts dish, which as good, with plenty of salmon. The 2nd dish was scrambled eggs, with potatoes and fruits. The scrambled eggs were absolutely tasteless, and cooked like rubber: dry, dry, dry. It's not that difficult to make scrambled eggs!

Amazing food. These portions were massive. The macaroni and cheese was probably the best I've ever had- and I've had lots of macaroni and cheese in my day. The inside almost looks like a classic masculine set up with the dark brown walls and the big leather sofas and that giant bar!! I had ordered the prime rib sandwich. THE BOMBBBBBBB!!!! That steak was so juicy and tender. I couldn't finish the other half of my sandwich because like I said, portions were huge. I fell into a food coma for a little shortly after half! hahaha

Slow service but great place !! Love the vibe in here !!  Drinks are fantastic !  The have pineapples soaking in absolute in large containers which is wonderful !!!   The 4 stars is for service tonight but the drinks were great
Great seafood tower appetizer. Steak and sides left much to be desired. Both tasted like reheated chain offerings.

Have been to Tavern twice and there won't be a third.  Never got that "we're glad you're here" vibe.  No seating available on the patio so the hostess asked us to wait in the bar.  Good drinks and nice bartender.  Hostess never came to check on us so I went up front to ask about a table and the hostess said to sit whoever you like in the bar area.  Food service was slow and good luck getting a second drink.  I had ribs, sauce is like catsup.  My husband enjoyed his burger.

Ate here. Wife had the veggie burger and a glass of wine. I had one of the prime burgers with the homemade chips with a coke (I drove). Our server was personable and accurate in service. I messed up and left my credit card behind. I returned and they had it but had to check identification before returning it to me.
Good food, solid patio. Can't really complain. Think it would be best as a happy hour spot. Lots of good people watching opportunities too!
Great day to sit outside for brunch. Service was great! Did not have to wait. We had the Oak St Scramble and a stack of pancakes. Do not forget to order some Glazed and Infused Donuts! Awesome!

First of all, I RARELY, write reviews except this needed to be noted for the public who are looking for a good dining experience. Service was HORRENDOUS. Server seemed uninterested in us as a table, spoke to us in a condensing manner every time she DID visit us to see how things were.  Food was overpriced, lacked flavor except for the lobster Cobb salad which was mainly because of the dressing. $55 steak was over  cooked, dry and had no flavor. Brussel sprouts were soggy and when my wife asked for honey mustard she(the server) seemed annoyed. Look elsewhere if you want a good meal in that part of town.

Had a great dinner last night at Tavern on rush. I went with my friend and her family to celebrate her birthday and everything was delicious. They gave us dessert on the house which was really nice and added to the dining experience! Def looking forward to going back there again soon!

What a great spot for lunch in Chicago! We dipped into the city before we went to catch a flight at O'hare and this was the perfect spot to spend a couple of hours and enjoy the city. We wanted to sit outside but due to the crowd chose the bar and had a great time. I love the open patio and window feel of the restaurant -- makes it a great weekend spot. Our bartender was excellent - timing was on point, and she made recommendations and  cocktails that everyone at the bar loved. Wish I knew her name, but I do know her favorite drink to make is a whiskey smash. All in all a great experience and we will be back next time we visit Chicago!

We came here, love the food, but were charged two separate times for extra drinks within 2 hours!  Once at the bar for an extra martini and at the table for a beer. We complained to the manager and he offered us a free $4.95 bottle of Pinot Grigio. Thanks but no thanks. Those drinks that you charged us for that we didn't get were more than that "free" bottle of wine.

I went with a group of 10 for a Sunday brunch to celebrate a birthday. The service was terrible, nothing we ordered came out correct and everything was served in a strange order so no one got to actually eat together. They were very inattentive, a glass broke and we couldn't find any to help us clean it up for 30 minutes! If it was busy, I could understand but we were the only table in the restaurant. VERY DISSAPOINTED

My wife and I had a great dinner at tavern on rush last night, she had the tuna tartare with a Caesar salad and I had a filet mignon with a house salad and a side of creamed spinach! The food tasted great and the service was good too however I was a little taken aback when our waitress told us that I couldn't substitute my house salad for a Caesar salad, apparently they don't do substitutes even if you're willing to pay the difference which I was, the only option was to charge me for the entire salad which I refused and ended up having to settle for the house salad.   We were seated upstairs but they have a nice bar downstairs which serves amazing martinis! I would definitely recommend this restaurant especially in the summer when it's nice and warm out, they have a very nice patio!

This place is a steakhouse for people who don't know any better. Go to gibsons or mortons down the street. I went to tavern on Monday for a early dinner. The atmosphere seemed nice but when I looked at the menu all I saw was bland options for a very expensive price. I went with a filet mignon.. Brussels sprouts which the waitress recommended and.. the au gratin potatoes all three of them came out in a timely manner but just was nothing special. The steak was cooked perfect but nothing like gibsons. The sides were nothing. No wow factor once so ever. I left just not stunned but I didn't completely dismiss tavern on rush yet.. Until today I tried again for lunch with my girlfriend we both ordered soup and salad. This is where service plays a factor., our server stood in corner chatting with another waiter for 15 min after our soup was ordered.. We had to call him over and ask about our soups he then said ohh ya I'll go get them... When they arrived they were cold but delicious once we had them reheated. Then the Cobb salads came and for $24 it sucked. All the dressings had way way too mayonnaise.. Which was surprising cause the waiter had explained one as a avocado vinaigrette. I even took it home and threw it out. I don't know why I didn't check yelp before coming here or think of there's probably a reason I never came here with family or on a date.Bye tavern on rush!!

Food is usually great. Love the ambience. Usually good service... Frequent diners here. Poor review thanks to Rory & the poor service today on the patio.  Here's a tip: don't blame the bar & tell me that they lost the ticket when you clearly forgot to place the order for my drink. Also, don't give us a dessert menu & forget to check on the table to see if we wanted to order something. The patio wasn't even that busy. Bring back the patio waitstaff from last summer!

This has been my spot since I was in H.S which was over 16 years ago. I've always enjoyed a great meal, ambiance & good customer service. My first time at Tavern on Rush may have been my Senior year or H.S for lunch while shopping on Rush street for graduation shoes. I recall my friends & I having this chicken BBQ pizza & some other items but I can only remember the pizza because it stuck out with extreme taste & flavor. Rush street is such a busy and popular strip in Chicago especially in the summer months as the restaurant patios are open and busy and I absolutely LOVE the entire feel in addition to the food. The valet service is prompt and the hostesses are very welcoming, I LOVE the fact that they take your phone and provide a ticket (like coat check) if you inquire about having it charged. How cool is that? No phone during dinner so you can pay attention to your company and to the server as they present the specials and provide suggestions. GO TO FOOD DINNER: Our Favorite straight from the menu item is the Filet Mignon Oscar Style Medium-Well. Or any FISH selection on the SPECIAL for the night menu, Ooh MY you can't go wrong with the chef special especially when it's Salmon or some type of fish. GO TO FOOD LUNCH: HandMade Salmon burger, let me say that again HANDMADE SALMON burger.. This salmon burger is like no other, it's made in house and full of flavor. The calamari is fried to perfection and the BBQ Chicken pizza and salads of all types are awesome. I really ENJOY Tavern on Rush and LOVE sitting out on the patio to people watch because you never know who you will see. I've seen some great celebs coming to the restaurant and leaving as well as some flashy spenders and wannabes LoL..

I've been here three times (always on Mondays for ladies night) and although the atmosphere is nice, the service is always consistently horrible. I am a server myself, and can't imagine treating tables how the cocktail waitresses serve tables. Some of the girls I've encountered were really snobby and just acted like they hated serving me. It's almost impossible to get a server to come back to the table at all. You see them all standing against the wall doing nothing while I have empty drinks. Also, every time I've ever gotten food nobody has checked back on me. I'll have an empty plate in front of me for a half an hour before anyone picks it up. What is that!

I am from italy and I just move here in Chicago. I was looking for a nice place and this is the place. The atmosphere is great. The food is not so good, and it's expensive. I think if you wont to buy a show this is the place.

My overall experience at Tavern on Rush was unsatisfying. The menu doesn't offer anything interesting, yet what is offered has a hefty price tag (specifically for what it is). Our table of five ordered several items from across the menu; however, I only truly enjoyed the Tavern Duck Tacos, an item from their bar menu which is only offered if you request it. Not only was it the most tasty and delectable item we ordered, but it was also the most reasonably priced. The salad and pasta our table ordered weren't spectacular... but again, pricey. Both were easily something you could throw together at home in about 10 to 15 minutes or so. Really -- there wasn't anything particularly exciting or interesting about anything we ordered. Though, portion sizes are generous, so although the food was not memorable enough to warrant visiting Tavern on Rush again, at least you could go home with some leftovers.

Let's start with the GOOD, tavern cranks out some delicious food definitely worth the visit. We came here for my best friends birthday dinner and by the end of the night we were all rubbing our bellys feeling content. I ordered the 12 oz medium  steak, adobo roasted corn and Chipotle mac and cheese. The steak literally melted in my mouth. I've heard people use this expression in reference to steak and I never quite understood until tonight. It was impressive. The adobo roasted corn was perfect. The corn was sweet and the cheese was salty, which gave it a nice balance. It was basicaly deconstructed Mexican street corn. The Chipotle mac and cheese had a nice kick but not overly spicy.  Aside from the stale bread accompanied by off putting chips served at the start of dinner the food was excellent.  However, the service was lacking. It didn't seem like our servers head was in the game. It could have been because it was the end of the night but he didn't seem all there and upstairs was really cold we had to keep our jackets on. Aside from that  everyone else was friendly and the food was great.

The SETTING:  Dinner with a co-worker on a Tuesday evening The VIBE:  3.5 Stars - This really depends on where you are seated at the restaurant.  The fun adn vibrant outdoor area (5 stars on a good weather day) does NOT take reservations, so arrive early or be prepared to wait if that is where you want to be seated.  The downstairs indoor area is where the (from the looks of it) serious business people are seated.  Upstairs (where we were seated) seemed to be more families and people dressed casually.  I would have preferred to be seated downstairs, but oh well...rookie lesson at this place. The SERVICE:  2 Stars - our server meant well but was slammed.  It took 15 minutes for our first drink order and 20 minutes for our second round.  The appetizer we ordered was never delivered...our consolidation prize was a complimentary dessert as an apology, which was only ok. The FOOD:  3.5 Stars - The salad was dissappointing and we never received our appetizer...but the steaks were actually very good, and the side of potatoes au gratin were excellent! The Bottom Line:  If you come here, arrive early, sit outside, and order steak.  According to friends, the service is normally great, so I am witholding judgement.  Otherwise, plenty of other good options in the area.

It was a nice beautiful day out in chicago! We wanted to go somewhere where we can eat outside. My cousin and I decided to stop here after doing some shopping! We were hungry and there were so many restaurants around, we had no idea where to go. I'm so happy we stopped by here because everything we had was really delicious. we both had the salmon sandwich with fries...the salmon was really good, it's probably one of the best salmon i've had in awhile...in a sandwich anyways. for our appetizers, we had shrimp and calamari for an appetizer which was very flavorful and presentation of the food looked nice! drinks, we had a blueberry lemon drop martini! it was very strong and very good! downfall about this place is that if you decide to eat outside, it can be very tight! especially if you have a handbag or shopping bags lol

A terrific dining experience. We had a table on the second floor and they opened up the area to the outside. Unexpected and very comfortable. The room is reminiscent of times long past and the service is excellent. he appetizers of calamari and grill shrimp were almost better than the steak. Calamari was fresh and cooked perfectly. The grilled shrimp - we could not get enough. A bit zesty and opened fire grill taste was excellent. We had the tomahawk wagyu ribeye and it was perfect. 32 Oz will feed two.  Overall a great experience. A must try.
Great bar menu.  Food seemed pricey for portions, but it was tasty.  Not good for kids.

My previous reviews were based on experiences eating in the bar; Have eaten in the dining room a few times recently and had amazing experiences every time. Last time our server, Jason, was just the best. Super friendly, made a whole experience out of it. Lobster Bisque is amazing; had a pork chop and my husband got one of the steaks. Delicious.

I think the restaurant is slipping. We went for Easter , they were not that busy at 2pm. We were seated after a wait for the upstairs hostess. We did get a window table that I had asked for. I ordered a Cabernet, a was brought a Chardonnay.  I ordered a New York Strip Steak, I was given a skirt steak. I had ordered a salad, didn't get it. By the time I received my steak, that I ordered extra rare, my family was done with dinner. My steak was over cooked.  No one came by and asked how our meal was. Not great!!!!
Love the food and atmosphere of this iconic place. Top notch service! Great for people watching too.
Great location right on rush street, excellent up beat crowd. The wait can be a little long so be prepared and the staff is very polite. It is a little pricey.

I've visited Tavern a few times and had nothing but great experiences, whether it was dinner service or small bites at the bar. So, to my surprise, I had an awful experience when I went for lunch on a Sunday. From the second we sat down, we were instantly disappointed. Before we had a chance to even look at our menu, our waiter was badgering us for our order. After we ordered drinks and told him we wanted time to review the menu, he then proceeded to disappear for 15 minutes. We were presented with a brunch menu, which neither of us were in the mood for and asked for a lunch menu. He told us they did not have one on the weekends and said we would have to wait until 3:00 pm for their dinner menu. After a few minutes, he unwillingly brought us a dinner menu and even though he said we'd have a problem ordering off of it, we didn't.  We also had to remind him to bring our salads and appetizer (the tuna tar tar...which was literally a hunk of avocado covered in soy sauce). The most upsetting part though was that he was hardly trained. We had to ask for silverware, plates, water, all basic things when serving anyone, let alone what's supposed to be a premier restaurant in Chicago.  But the worst part?  He didn't even bring us dishes or silverware!  We had to constantly grab things from other tables.  I am so beyond disappointed...this was a completely different restaurant from other times I have visited. And sadly, I don't think I'll ever return.

Went along for dinner. Only a short wait for a table and we sat outside. The menu options were good. My companion had a steak and I had a jumbalayo. Both were excellent. The service was really good. No waiting around at all. Only criticism, and it is a little one is that when sat outside all the tables are really close together!

Great atmosphere for drinks. Food is just terrible. No flavor at all. Had the carpaccio -no good no flavor. parpadelle - the sauce was acidic and just no flavor at all. Brussels sprouts -no flavor. All the food was just bland. The menu is extensive for sure...but it's awful. My waitress didn't think to care about what I thought about the food...Cecilian-Scicilly something like that. Save your money to eat elsewhere. Drinks come on in.

This place was OK. No where near as good as Gibsons (of course). The appetizers were "Meh". We ordered one particular app, the grilled calamari, and it was just pieces of grilled calamari- no sauce, no lemon, nothing! That was just mediocre at best. The tuna tartare was incredibly sweet and it had these really gross hard, crunchy noodles sprinkled all over it. We had to try and pick those out as best we could. The best thing we had were the cajun shrimp. And it was such a small, tiny appetizer. Especially for the price. Not worth it. The waitresses were very very inattentive. We were honestly seated for 15 minutes and we kept trying to wave her down. She seated a group of guys and was taking pictures with them and tending to them when ever they needed anything. Getting service from her made our stay frustrating. So, we went to Gibsons after that so we could feel satisfied. I wish a manager had walked by to ask us how our experience was going. We stayed there for two hours and we would have stayed much much longer -we got a hotel and wanted to be there all night- had our needs as customers been met.

Been here a bunch of times, the food is great but my last visit turned me off for good. I made a reservation at open table for 8pm. I show up and the man standing behind the hostess counter (looked like a manager) does not even look up from his phone to greet us. Didn't take a name, tell us one minute or even acknowledge our presence. That akward moment went on for a minute or two,  He finally leaves his post walks by us, basically bumps into me and walks outside. I thought he was a drunk customer untill I noticed him addressing the staff outside. It was unbelieveably rude. Meanwhile the actual hostess is striking up conversation with someone else and finally decided to come over and try to seat us.  Hostess finds our reservation, and asks and elderly gentlment to seat us. I've dealt with the older man before and he is usually a delight. He smiles and tells us "two minutes," It seemed strange since open table had this place available at every slot and we had a reservation so it wasn't like they were lacking empty tables. Anyway I wait for another 5 minutes while the gentleman is making phonecalls on his cellphone and everyone basically ignores us. I'm pretty laid back and I can wait 5 minutes to be seated. Anyway some other clients come in who seemed like his friends, he embraces them makes small talk and then escorts them to the bar area. I get it, some clients are a little more VIP then others they can be seated first, it's not the end of the world.  Anyway ten more minutes have gone by, the gentlemen still hasn't returned, no one at the place has acknowledged us in the slightest. Again table availability was not the issue, anyone else couldve seated us or said something. But after being ignored at every turn, I just had enough and walked out.  I go to restraunts for the food not the service, but I am paying money to eat at your establishment. You can be civil, No one deserves to be treated that way. I'm done with them.

This place is a staple of chicago. I've been coming here regularly for 5 years and nothing has really changed. My goto for brunch and cocktails on any night. Patio In the summer is the best for people watching. The bar in the winter always has a strong crowd. Nice waitresses, good service and a DJ playing loud music. My favorite thing about this place is the diversity of the menu additionally if there is not something you care for offered you can always ask for something custom to which they are happy to accomidate.  My favorite are the eggs Lola, seafood tower, and the burgers. Don't forget their ice cream sunday it's huge and amazing. I've never been to the actual restaurant upstairs. I much prefer the bar area.

Went there last night with my boo for dinner we had an amazing time I had the Kansas City steak and Rockefeller oysters for appetizer which were amazing I highly recommend this place and Benny the general manager is an awesome guy
Excellent service and steaks. Are here for corporate function and went back next day only own. They let you pick your cut of steak. Side dishes served family style so you can share. I will be back!

Tavern On Rush has really good food. I especially love the gluten free pizza and heirloom tomato and mozerella salad. The drinks are pretty strong. There is a raffle on Monday nights to win Louboutin shoes.

Really cool spot. It's an older crowd but it's a refreshing change of pace for a younger person who's tired of the kiddy clubs. I've only had the drinks here so I can't comment on dinner but they're generous with the vodka and the drinks are reasonably priced.

I went here about a year ago and the food was unforgettable! I got the steak and it literally melted in your mouth it was so tender. I also got the side of mushrooms to split with my boyfriend, also amazing. They also give you a nice variety of bread for a starter. Tavern is definitely pricey, but worth every penny.

Got there on a Tuesday night looking for some food. The menu is an American style.  Food was ok however the servings are huge and not always quantity represents quality. Place is probably better suit for summer when they have an outside table seating setup an the location is very appropriate right on a corner at Rush St.

I've always rolled my eyes at restaurants in the heart of the Viagra Triangle, but really enjoyed Tavern On Rush.  We stopped in on a Friday evening, and the food was very good .  The people watching was even better - very entertaining (the 50 year old women trying to look 30 are not fooling anyone but reminded me of the importance of aging gracefully). I had the Tuna appetizer and split a twice-baked potato with my boyfriend.  He had the chicken breast.  All were very tasty - the chicken was moist and tuna fresh, but what really stood out was the double-baked potato.  It was unbelievably good and I want to go back just to get it. Service was good, not great, but we didn't mind waiting and taking in the atmosphere.
We loved this place!!! We had an excellent hamburger and chicken avocado club!! Excellent location!

Really enjoyed my experience here at Tavern on Rush. Here's why: 1. Steak. I had the dry aged ribeye, which is supposedly their "best cut". It didn't disappoint. The temperature was perfect and it was extremely flavorful. There is absolutely nothing like a ribeye done the right way. Others at my table had various dishes, and everyone enjoyed their meals.  2. Atmosphere. It was very easy to maintain conversations with those at my table, as the volume is pretty moderate here (at least in the upstairs dining room). This would be a great date spot.  3. Service. The service was professional, and our waiter actually took the time to do separate checks for the 5 or 6 different parties at my table which is well appreciated. We had to wait a while for drink refills at times, but overall our servers were great.  Takeaway: This place is a nice alternative to the other formal dining options on Rush.

Went here for some after dinner drinks with coworkers. Quite pricey, but then again, it is located in the "Viagra Triangle"  I had never heard of this "endearing" term for this area until visiting, but it promptly made me laugh out loud. Needless to say, youth trumps beauty in this joint. As far as drinks, I had the pear martini and it tasted basically like pure Absolut Pear. The best drink I had was the pineapple infused vodka shaken with strawberry puree as a martini.  It's not on the menu, I just put it together, but it is heavenly!

What a great place. The vibe and atmosphere is so cozy. We had drinks at the bar and then went upstairs for dinner. Service in the bar area was a bit slow, but average. Upstairs, our server was very attentive and funny. In fact, multiple servers engage with you along the experience, even the bus boys. I really enjoyed that. Food was delicious. We had the tuna and calamari apps, new york strip, dover sole, cavatappi, white cheddar au gratin and broccoli. The cavatappi was good, but nothing special. The steak was fantastic. The au gratin was my favorite dish by far. The tuna tartare was so fresh. My only complaint was we asked for the dover sole to be deboned and it wasn't. No worries at all. Overall really enjoyed my experience here

Wow they really dissapointed me.  I ordered a $38 salmon.  Over cooked and wasn't even edible.  I asked for no pico de gallo, it came out doused in it.  They took it back and just slid it off, It still had the taste of it though. I never ate a salmon so tough in my life.  They failed tremendously.  You would think they would check the food before it comes to the table.  I liked my server, but he never asked if I liked my food and only asked if I want to box it.  Honestly I wouldn't even feed this to the homeless.  They would hate me afterwards.

Ummmmm no. After my grandfather died, we migrated from the other Newman staple in Viagra Triangle, Gibson's, across the street to the less-stuffy TOR - and for a while I was pleased with the switch - larger salads, fresher fruit, better omelettes, and no watching the ever-frisky Grandpa N lightly sexually harass our 25y/o waitresses - welcome changes, I dare say (though RIP Edward, clearly) - but in the last few years, I've just been bored as eff with anything Tavern attempts to feed me. While the menu is large enough that anyone will find something to nosh on - even your vegan bestie who can usually only breathe air at a typical Chicago brunch spot (delicate we ain't in the Midwest) and your "celiac" cousin - the food just is bland and uninspired - the stuffed French toast is overly saccharine, the Azteca salad, even w corn salsa, lacks any heat, and their "glazed and infused" doughnuts are flat and without merit - and certainly not worth the extra time you'll need on the treadmill to continue to fit into your size 2 Lulus.  But okay, you say, the food has seen better days - but really, what's so offensive? Answer: the total sh-tshow that service has disintegrated into - most recently, though we were one of 6 tables in the entire place, it was horrid - absent, unfriendly, unknowledgeable - and dare I even add...unattractive? B/c obvioussssly that matters. If you're seated in a section w a bald dude w thick Ray-Ban frames, exit the premise immediately. Or, take my route and just complain to the management and score a tiramisu on the house, which was actually tasty. But really, it's just gotten to the point where I leave less thrilled than when I go in, which is usually in a light hanger, so that's  saying a lot. Apps range from $3 (oyster) to $65 (seafood tower) - though most hover around $13-16, salads are $11-24, pizza is around $14, eggs/pancakes are $10-14, and sandos are around $13. Portions are fairly ample, but unless you're getting an omelette, it's just not worth eating here.
Always a great time! Good food, fun people watching (it's the heart of the Viagra Triangle!) and the drinks are great.
