We love everything about it. Breakfast or brunch, lunch, dinner, siting inside, outside, the sliders,  the pizzas, ohhh the Bloody Marys! The crowd, the service, the location of course, we just love it

Chi-town classic on the Gold Coast! The family was in town for a brief first visit to Chicago so we had to hit one of the classic restaurants in the Viagra Triangle. We didn't have rezzies but walked in at 7pm on a Sunday night at Christmas time and were seated in five minutes. The service was great as was the ambiance upstairs as it was decorated for Xmas. [next time I will request a table in the bar, it looked like more fun and you could watch the football game!] I started with the steak chili, which was delish, and my son's three meat pizza was great. My duaghter and I went with the chopped salads and we were a little dissappointed ( I would not get this again). The wine was reasonably priced and the bottled still water was plentiful and included!

Worst steak i've ever eaten. If you charge $45 for a small stake, you have to learn how to properly cook it. It was all burnt and dry. I could cook it in a fry pan way better than you. And you call your restaurant a 'steakhouse', what a shame.
The tomato soup is to die for! Excellent, had dinner one night there, went back the next day to have the soup again!  Awesome, bar scene too!

I only spent $20 (with tip) on brunch for myself, so that's a win in my book. The chilaquiles are pretty tasty, but it would've been nice to have the option to add steak or some meat to it (or just get a side of bacon or something). Trendy atmosphere. Definitely a place to see and be seen raising a mimosa.

Tavern on Rush is a great restaurant, slightly expensive but the food is good.  I had a great server, I wish I could remember his name but he was very charismatic and reminded me of Pauly Shore.  I did find it funny that the items he recommended, were of course the 2nd and 3rd most expensive items on the menu, but he's doing his job.  I wasn't too hungry, but I did enjoy the burger which was excellent.
Great landmark and great place to people watch. The food and service was excellent. A nice varied menu that can satisfy all.
One of the best steaks I have had. The best service I had on this business trip to Chicago. Highly recommend.

I love the atmosphere here. Very low lighting, quiet, and great service. We had a large table upstairs, with a group of about 5 of us. The wait staff was attentive, and the food was delicious. The waitress was very enthusiastic in explaining their steak choices.. although a little over the top at times. Very pricey, but you can't expect much else for the location and swankiness of the establishment.
Nice restaurant....good food...expensive....nice location...good service...njoyed d liveliness at downtown

My husband and I had dinner here a couple of nights ago.  We sat outside in the heated patio which was great for people watching.  Our server was very rushed.  We started with Oysters Rockefeller for our appetizer- they were tasty but small considering they were 2.95 each.  I had the French onion soup for dinner which was quite good and my husband had the 14oz New York strip with the garden salad and twice baked potato.  The best part of his meal was the potato.  The steak was just okay and the salad was not very good.  Since the food was not that great we decided to skip dessert.  Would not recommend this restaurant- many others in the area are better.

Great place for drinks and dinner. Came in the other night and the beautiful hostess, Dallas was very friendly and got us a table within a few minutes of arriving. The manager Benny was welcoming and a great guy. We had drinks in the bar area then upstairs for dinner. Our server, Jason was the best! Very friendly and suggested the Wagyu steak which was amazing. We also really liked the oysters Florentine and potatoes which he also recommended. Just an overall great time at a great place.

Came here by accident a couple weeks ago. I liked the upstairs atmosphere and our waitress was great. You could tell she had been there for a while and knew what she was doing. Very personable and attentive. I had calamari and the filet which I enjoyed but found the filet to be somewhat over priced for the quality (it was still good though). Although it was a weekend night and we didn't have a reservation we were able to get seated rather quickly. My only complaint is the hostess group downstairs. They seemed to have an attitude and not really care about their customers. Remember ladies-you are the first thing the customers see when they walk in and set the tone for the whole evening. Do your job and smile.
I just love this place. The small table for two next to the windows is my favorite spot for Friday night.  Food is awesome. Make sure you save a space for the Tavern Brownie desert. I love it.

I pass by this restaurant so many times but never been there. So I finally when there the first time for dinner on a date and the food was delicious. I remember sitting upstair in a cosy table sipping wine and enjoying my delicious meals. I haven't tried brunch here so I have yet to tried it but I will definitely come back here for dinner. I have to tried there mini burgers that they have.

I can't find a single negative about Tavern on Rush... Everything from the service to the food was perfect! Every staff members was personable and entertaining. Did I mention the view? I highly recommend requesting window seating if possible!

I detested Tavern on Rush. It exemplified everything I detest about a restaurant: female servers who are unfriendly/biased against female patrons, disjointed and unorganized, overpriced and mediocre food, an indeterminate atmosphere that is simultaneously tacky and snooty. If Yelp permitted 1/2 stars, I'd give Tavern on Rush 1.5 stars based on the decent food and okay dinner service...but no.  1) "Female servers who are unfriendly/biased against female patrons": Look, I get the gender bias in the service industry - a definite belief exists that men always pick up the tab and that men are better tippers. Heck, I've flirted with many a dude-dominated table in college as I waited tables (I may or may not have even been wearing orange shorts at the time). BUT YOU'VE GOT TO BE CONSIDERATE OF YOUR FEMALE PATRONS. And, TOR isn't a Hooters or another type 'Breastaurant': according to our male waiter once we were [finally] seated in the upstairs dining area for our reservation, they are an "upscale steakhouse, after all." Riiiiight. And O'Charley's is family-owned and operated. But our experience (me and my two girlfriends) in the downstairs bar, from the hostesses to the cocktail waitresses, varied from forgetful indifference to impatience. 2) "Disjointed and unorganized": I should have figured something bad when I had no problem booking a reservation via Opentable for a table for 2 at 7 PM, two nights prior. Then a third girl decided she could make our Chicago trip, and I had no problem modifying the reservation online and bumping the reservation to a table for 3 at 7:30 PM. We arrived at the restaurant 30 minutes early and asked the hostesses if she thought we could get a table early. She said to come back around 7:20 PM and it shouldn't be a problem. We managed to get a table in the bar area while we waited with some wine. We got up in 5 minute increments to check on our table, each time the hostess looked surprised and confused that we kept 'bothering' her. She told us that there were "two tables ahead" of us - which doesn't make any bloody sense if I had a confirmed reservation. Ultimately we lost our bar table and stood around awkwardly until they finally seated us - at 7:45 PM.  *One of my girlfriends overheard one of the hostesses mention that had forgotten our reservation. There was never a single apology or acknowledgement whatsoever for the delay.  3) "Overpriced and mediocre food": The food wasn't bad, but it WAS overpriced based on what you got. If you're going to charge me Jeff Ruby's (regional) or Ruth's Chris (chain) prices, I'm expecting food of that quality. My girlfriends ordered an asparagus/prosciutto/arugula pizza (tasty, but dry); duck sausage and squash risotto (great flavor but again dry and clumpy but the Arborio rice was still too crunchy, yikes); some pasta and prosciutto dish (forgettable, none of us thought it was great). We also had bread: the sliced baguette and the rye with golden raisins were COLD and served with ice-hard butter, but tasty; the focaccia tasted like leftover pizza. However, all of this food was hearty and reasonably priced and decently tasty. But I am still underwhelmed by my entrée: I ordered the 12-oz. filet mignon, med-rare ($45). It came with just a side salad, which was a complete joke: tossed salad, topped with sliced mushrooms and mushy chopped tomatoes and a side of bottled bleu cheese dressing. COME. ON. The steak was perfectly seasoned, but looked almost forlorn squatting alone on its plate. It was inconsistently cooked, as some parts were perfect and other parts were grey and way over-cooked (well done).  However, our server "Frank" was very friendly and eager-to-please, which was a nice change from the female staff downstairs in the bar area. The only area of irritation was when another server brought our check (this is a no-no in my book for an "upscale steakhouse"), didn't ask if we wanted it split (we're all generous and friendly types but again, COME ON) and we just sat there for another 10 minutes before I flagged our original server down and had to request that the check be split.   4) "Indeterminate atmosphere that is simultaneously tacky and snooty": The outdoor seating looked nice, with good heat lamps (too cold for us three still). Downstairs looks like a ritzier Applebee's bar with provocatively dressed cocktail waitresses with wildly teased hair; the upstairs dining area was aiming for "upscale" steakhouse (white linen cloths, etc.), with what appeared to be an all-male waitstaff and some sort of equestrian theme. The equestrian theme was a joke, as we are all from Kentucky and noticed that a sign for Keeneland was spelled "Keenland."  I can only assume that TOR is as busy as it is because it is located in a touristy, high-profile locale (Viagra Triangle, no less).

Good restaurant that has different variety of food. All their dishes are cooked to the point where you can taste all the ingredients. I have tried their burgers, steaks and salads and liked them all. It's a good place to have a quick bite while shopping in the Windy City.

My mother, husband and I visited this establishment the end of August for lunch. I had pizza, my mother had chicken and my husband had the tuna filet sandwich. All was great. We had a seat on the lower level near a window and really enjoyed people watching while dining. Will definitely return!
Great happening atmosphere,  tempted by the tomahawk rib eye but settled for the new York strip...  Great cut of meat and our waitress was the best I have ever had...

Went there recently with my family had a very good steak dinner with some good sides shared at the table.  The steak was very well prepared and exactly what I wanted.  All the sides were good but the mash potatoes which were just warm.  We all got salads included with the steak dinners and they were very good.  The sides were all extras for about $8 to $9 each.  They served a few so not bad.  We had a few appetizers, the tuna, Calamari, hummus and all were good.  Overall the food was very good, the service was also very good and the dinner steaks (filets) were excellent.  Highly recommend, my only issues are overall prices are on the high side and for a couple with drinks, wine and appetizer and main meal your maybe at $200 or so. Vince D

Food was great, waiter was horrible. He ruined the experience for our whole group.  First, misled two of my friends when they asked to split a pasta. He said it would be around the same price for two smaller  plates but it was actually the same price so they ended up getting charged double. He also got their order wrong so as we received all of our food, they had to wait to be served again. After a lot of back and forth we paid and I gave him a large bill to pay. He gave me back an incorrect amount and we assume he did this on purpose thinking he'd get away with it.  Would be willing to try again but feel like we should have gotten a meal for free.
Great ambiance, happy hour is a must. Fridays while the fall is still warm, can't pick a better place! Cheers!!

Just another amazing Stefani restaurant. I always enjoy the filet mignon or surf and turf. Timeless decor and waiters make for a pleasant experience. Plus, nothing tops having a few on the patio. One of my favorite outdoor spots for summer.

Um NO! Took my bf here for his birthday after reading the raving 4 1/2 star reviews on Yelp! I've also been here on my own for drinks and it's always a live atmosphere. Lots of trendy people, old, young, business savvy, socialites, and regular! Now I've had good food, especially good steaks and this place does not fit that mold! Blah!  The one star is only for the amazing service from a great waitress who was sweet and attentive.  The food was crap- basic to say the least. Our bread was stale! Longhorn steak has better steak than this place. My salmon was dry and drinks were so-so. For the 160 I spent I should've went to Capital Grille or Chicago Cut!  Will not be returning.

Stayed in Chicago for a long week. Had Lots of nice meals but Tavern On Rush was easily a favorite. Great dinner, lots of menu items, service is very good. 4 -1/2 stars easy.  If you have never been there, go.

Hip place but not trendy. Great location with great upscale people. Cool spot to grab a bite to eat and hang out with girls. Single ladies, come here! Educated, Succussful men usually hang around here. Saw Terrance Howard here too. Food is ok. Biggest Plus? It's by Barney's.

Extremely dissapointed with the experience I had at Tavern on Rush.  Lets start with the service, which was the worst of the experience.  Our server looked as if he had not showered in weeks. We did not want him anywhere near our food.  He was cold and unfriendly.  He did not go over any of the specials of the night with us nor did he present the cuts of meat to our table which is a standard at Tavern AND two people in our party ordered steaks.  Our drinks and food were basically thrown at us, the whole time it felt very rushed. Next the food, I was extremely disappointed with the food as I had heard unbelievable reviews about Tavern.  We ordered the calamari and potsickers to start.  Although the potsickers came out 5 minutes after we ordered them (possibly even faster, no joke) they were cold in the center.  Two people in our party ordered the filets and a side of the white cheddar au gratin potatoes for the table.  These items were just about the only thing enjoyable during our experience.  I ordered the 12 oz lobster tail.  The lobster came out over cooked.  It was very chewy and did not have the type of crunch bite that shellfish is supposed to have. We did not even waste our time on dessert.  I emailed Tavern on Rush after our poor dining experience (about 3 weeks ago) and I still have not received a response.  Pretty terrible customer service if you ask me.

Service fast and prompt. Oyster Rockerfeller were super tasty. Lobster cobb salad actually had lobster meat in it.  The salad was huge...my husband and I shared.  My son had a burger.  Not sure what it tasted like because he ate it in like 43 seconds.  Teen boys....ya know.  My daughter had a salad and Italian Wedding soup.  Both were tasty.

Went here for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. It was beautiful outside, and the patio seating is great on a nice day. Even at 1pm, they were still serving brunch food in addition to their regular menu. My friend got the corned beef hash of the brunch menu which he rated as one of the best he has ever had. I had the angus burger with cheese and grilled onions on top and it was one of the best burgers I have had. Combine our satisfying food experiences with great service and a reasonable price and Tavern gets 5 stars from me!  You should make reservations if you do not want to wait more than 30 mins for a table for lunch. Also, fyi I believe reservations are almost a necessity for dinner. This place serves expensive meats and is in a fancy area on Rush street, but it has plenty of affordable options too, especially at lunch time. Check it out!

Came here for dinner and sad to say I did not enjoy this place at all. Coming from Florida, I was expecting the food to be amazing, the bread they give you was cold. I had the seared tuna as an appetizer and that was ok. For my entrée I order the filet mignon which honestly looked like a burger patti and did not even taste like it should. Highly disappointed!
Stop here and get a cocktail at the bar if your husband's out of town on business or you want to chat up a bored woman who's husband is out of town on business. The cocktails are poured heavy.
Always a nice crowd. The place to be seen if you sit outside,  beautiful patio.  Good menu.
Go go go ! Prosciutto and Arugula Pizza, Killer Spinach Salad with warm bacon dressing and a spunky midwestern waitress. Very fun for lunch and great proximity to the Thompson.

Had dinner outside on a warm Sunday evening. Their estimated wait time is always less than what they say which is good. Got seated next a very loud table which was disappointing. The tables on the Bellevue side are crammed way too tight. We had to constantly keep moving our chairs and even get up a few times to let wait staff get by and let people out.  Ran out of oysters at 7:00. Ordered special Hawaiian Opa with lobster. Fish was disappointing and bland and didn't realize lobster was deep fried. For $42 not a good choice. Manager came around later to ask how we liked everything.  I told her honestly that it wasn't very good.  Response was "I'm sorry" and that was it.  Waitress was very much on autopilot and not overly friendly or attentive. My last experience here was very poor on the service side as well.  I always really liked it here from both service and food quality but it seems to be going downhill.

Came here for happy hour on Friday. The outdoor patio was nice, great to people watch. The drinks were reasonably priced and were strong. For food, my friend and I split the Caprese Salad, Tuna Tartare, and Grilled Calamari. The Calamari was really awesome. Most places just deep fry the hell out of it but this was delicious. The other food was good too. Our waitress was almost annoyingly attentive and it was quite apparent that she wanted us to purchase as much alcohol as we could or would, consume. But overall, it was a nice experience and I will definitely return.

We showed up as a party of six. They sat us at a normal table for four plus one extra chair that didn't even fit at the table. I said "this is a small table of four with one chair on the side. We asked for a table of six."  They wouldn't let us sit two people at the two top next to us. We left.
Very nice place, had a really Good time here. The food was excellent,  our waiter was amazing, that Chardonnay was delicious, them shrimp. And those. SCALLOPS was Amazing

Their manager is racist! They made us wait for more than an hour and then when our turn came they gave our table to someone who had just shown up. When we questioned the manager, he was completely unapologetic and rude, and his answer was "I just decided to give them the table ahead of you -- so what, it's my choice". This was the worst behavior I has ever seen at a restaurant. Completely unacceptable. Would never recommend this place to anyone.

This place is adorable! Sitting outside looks SO nice with great people-watching, and the wait was only 20-30 minutes in the middle of the day. Still, we didn't feel like waiting so we got a great table upstairs by the windows.  Two of our salads were awesome (the fresh spinach salad and the Azteca salad FTW!!) but the Ceasar was pretty boring (I guess they always are). I thought it was really affordable and the server-- and especially the host-- was nice. Two minor problems: the breadsticks were stale and bleh. No oil or butter or anything? Was that looked over or is that always the case? It also took quite awhile to get/pay the check. But still minor-- we liked it!

Food was absolutely phenomenol.  Started off with the sea food tower; it was amazing and extremely fresh. The filet oscar was also one of the best I've ever had. Service was great; wait staff very attentive, friendly and professional. Prices were not over the top but needless to say is a high price point. I highly recommend Tavern on Rush.

The inside bar was great! Service was great! Fun atmosphere.  Food was great outside however the server was awful! I had to tell him a salad came with mine and he brought the salad and food the same time! He said he didn't know he worked lunch shifts usually. Thankfully we brought our drinks from the bar because he never offered us another. Very sad. I visit most Fridays so I'll be back hopefully I don't get that server!

Nice place, friendly staff all the way from the hostess to the waiter and the bus staff.  Their service and attention was top notch.  Our party of 16 was seated and the waiter split the bill for everyone without asking specifics down to each couple. Food was ok.  We were there during national oyster day and it was $1 oysters.  Granted this is a steak place so it's understandable but these were some of the weakest oysters I've ever seen. We left a bunch on the platter that didn't look right.  But again...$1 oysters...can't complain there too much.  Otherwise nice location and a vibrant atmosphere.

How this has a 3.5 rating on Yelp is insane. The food is so bad--bland, boring, overcooked. It's poorly prepared bar food at boutique prices. This place is simply a testament to how many Chicagoans are somehow living very well despite being complete idiots.

We went to Tavern on Rush for breakfast.  They have a great menu and it's a busy place in the am.  The wait was long for outdoor seating so we ate inside but realized once inside  that one side of the restaurant has large doors open to outside so it wasn't too different being inside.  We started with bloody Mary's that were delicious - a little spice with fresh horseradish and great garnish (celery, olives, peppers & pickled onions) - yummy!  I had a scramble of eggs, goat cheese, sundried tomatoes, spinach and ground turkey.  All the tastes combined nicely and it was hearty.  It came with sliced home fried potatoes and I added an English muffin (in hindsight I would have just substituted the potatoes for toast like my husband did),  he had a build your own omelet which wasn't on the menu but was no problem.  It was my husband's birthday so the waitress brought out a complimentary tiramisu which looked good but we declined partly because we were full and partly because my husband hates coffee (so tiramisu is ng).  We apologized but it was a nice touch.   We really enjoyed this place and look forward to coming back next time in Chicago.

I stopped in last night for drinks with some friends. Our server was very delightful. The drinks were a bit strong, but expertly crafted. To my surprise, Mondays are Ladies Nights, and as you walk in the door, you sign up for a raffle that includes: 3rd place- a bottle of Dom Perignon, 2nd place- $250 gift card, and 1st place- a pair of Christian Loubotin heels!! The crowd was fun and everyone was very dressed up. They had quite a list of night specials to accompany the setting. We ordered a $15 bottle of Pinot Grigio, and a $7 12" thin crust brick oven baked pepperoni pizza, and OMG was it delicious!

Excellent everything!  Their steaks are among the best in the business.  Their seafood is cooked perfect...variety offered.  Their location and seating is as good as it gets.  Great service along with excellent food.

Oh! Tavern On Rush! The place that can make you feel like a king of the world or a bag of dirt, depends in what car you've pulled in.       Let's start with the food. The food is good. I wouldn't say that the fish is better than at Hugo's, that the stake is better than at Gibson's, or that pasta is better than homemade pasta at Piccolo Sogno, but their pizza is great! But again - you have to really try to f.. up your pizza.      Service - pleasing to the eye, thats for sure! The hostesses are 6 feet tall and the girls in the bar area have just walked out from the cover of Sports Illustrates, but sometimes, they can forget that they are in the service industry and that the customer is always right.     The managers have their own secret system of checking on customers dining experience. First, I thought it was every third table, or so. But no! They check on the 'special guests' only. One weekend I had dinner with my 'regular' friends and the next evening I sat with the 'not-so-regular' friends and trust me, the difference is significant! I was even granted a GM's card and to my surprise it was not gilded. No '2 hour limit at the patio,' no 'full dinner must be ordered at the patio'! At Tavern On Rush, just like in real life, rules and regulations were created for regular people.       Interesting, but when you go to places like Hugo's, you receive the best dining experience regardless of the color of your credit card. But Tavern On Rush is too arrogant to realize that sometimes oligarchs wear slippers and cotton t-shirts.  Tavern On Rush has it's circle of people who it serves. So if you planned a dinner at Tavern On Rush, be prepared to chug your hot soup and don't count of seeing those girls smile at you, because you're not that special.

Tavern on Rush has many memories for us. Corporate dinners, drinks with friends, anniversaries, etc.  It seems to always be packed with people and everyone seems to be having a great time. It has a great Chicago feel. The food is always good, the drink menu is interesting without being obscure, and the menu offers a variety of choices far beyond just steaks. The outside patio is the best spot to sit and watch the world go by. The big booths upstairs are great for an intimate dinner. And they are one of the few places that still has matchbooks - which I collect but with the decline in smoking most restaurants don't have them anymore.

Beautiful atmosphere here. They have lovely patio where you can sit and enjoy your meal or drinks outside. Friends took me here while vacationing to Chicago and I loved it! The carbanora is amazing, and there fried calamari very good to. I also had a chocolate cake fro dessert, which I do not remember the name but was delicious. They have very good martinis here and the location is fabulous! Its a bit noisy at night but that what make it have such good energy!

Walked by last night and a server said to the hostess.."I didn't think we were seating in my area anymore and now we are seating the scum of the earth ??" Really disgusting to hear the staff talk about their customers like that in front of others who are walking by. The guy had a blonde mustache FYI. Didn't know waiters judged paying customers... This place is such a joke. I wish it would just close.

Food was mediocre but it's got a vibrant vibe and nice outdoor seating area. I've been for both dinner and brunch. Here are some highlights: Seared ahi tuna dinner- good quality fish but bland flavors Side of corn- playful side dish with cheese and a bit of spice Oak street scramble- pretty good! A bit too much spinach and the goat cheese was all in one section but had some fresh flavors Enjoy!

Renewed  Faith in the tavern. Went there last night after work alone for some wine I have lived in the area over 3 years and always went there to sit with the gentleman behind the bar I thought it was great. However I have  regretted returns in the recent few years..And really I tried, usually once every few months I would decide to give it another shot and many times ended up just leaving.  Bartenders would ignore us, walking past For 10, 15  minutes at a time and Treat individual requests as a nuisance.  Its the service industry, that's the only job is making sure customers receive good service. Just a note to self I guess.  This time was different Julie at the bar makes me want to become a weekly Regular, every chance I get I will swing in or plan to meet people there As opposed to other places in the area, the food selection is better there is something for everyone and the prices are reasonable. Go in Tuesdays and get grade a treatment from Julie at the bar.  best hummus in the area, decent wine list. Give it a shot again.
how many dumb blondes does it take to figure out a reservation? apparently 3.  good food but hostesses are idiots and rude.

It was our last night in Chicago and were celebrating at the Tavern! We had reservation so no issues there. We sat upstairs and looked over the menu... our waiter was cool as beans... It was 8 of us...we all ordered different things and the consensus was pretty much the same. GREAT food. Large portions and good drinks too! I had the grilled chicken meal w/ baked sweet potatoes, and chipotle mac and cheese -awwww man was this delicious!  I had the peach sangria which was refreshing as well. We laughed, bugged out w/ the waiter who likes Brooklyn, NY haha and just chilled for the rest of the meal. Service was great, fast, and pleasant!
Good food, great atmosphere, awesome people watching if sitting outside. Be sure to have a reservation, very busy.

We were there yesterday.have to say - this place has really gone down. From the hostess who thought she was hot stuff and couldn't takedown a phone number correctly - so we missed our call waiting for a table to the server who incorrectly put in our breakfast order. This isn't heart surgery. Not impressed- won't go here again... Plenty of other places in the city that want your business.

Nice variety of food on menu. Good service, great scene and great outdoor seating in summer. Food has good flavor. We all had steaks that were cooked perfectly. The Oyster rockfellers were delicious. The sides could be better still good.

Still a great place for tourists, but don't show up without a reservation! We went for a late lunch, which meant lots of empty tables in the bar area. Sounds like it would work out, right?! Nope.  There were about 6 or 7 servers running around, but it took us 10 minutes after we were seated to get water, and then another 10 minutes before a waitress showed up. She was nice, but hard to flag down. A quick lunch took waaaaay too long. Maybe it's the way the tables are set up at the bar, but the service is pretty lame.
Went for lunch and just as good! Always great food! Tons of people watching!  The filet mignon and salmon are favorites!  Great menu and service!

This place is a great place to take visitors or to start a fun night. I was on business traveling and went there with my co-workers. There were 5 of us and we had no reservation. While the place was super with an approximate wait I 1 1/5 hours the AMAZING hostess Emma, ran around the entire restaurant trying to find a way to accommodate us. She was super helpful and very pleasant to deal with. She set us down in less than 30 minutes!!! The food was awesome. I got the seafood tower and the filet and both were to die for.  Even if you don't get a table, just sitting by the bar is a lot of fun. Again, a great place to start a great night, I would just make sure to make reservations.

Great ambiance, great service, and great food! We were in town for a convention & this place came highly rec'd by one of our co-workers who used to live in Chicago.We also had a client dinner so that always makes for a nice night out on the town.  Also, Ladies, there are a plethora of older men here that will hit on you at the bar, as it should be...in the Viagra Triangle. Definitely make a reservation as this place was VERY busy, even on a Wednesday night. They had a boat load of outdoor seating as well. Their bar is open & airy, with a rotating pair of Louboutins in the center???  I got 2 sugar free RedBull and cherry vodkas before we sat for dinner and they did it nicely with Effen Black Cherry Vodka & added some actual black cherries to the drink. We ordered way too much food, but here's what we got 1- appies- seared tuna and steamed dumplings- both very good 2- salads- I didn't even need this 3- Halibut-  co-worker only kind of liked this b/c it paled in comparison to the steak 4- 40 day dry aged steak-that delicious piece of meat was the clear winner of the night....I had food envy!  Thankfully my client shared! 5- Chateaubriand- WAY too much food here- I mean there was like a 12 oz filet and another 12 ozs of meat as well on top of a BOAT load of grilled veggies. It was very, very good, but way too much food for one person. 6- Side of Mexican corn-also very good Our bill was well over $600 for 4 people....eeks! Totally would go back!

Great spot for people watching!  That is the only positive thing I can say.  Outdoor seating is crammed and food previously dropped under our table was not picked  up.  The pizzas we had were ok at best, but we expected more.  Waitress was not attentive to us at all, and we had to wait a half hour before getting our drinks refilled.  We had a great day in Chcago, but we picked the wrong restaurant.
Very poor service. Waitress never came around to ask how things were or refills. Pizza tasted like cardboard..With so many other dining options in area will not be back

We've been to Tavern a few times for brunch.  My husband likes their pancakes.  Today my caesar salad was good, but nothing remarkable.  The downside:  they bring the bottles of water to the table, but they are not freezing cold, so after a little while they start to get warm.  Need to ask for a glass of ice.  Also, the soup is just OK.  They have tomato bisque and the soup of the day.  I always get the soup of the day, and it is always the lobster bisque. (I see someone posted a picture of it here.)  I never had the tomato bisque, but I am willing to bet that it is the tomato bisque with some lobster meat on top.  It always tastes the same, and it is always too salty (I read this in another review by someone else too.).  Truly, if you can't change up your soups regularly, one has to wonder if they are ever homemade.  I doubt if they are, so it makes you wonder how much of the other food is canned or frozen wherever possible.  From some of the other reviews, it sounds like even the steaks may not be the best quality, and a lot of food is cold or not fresh.  Service is just OK, but sometimes my husband has to ask for coffee refills.  They should pare down the menu and change it up somewhat, and focus on improving service and food quality.

********************* 1103 ********************        When I was living on Cedar Street, we lived literally half block from this restaurant, a perfect spot for people watching. located on the famous N. Rush Street & E. Bellevue Place. There's tons of restaurants around this area, Golden Triangle :-) fancy fast cars, older man and younger women, want to see and be seen. You know the thrill.         The bar is happening when games are on. Nice bartender, decent drinks, food is typical, but you can skip it. Service is OK.

The hostess was forcefully friendly told us we all had to order an entre...I waited  20 minutes and did not gear her say that to anyone else. She mentioning it again our table was ready, we said OK but when we sat down the waiter said he had never heard that policy. The hostess and the management are racists and negligent and are a sad excise for a staff.
Ordered a Moscow Mule and it was not made correctly.  Waitresses had attitudes and looked like they were pissed to be working there.  Smile people. Just smile.

Bottom line- No thank you! We came here on a Saturday night as a back up after a failed dinner reservation at another restaurant. It was going to be a 2 hour wait for a table in the dining area so we just sat at a table in the bar area since there was no wait there. It was super crowded and loud in the bar area, but the service was decent. The food however was far from decent.  My order was especially disgusting. Do NOT get the ribeye steak sandwich. This is by the far the worst steak sandwich I've ever had! The bread tasted like it was the leftovers from a grocery store, and the steak just didn't even taste like steak. And the fries that it came with were completely soggy. Absolutely horrible meal.   My mom's order was okay, which is why I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1. She had the blackened cajun shrimp appetizer. The shrimp were over cooked and they were definitely overpriced for the little amount of food on the plate, but at least this dish had good flavor.  There are way better restaurants in the area, so skip this place! The short wait at the bar isn't worth the poor quality of food!
I came here with some friends and sat at the bar. The food was great. I had a pepperoni and mushroom pizza and a bloody mary that was made to perfection.

Yawn. I made a reservation and went there with a friend. When I got there, the hostess told me that all of the reservations were for the top room, and that all of the tables both downstairs on the main level and the patio were first come first serve and couldn't be reserved. That being said I did see some tables on the main level with 'reserved' on it. I sat downstairs because that's where the action is. The waitress was clearly overworked.  We ordered mojitos and they were just wrong. There was no crushed ice and mint, it was almost like a vodka tonic and not refreshing at all.  I ordered a salad and a seared tuna entree, but the entire order was wrong -- first I was given a salad with tuna on top, and then the appetizer with ahi tuna, twice, I was just exhausted at that point and cancelled the order.  The tuna was really good, but the caesar salad with mediocre and the dressing was just wrong. Way too much mayonnaise.  All together, crowded, bland food and loud atmosphere. There are a lot of girls walking around with badly damaged platinum hair and spray tans.

If you're so uptight you can crack walnuts with your ass, this is not the place for you. Yes it is where old, rich, men bring their hot 20 something girlfriends. Yes it is in the "Viagra Triangle". It's still fun and a good time. Weekends it's usually packed. The service ranges from amazing to horrible, usually based on the crowd, who you are and how you treat the staff (like most places). I "LOL" at all the people giving this place 1 star. If you want to have a fine dining experience with 5 star service and a quiet, sleepy atmosphere - go to one of the 1000 places in Chicago offering that. If you want to party and grab a bite to eat, watch the game and people watch, or just grab a drink with friends outside at an awesome people watching patio - come here. If you're boring - stay home. Please. For all our sake.

This place has The Worst Service and Food in the whole Chicago Area, you could go to any McDonalds and still get a better service than this place. We came here a week ago for my friends birthday. And we sat in the Bar areas' long table. It was a huge mistake!!! If you're not an old male with a suit, dont expect to be treated well here. Our waitress was so Rude and unfriendly, that it almost seemed like she was racially labeling us. Forget about smiley face, she was not happy to have us as her customers, but when she went to other tables, (with older guys) she was smiling like a clown and clapping like a zoo seal.  The food and the drink were mediocre. Nothing was out of the ordinary. At the end of our dinner, we told our waitress that it was our friend's birthday and maybe she can get her a birthday cake or something. Not only it took her 45 minutes to bring out a cake, but when she brought it to our table, she literally threw it infront of my friend, gave us the nastiest look, turned around and left. She did not even say Happy Birthday! We did not want to be bad Spirited on our friend's birthday so just smiled and ignored her attitude. Then we asked this waitress girl to take our picture and Guess What, She Bluntly said NO and left again!!!Then we asked another server girl to take our picture and she Said She cant too!!! So freaking Rude and Mean.  This is a Horrible Horrible Place with Full of Nasty Rude Hypocrites.

I had the scrambled egg on asiago for brunch. It is on their seasonal spring menu. To be honest, it fell below my expectations. The scrambled eggs were bland. It came with a side of breakfast potatoes that were also bland and not crunchy. Let's just say I had to use a lot of ketchup and mustard to make up for the lack of flavor in this meal.  The one redeeming part of the meal was my apricot strawberry mint smoothie.
Good location and environment but the food is subpar. Had a Kobe Burger that was dry and uninspiring.

Loved coming to this place on the weekend for Breakfast. Amazing service and an awesome breakfast. Very strong and delicious coffee. They were very accommodating and we will be going there again and again while we are on our trip. I would recommend the stuffed French toast.

Tavern on Rush is in an area of Chicago known as Viagra Triangle.   So when my group of 8 was seated, it was funny when I saw a couple tucked away in a booth.  Dude was old with a young hot woman.   This place is well-recognized, and on a Thursday night was crowded and in full swing.    I couldn't take eating more meat, so I went for a salmon dinner special they had.   The fish was dried out in some spots, which I felt was inexcusable given the price they charge.   One of my friends had the same problem with her salmon.   Others at the table ordered steak, commenting that their steaks were overcooked.   For such a recognized place with high prices, how come they can't get the food right?

We decided to enjoy the beautiful weather and wanted a place where we could sit outside. When we got to the restaurant there were at least over five open tables outside. When we spoke with the hostess she explained to us that if we wanted a table, we could NOT just order appetizers and drinks, we had to order a full dinner meal. It was 4pm and there was no wait.  Considering the restaurant was not packed and the dinner rush was not suppose to start until 5pm, I did not understand how they could require someone to order dinner. We could have easily spent a lot more money if we just ordered appetizers and drinks. Ridiculous! Horrible horrible management decision. We went to Luxbar next door instead. I don't think I'll be going back to Tavern on rush anytime soon!

I've been here a couple times, and only had good experiences. The food is VERY good, and the service is excellent. Both parties I came with also gave high remarks. I would definitely recommend Tavern to anyone.

Should be called Tavern on Rushed. Three of us spent $500 dollars here on dinner and the entire time we felt rushed by the staff. The bussers kept trying to grab our plates while we were still eating. Although we told the waiter we wanted to take our time between courses, he kept pushing us to order. The restaurant was not crowded and we were a quiet group, so there was no reason for this, and our total time there was only an hour and a half. It felt like we were dining in a cash-only diner the way the plates were thrown at us and quickly yanked away. As for the food, it was fine, but not worth what we spent. We won't be back.

Asked for a Manhattan on the rocks, came up.  Oh well.  After two sips, noticed a small crack in the martini glass.  Brought it to my server's attention, she returned with what was clearly my same drink, shaken with more ice in a new glass.  I got not only a watered down drink, but if there was glass in the liquid, it'd still be there.  Poor from from a place I once considered classy...
Great location, but the food is nothing special. if you want better food just go to Luxbar next door.

Went here Friday after a conference I attended (was highly recommended by a couple of people I spoke with). The location is amazing, being surrounded by equally great steak houses and shopping. The interior was stylish and while others have said the crowd was "older", I personally felt it was simply more professional.  I was going to have dinner, but ended up mainly having drinks at the bar. The food I did see looked amazing and I regret not eating. It is on the list for the next time I am in town.  The bar was really chic and the drinks were great. Bartenders were on top of their game and I truly enjoyed the vibe. I'll 100% go back and eat the next time for sure.

If there is one thing about Chicago I will miss when I move from here, it will be the steaks. Something about the Midwest, y'all know how to cook your cows... I like to think of myself as a foodie, but deep down inside, I'll take a huge sizzling hunk of meat over a froufrou plate any day. I've been to just about all of the steakhouses in Chicago, New York and Miami, and in my opinion, Tavern on Rush has the best steaks I've ever had. Consistently. It is high grade, tender, marbleized, aged, and cooked to perfection with the right touch of seasoning and a delicately crispy char on the outside that makes my mouth water as I type this review. Sometimes I get a filet, sometime I feel like a rib-eye... I'm never disappointed.  The service is professional and very helpful with any questions you may have and prompt with food, drinks, water, bread and check.  The decor is spacious for a steakhouse, no bumping seats or elbows here, but the floor is strategically arranged, so that you feel somewhat tucked away in your own space. It's decorated like a horse betting house and there are names of some of the famous racehorses written on the walls which is a creative and still elegant theme. On warmer weather days, the upstairs balcony windows can be opened to overlook the socialites and gawkers of Rush's Viagra triangle making for some fun people watching as you dine. Bottom line: the best steak I've ever had.

Not the most creative brunch menu, but it's definitely solid.  I like how you can order off of the main menu too.  It's a great spot to come in the summer b/c of the outdoor seating.  The menu is huge, and the portions are even bigger.   If you room for dessert, ask for a half portion.  That's still a healthy portion for your group.

I recently started working in the area - I've been taken to lunch a couple times this week. I'm so so disappointed. I used to come here for dinner all the time... And now I leave just unhappy. Maybe it's the lunch menu? Salads are weak - ingredients always look pre-made with horrible dressing options. Gibsons puts them to shame. Take some pride in your food items - even as a hot commodity to the loop.

Normally love this place. Sat in the bar. Server Jennifer ignored us the whole time. Had to get my own menus. Had to go to the bar for an extra wine glass. We saw the server in the section next to ours 10 times more than our own.

Fantastic breakfast burrito! Not so fantastic service though... I loved everything about this place except the service. The patio was perfect on the rare sunny day we were there, the burrito was tasty, my boyfriend's skirt steak was juicy enough, and the people watching was top notch. However, our server was suspiciously missing for the first 20 minutes of us sitting down. Good thing we weren't in a hurry. A steak knife for the skirt steak was suspiciously absent as well, and the meat wasn't tender enough to cut with a butter knife. All in all the atmosphere and the food was just enough to make up for the service. The burrito was really good, which its guacamole creaminess and sprinkle of Chihuahua cheese. You just cannot beat the people watching in Viagra Triangle either and Tavern On Rush is the perfect place to seen and be seen, inside the dining room or outside on the spacious patio. Just don't expect a quick table time.

My boyfriend and I finally made it to Tavern since we live in the condos around the corner. Today was finally nice enough to sit outside, so we decided to give it a chance.... WORSE EXPERIENCE EVER! I wish I could give negative stars to reflect the level of poor service we put ourselves through. Yeah, our bad choice to go there.  The waitress was nice at first, then decided to forget that we were even there. We never got the complimentary bread that the other tables got. Then, a big group of obnoxious younger people decided to keep adding more and more friends and basically taking over our personal space while shouting at each other. I feel like if we had been at a different restaurant, they would've either moved them to a bigger table or would have asked us if we wanted to move or if we were comfortable. This didn't happen.  Not only were we ignored by our waitress, we had to box our own food even though everyone else's food was boxed for them. Not once did she come to ask us if we needed anything or if our food was ok.  My boyfriend wanted to complain, but I didn't let him. I didn't want to ruin my sunny Sunday. I should've let him.  If you are BROWN and don't look like you can afford to live in the area (even though you DO live there and can certainly pay to eat out) don't go to Tavern. They will treat you like shit and like you shouldn't be there in the first place. Lastly, we waited over 45 mins for our check. I kept giving her the "I'm ready for my check" look but she ignored me and my bf. she honestly didn't want anything to do with us. It was really beyond ridiculous. The hardest part is that we are both educated, well-mannered people. We treat people with respect and expect that back.  So, moral of the story: If you enjoy good service, properly dressed waitresses, good food, and no discrimination DO NOT GO TO Tavern On Rush. You're not missing out on anything spectacular. Just mediocre food with terrible service to not make up for.

Given todays beautiful wether my girlfriend and I decided to try Tavern on Rush. To start our experience we were surprised by their reasonable wait and thoughtful use of technology, which made the 1 hour wait seem very short.  After we received the text message our table was ready we were promptly sat and our drink order was taken. They have an excellent selection of coffee and espresso drink which i recommend (to go). Next our food order was taken and around that time the table next to us decided to add another person to their 4 person table, this made our experience very uncomfortable, I had to have brunch at a 2 person table with the back of another person right on top of our table. The tables are clearly arranged to accommodate the designated number of seats at each table. from here the experience continued to plummet. The table next to us began to get louder and louder and not once did a manager or our server ask if we'd like to move when there was clearly a problem. The food wasn't anything special and my french toast was cold. not once did I have my coffee freshened or water refilled. finally we waited for more than 30 minutes for our bill and after paying it took 15 minutes to get our check back.  The worst part is our server seemed very personable and courteous to every patron minus our table. I know we look young but it seems they didn't want to give us proper service. way to ruin my sunday afternoon Tavern. We won't be back.

I have been here a few times and came tonight because I was able to secure a 1000 open table point reservation. You can't go wrong with this place if you just want a nice dinner in the Gold Coast. Service is old school with being quick, respectful, and attentive.  Drinks were out quicker than counting to 10 and food was made correctly. I had never been upstairs but was spacious enough to bring a large party group.  I would definitely consider this restaurant if you want to get away from the River North hype.

I went here for brunch on Sunday. I had the breakfast burrito with apple chicken sausage, it was soooooo good. I had also tried the breakfast pizza, which was amazing, and i loved the fact that the sodas were served in bottles. Kinda felt a little nostalgic. We sat upstairs and the view of the city was nice to look at. Also our server was very attentive and friendly. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the Chicago area.

I absolutely love Tavern on Rush and love the location of the restaurant. We always go there in a summer time, where you can grab a table outside to enjoy the scenery and great food. Staff is very nice and friendly!!!
By far my favorite steak house in Chicago this far. From the bar to the dining room everything was delicious, atmosphere was great and service was perfect.

Ate at the bar with a friend and had a perfect time.  Weather was extremely cold (-13) so there were not many people around.  We started at the bar and ended up sitting there drinking martini's and wine while looking at the massive bar.  We also had the steak sandwich.   Bartenders are informative and responsive. Went back in October with some clients, this time sitting upstairs.  Great steak and lots of interesting sides (not the normal Mortons or Ditkas).  Very friendly staff.  Not cheap, but definitely worth the $$$$ for a special event or to entertain.

This review is for Ladies night, held every Monday evening. The drink and food specials are great! I recommend one of the pizza dishes. Make sure to take your significant other with you to submit their name for the raffle drawing. Every week, the big raffle win is a pair of Christian Louboutin's. I'm definitely going to try and win it one of these days!!! I took one star off because I didn't win last time LOL.

Kristy & Tom are the BEST bartenders in The Gold Coast. Tavern is already known as a top spot in Chicago, however these two are the best. Classy & quick service. Always impressed and satisfied with them.

I came here with a friend last Saturday around 11 am and was pleasantly surprised to find no wait.  I love the atmosphere here-- Tavern on Rush is super cozy and casual enough to be comfortable but nice enough for a brunch date.  My friend and I were seated at a cute little 2 person hi-top and had great service. My friend and ordered an omelette and I got a salmon BLT-- my friend loved her eggs and my BLT was packed to the brim with salmon. I feel like anything would be good from here, totally recommend!
Lively busy spot. Good atmosphere in a cool part of town. Likely to pick a convo with someone at the bar.

My husband and I had dinner at Tavern on Rush Jan. 25, 2013. I have had dinner here several times with girlfriends, but this is the first time my husband has dined here. First we could barely read the menu with the very very dim lighting. Had to fold the menu in sections to get it next to the candle (can't believe I forgot I have a flashlight app on my phone) which made a huge difference when we were given the dessert menu. We ordered a bottle of wine ($55) which was very good. Husband had the small caeser salad which was large enough and he said it was very good. I ordered the wedge salad with iceburg lettuce instead of romaine as offered on the menu. Never had a wedge salad I didn't like, until this one. All of the components were separate on the plate so I had to essentially make my own salad and I did not care for the dressing at all. I had the ribeye chop and husband had the filet on the bone and we shared the augratin potatoes and grilled asparagus with hollandaise on the side. The steaks were cooked perfectly, and the potatoes, and asparagus were VERY good. The hollandaise was chilled and every time I have ordered hollandaise it was served warm which is much better. We ordered the big chocolate cake and it was BIG and very good. Coffee is just average. Total bill with tip was $275. Our server, Jodette, was very friendly and knowledgeable and service was outstanding. Note we mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary and our server congratulated us but there was no offer of a complimentary dessert etc. Everything was good, with the exception of the wedge salad and the cool hollandaise. If you don't want to travel to the city, Eddie Merlots is a great choice and one of our favorites.

For a place that serves glass bottled water and four types of complimentary bread even before the ritzy refreshment, I sure was underwhelmed by the actual dishes my party ordered. First of all, props to the waiter for overlooking my party's untypical casual apparel and youthful dispositions to treat us like the d-list celebs he is used to serving. He was fabulous.  I ordered the Angus burger and a glass of Pinot Grigio. I was awkwardly seated at the head of a table for 8, and kept getting bumped around by all the bus boys and food runners rounding our table. A grumbling tummy makes such misdemeanors almost unforgivable, but I managed;) The burger was super rich and possibly delicious to most, but unfortunately it was so very rich it gave me a stomach ache before I was even full. The fries were nothing special..  a bit dry and bland.The vanilla bread pudding I polished off was unparalleled. I want more. Now. If you are reading this review, understand that the bread pudding is not optional. It's so good. All in all, the main courses were decent. The service was hospitable. I didn't feel like the overall dining experience was worth what I paid for it, but it wasn't horrible. I probably won't come again until my wallet can justify 36 dollars on an "eh"meal.
Beautiful place.. attentive bar tender.  Will stop when its NOT winter and I can sit outside and enjoy the people watching.  The place is top notch.  Will return.

To be honest, I was disappointed with Tavern on Rush. I've driven by it so many times and, shockingly, had never checked the Yelp reviews (even before I made reservations here...), but figured that such a notable restaurant in the middle of the Gold Coast had to be great. So, I picked it for our small work holiday dinner this year. And I was embarrassed. First of all, shoulda read the reviews. The waitresses' attire in the bar area is enough to make you blush around your boss. Also, I realize that I am not an old male, but the waitress treated me as if I wouldn't tip, so why bother to give me reasonable service? As soon as the two men joined, it got better... Drinks aside, dinner was a letdown too. I did enjoy the fried calamari, but the shrimp cocktail and the veggie plate left something to be desired in the appetizer round. They didn't seem fresh, nor did they have anything special or different about them. My filet mignon was, to be fair, perfectly cooked, but I wished they had more options for preparation. I was in the mood for a nice peppercorn sauce or something a little spicy, but the only option I saw was Oscar style (don't get me wrong - I like that - but calories!). The sauteed spinach was REALLY good, but the other sides were not. I can't even figure out what was on top of the roasted corn; it looked like cheese that had once been frozen and then was plopped on top and barely reheated. I was excited for the garlic mashed potatoes but I think I could have made them better at home. The atmosphere upstairs wasn't helping anything, either. I felt like the gentlemen who were serving our table were disinterested and barely there. I may also be biased from past years' dinners, but our table location was not my favorite. We were at a circular table in the middle of the dining room. At other steakhouses, we've been able to have a large, secluded booth, which has been really nice.  Even though there were some high points with the food, I can't recommend coming here when I've had such stellar experiences at places like Kinzie Chop House, Benny's Chop House, and III Forks. I'd recommend those three over this place, any day.

Stop by on a Saturday afternoon after doing a charity event. I have never been here and I was glad I came. We ordered our drinks and browsed the menu. I was ready t pick out a burger when I seen a plate get dropped off at the table next to me. Another waitress stopped by and i asked what do they have? She said it was the Ribeye sandwich. Well i had to have that, it look delicious. Well once I got it and took a bite, that was all I needed. Stay away from me this is one damn good sandwich. I need to return here.

We were in the bar area and it was adorably decorated for the holidays. Huge fan of this. The service however was very slow and the waitress forgot my appetizer entirely. The spinach salad I had as my entree was quite good and they do a decent job on my dirty martini. However, if I were you, I would go around the corner to Lux Bar. I am partial however because they do a great dirty martini!

Great place to stop for a drink, catch a bite in the bar or have date night in the restraraunt.  The drinks are not a bargain, but the atmosphere is wonderful.  We grabbed a couple Irish coffees while we warmed up and watched the football game in the bar.  We've also been there in the summer for lunch and dinner and always enjoyed it.  If you start at the south end of the mile and end up at the north after a long day of shopping it's the perfect to grab a cocktail and bite before heading back down the other side.  The service has always been very good.

I have wanted to come here for years, but as you know. Gibsons is just across the street. Came here for a late lunch on a Saturday afternoon. I did not know they have a brunch menu on the weekends until 3. We had another server come and ask if someone had taken out drink order yet? That never happens! Aces to her! We had a couple of drinks and I asked for them to be tall. He brought them in a rocks glass. No problem, he's just going to have to make more trips! I ordered the turkey club as usual. It was quite huge when it came out. The avocado was a nice touch. But it was dry with very little mayo and came out on white bread. How innovative! The fries came out in a little fryer basket and they were nice and crispy. The slaw had a nice taste to it, but was on the dry side also. The bloody Mary's looked awesome and huge. My buddy had the ribeye and loved it. Great service and atmosphere.

This place was recommended to us by a family who grew up in Chicago. We went down to the city for the magnificent mile holiday light parade. We couldn't get reservations until 9:30PM. Once we got there we waited about 15 minutes to be seated. The service was excellent and the food was amazing! They have great portions and you definitely will not leave there hungry. We highly recommend Tavern on Rush to anyone.

A little bit of false advertising....I was in town on business and TOR was decided on for a business lunch. The website vs. reality is pretty misleading. I'm not sure if there was additional seating (another room or upstairs) we should have asked for but as far as my experience goes, the pics on the website are very different than where we were seated. Note: I consider myself a "burger and beer" type of guy and this is probably a good joint grab food with some friends or in a large group. I just feel a bit duped when I chose this establishment as a setting for a meeting. Also, the service was pretty bad. We went a solid 15 minutes from drinks being served to when we saw our waitress again. I will give the benefit of the doubt when a restaurant is busy, but in this instance the place was less than half filled. As far as the food, the kobe beef sliders were outstanding. The rest of the table said their food was "good, ok" (ranged from club sandwiches to salads, no other burgers or steak).
Great place to have a drink in the city.  A little pricey but it is what to expect downtown . Try it out. You will enjoy

While I was visiting Chicago people told me that I would have a great time at Tavern on Rush if I went at night. Great place for people watching. Bartenders were friendly and quick. The music isn't overpowering so it's easy to have a conversation. No dance floor but tons of interesting people. Worth a visit if you are looking for a bar that is going to be consistently busy.  One last thing. Our waitress Candy was amazing, she was funny and she totally fit the part, gave me some great advice on the area and next stops for the night.

Everything that you would expect from a steakhouse on rush street.  I had the pork chop and it was thick, medium rare and perfectly salted.  The char was prepared exactly the way I ordered it and all of the recommended vegetables were a great compliment to an exceptional piece of meat.  Our waiter added to the enjoyment of our meal and my water glass never got past half full.  I would have given them a 5 star if my gin and tonics came out with more gin in them.  I know it was a freehand pour but at a place like this you should have a stronger taste of booze in your cocktail.  I should have gone to my tried and true shot of gin with a tonic back and then I could have made my drink the way I like it.  Next time.

Tavern On Rush was recommended highly by a friend, and said it was a must visit while in the Windy City. So glad we came there. Great service by our waiter, and the food was superb. We had the blackened shrimp for an app, and our entree specials were a pork chop special, and fish special. We thoroughly enjoyed them.  We had  a dessert that had salted caramel gelato, which was by far the best I've ever had. We had a great time. Just be ready for a loud and vibrant atmosphere.

I want to rave about Carmen the bathroom attendant on 11-4-13. She is the only person in gosh # of years that has made me feel welcomed at Tavern. Normally I get the snooty attitude no matter how nice I am, Carmen transcends that. For whatever reason Carmen is the Cinderella of Tavern banished to the bathroom & sweet enough to go along with it for tips. Personally I think Tavern needs to step up and let her be an effective customer liaison or let another company snap her up. I honestly would snap her up in a second if I thought my company was a good fit. I would be overjoyed if she wanted to be a marketer or saleswoman for my company.

Went for drinks after dinner with a friend on Saturday evening November 2nd. The two blonde bar tenders chose not to make eye contact and server everyone around us. After 15 minutes of standing at the bar, still not able to get a drink while everyone around us had one. As an out of towner, it was highly recommended. I now highly recommend NOT!

The restaurants bar scene is an excellent mix of ages. The food is great and the restaurant is always consistent. The only negative comment is we had to wait an hour for our table without an explanation or check-in from the maître d.

This place is situated in the "Viagra Triangle" , perfectly named by the locals. The place has a really nice atmosphere and a good vibe. We didn't experience any food, however the dishes looked great.  The drinks are good and the service was just okay. If you are single and looking or married and looking, this would be a great hangout. I prefer a place with a little more substance. I would give it 2 1/2 stars.
Good service. Fresh delicious food. Large selection. Not super pricy considering the area. The upstairs is nicer than the downstairs.

Good service, good cocktails. Ordered pasta, which was a mistake. It was linguine with rock shrimp and broccoli in garlic and oil. No flavor - not in the shrimp, not in the sauce.  Shrimp were small and did not look/taste like rock shrimp. Had to add a ton of salt to make it edible. Others I was with seemed to enjoy their orders - the tuna tartar and the lobster cobb salad.

Quality bar/seafood and good drinks.  Had some really good grilled calamari and a pretty burger.  The waitress was really attractive and she was also attentive and nice.  Will be back next time I'm in town.

Wife and I love this place for the outdoor dining and the people watching in the summer.  Have never set foot in the dining room, but the bar and outside suit us just fine.  Solid, if unspectacular, cocktails.  Menu is diverse and pricey, but there are some hidden gems (pizza isusually good, so is the shrimp cocktail and most of the sandwiches).   Definitely better places to make your "destination" for dining ... unless except in the summer when you  can sit outside (2 hr limit, but have never been rushed as long as we kept ordering).  Deserts are good as well.

This place is in a prime location with indoor and outdoor seating and a large bar area.  However, the service was terrible.  We came rather late for some refreshments and some appetizers.  Could not get anyone inside the bar to come to our table, we moved outside as there were all kind of open seating.  No food service at that hour outside only inside we were told.  We were professionally attired in business suits, just coming from a late business meeting, so I would think they could tell we were capable of paying our tab. Needless to say we just left.  If you go, I wish you better success.

I went to this restaurant with a group of friends for a casual meeting. The service was very good and accommodating; however, the top floor of the restaurant was empty, so our group and the waiter were the only ones. The food was average at best. We ordered the margarita pizza, which was subpar as it was bland and hard to chew. We also had a pasta dish, which lacked sauce and had an odd after taste. I ordered the veggie patty dish, which was well below average. Being a vegetarian, I have had many veggie burgers. This was probably in the lower tier of veggie patties; the seasoning was non existent and overall tasteless. The fries were great, but it's hard to mess up fries. Really it's 2.5 stars.

So, I have dined at Tavern, Riva, all the Tuscany's even the original Stefani's on Fullerton and of course the incomparable Lino's literally one of them weekly . Okay I even worked at a few of these places decades ago. Sadly I have never taken the time to chat on line about how this organization never fails to deliver. I guess I always assume everybody just knows. To the point of this, my first review... last night at Tavern both our meals (fish special, short ribs, heirloom tomato salad) actually beat my number 1 of all time meal 30 years ago in the south of France(not sure if I even knew what I had ordered but it was fabulous). I can tell you I have never had a bad meal in any of the above mentioned establishments, last night just reminded me of how well they do it.  It kills me to say this because I love being able to get a table but If you haven't been to Tavern or any of Phil's restaurants you need to go. If it's been awhile go back.

What a great spot.  I was in from out of town over Labor Day weekend and my wife and I decided to give Tavern a try and we were not disappointed.  My wife had the Chilean Sea bass over Lobster risotto and was in heaven.  I ordered the Porterhouse Steak Cajun style and was very impressed.  The steak was on par with any Las Vegas or NYC steakhouse and in my opinion better than Gibsons.  Give this place a try.
I got the breakfast burrito and my fiance got the eggs lola. They were both okay... the side potatoes were good!

My first time at Tavern on Rush was excellent! We went to celebrate my birthday and decided on indoor seating. The place was busy but the noise level was not bad. Our server (shame on me for not remembering his name) was amazing and really attentive. He was funny, knowledgable and gave great food and drink recommendations (try the firecracker sauce!) We had grilled calamari, 22oz filet mignon and the jambalaya. Very delicious and full of flavor. We will be back again for any upcoming special occasions!

My friend and I both got a half salad/half soup combo today for lunch. The tomato bisque was comforting as well as outstanding! We sat outside as the rain came down, and enjoyed our lunch thoroughly. I will be back! (It's just always crowded on the weekends, guess that means its worth the wait)

Beer selection was limited, but service was responsive. The crowd is mixed age groups but mainly late 40s the mid-50s. I had a Two Brothers Cane and Ebel, which is a decent craft beer. Others in my group had Black Label, so we weren't really testing their craftsmanship. Prices are a little high but not as bad as I expected.

What would you expect from the epicenter of the Viagra Triangle? There servers are easily some of the best eye candy in the city of Chicago. You definitely need dollar dollar bills to impress any of 'em, but gawking is completely free if you're ordering those expensive drinks.  If you factor in this said free entertainment their prices for food are actually pretty reasonable. There's great steaks, fresh seafood, and one of the best twice baked potatoes I think I've ever had in my life. The patio's perfect for people watching in one of the best hoods to do so, and the said hot servers actually on their shit which you wouldn't exactly expect considering how hot they are.  Long story short if you're a young guy on a budget you'll probably enjoy Tavern, but you'd definitely enjoy it even more if you were a rich old guy.

I visited here with  a friend for Monday night dinner. The restaurant was almost full. The restaurant is little pricey. However my hostess could arrange a table on  a patio. I ate lobster cobb and the lobster was very fresh. They have excellent collection of wines and apetizers. Amongst the apetizers brussel sprouts was very god. Defiintely a fancy place and I would like to visit again.

my friend and i went in after our monthly saturday farmer's market for brunch with our minds blown!  the server was very friendly and knowledgeable.  she gave us recommendations on what's her favorite choices, and gave us the time and space to enjoy our al fresco dining.  i did go with the server's recommendation with the crab cake eggs benedict.  i love me my crab cake benedict.  if you have read any of my other brunch decisions, this is my usual go-to.  i love the savory and hearty breakfast selection and its something i can't make.  i digress... their crab cakes were flaky with chunks of real lump crab!  the egg was poached perfectly and when that yoke was broken it would get soaked into the crab cake with the hollandaise sauce.  yumo!  the two proteins were on a bed of fresh baby spinach, a thick slice of beef steak tomato and your traditional english muffin.  the pair of crab cake benedicts came with a side of home fries.  instead of shaved, the potatoes were in thick slices.  seasoned with a little salt and rosemary.  must must go!  if they're breakfast is this amazing.. i wonder what their dinners are like??  enjoy!

The Tavern on Rush is a great restaurant with an absolutely prime location.  The wagyu burger is one of the best pieces of ground beef you will find in Chicago.  And unlike a lot of great burgers that get there with gourmet toppings, this one is best left plain to enjoy.

We went to have dinner, and had trouble with the hostess with seating. The restaurant was 1/2 empty, yet we were not allowed to have two tables next to each other. Needless to say, we left. A little tired of the rude service in Chicago.
We sat outside last Tuesday night and had a great, great dinner.  We ordered a bottle of champagne with appetizers and a bottle of red for dinner .  The atmosphere was unbelievable!

My friend told us this part of town was called Viagara triangle and the reason for that can be witnessed here many times over. Really good and entertaining people watching!The place was busy on a Saturday and drinks, although tasty, were expensive! For three mixed drinks (jalapeno-strawberry Margarita, apple pie martini and the second martini in the list), three beers, and a dessert it was almost $100! The desert was a mocha ice cream cake that was huge and delicious, but so expensive for what it was...

I had a terrible bone-in filet.  There was so much connective tissue through the whole cut I could only eat a couple bites.  It must have been the very end, the bone wasn't even a whole bone.  Not only that but my Mother's steak was ordered rare and was medium and my asparagus was supposed to be grilled but was obviously steamed and then grilled because it was flimsy and overcooked.  I had my kids with me and one was sick and sleeping so I didn't even say anything.   This is two bad meals in a row now here, I'll never go back.

As a Torontonian, Tavern on Rush is very similar to Sassafraz in Yorkville. The area is like Yorkville, except way better. Tavern has a wrap-around-patio which is BUSY, especially on a hot Sunday afternoon. My parents and I were lucky to snag a table, thanks to our wonderful concierge at the Ritz/Four Seasons who was able to BOOK a patio spot. Unheard of. If you are lucky to get a patio seat, it is PRIME PEOPLE/CAR watching. In my opinion though, cars are on either ends of the spectrum; I saw a Buggatti (my first one!) parked next to an old BMW convertible. I also saw an electric lime-green corvette drive by. People watching is great too: I saw two ladies dressed to the nines strut out of their old Taurus...considering the area, it's no wonder you will see a lot of "trying-to-hard." On to the food. Nothing outstanding, but still good. The Tuna with Avocado was delish and so was their Tomato Bisque. I like my soups chunky. My mom had the Kobe burger, done rare, with Blue Cheese. I couldn't stomach the smell of the garbage truck, I mean, cheese, but my mom loved it. My dad just ordered the Grilled Calamari (good) and a small salad. FYI - This place serves LARGE portions of their main salad, so you won't have to worry about going home hungry just on leaves. Service was good, and attentive. They have a great drinks menu, and in my mind, there is nothing like people watching with a glass of champagne.  Although I felt that the food here was okay, it's still a very fun place. You come here for the vibe and atmosphere, ambiance etc..I am sure the atmosphere would be very different if you had to sit inside. And after a great meal, you can spend some more money by shopping at Barney's or all the fancy stores around this area:)

This was a nice place in a nice part of town with a huge patio and decent food. Everything was on point, that being said I think that there are way better places in town to check out with more authentic food.

The consistency of food and service is only trumped by the quality of food and service.  Solidly in the top tier of what Chicago does best... the big meat, potato the size of your head and lettuce wedge meal.  I don't always eat at steak places, but when I do, this place is a guaranteed winner!  Benny, the house gumba, is a Chicago staple and runs the joint with the expertise of a seasoned, polished pro.   If meat is not your thing, they have many fish choices which are both big and delicious.  Appetizers, mains and dessert portions are generous and easily shared. The lobster fra diavlo is the best I've had in recent memory.  The downstairs bar scene is vibrant, but since the dining room is upstairs your conversation is not drowned out by TV's, music and sh*tfaced tourists, suburbanites and conventioneers (collectively the "TSC crowd") screaming at each other while sucking down $14 cocktails and trying to get laid.  The outdoor dining and people watching is second to none for Chicago or any major city for that matter.  Their is something for everyone here in terms of a vibrant, dynamic Chicago legend that's does it right all the time!
