It is what it is.   A fancy-pants restaurant in a fancy-pants area of the city.   The Tavern On Rush offers an expensive menu, prime real estate and a nice patio.  I visited here with some girlfriends for a late lunch.  I stuck to burger with feta, others got salads or turkey burgers.  Friend's salad, topped with salmon, looked amazing.  I tried the salmon and it was perfectly prepared.  My burger was pretty solid as well.  A little undercooked but whatevs.  They did pile on the feta which I can't hate on but it did overpower the burger at times.   Service was just ok.  Food was a teeny bit better than just ok.  The whole experience?  I know its all fancy-pants but I left here thinking ummm...I guess that was okay??

Way over-rated Snarly wait staff Wrinkle cream regular crowd Dumb Polack regulars trying to pick fights with out-of-towners Really really ordinary food Jesus, this place is such a wanna-be waterhole it's ridiculous Go if you're 25 and desperate to prove you are upwardly mobile Otherwise go to Morton's and have a nice meal

Probably the worst service in Chicago (most definitely a 1 out of 5). It's got a good location (4 out of 5) and the food is okay (2/3 out of 5).  The problem is that the service was so bad that I can't give it more than a 1.

I love the patio area here... You will completely enjoy the people watching! They serve a fantastic drink which is why I ended up staying for a few. Excellent service and if I was a guy I would have enjoyed the cute servers in little red dresses.

Pros:  1) It is SO FUN to watch all the tragic plastic figurines walk by...best people watching in the city by far!  2) Nice location Cons:  1) Spent $55/ea on steaks that were Taco Bell quality meat and not cooked to our specifications. Seriously, we should have gone to Gibson's across the street. 2) Their drink list looks like my 10 year old niece made it. Seriously wtf... Horrible drinks. This is CHICAGO spice it up a bit! I could craft a better drink from the ingredients in my most recent nightmare.  3) ^^^^^ this one again! Come on!!!!

I came to tavern with 2 friends this past Sunday night. Upon entering I said three for outside the hostess replied "drinks or dinner?" Does it really matter?? No hello, no how are you? Seems like the hostess was hired for her looks, and not for hospitality. We sat at a great table outside and the heaters were on, which made it nice and toasty for a cool evening. The waitress was noting to rave about during our dining experience, and the buss staff was even worse. Our waters were not refilled once, only the bottles were replaced after I poured water for my friends myself. The plates were not cleared between courses, nor were they cleared after dinner. The food was outstanding. I had a tuna tartare and the enchilada soup. My friends enjoyed their steak sandwich, tomato bisque, margharita pizza, and beet salad. The wine list is also excellent. I don't want to say I will not be back, because I will for the food. The service however, needs to step up. For such a popular restaurant in the heart of Gold Coast, service is not up to par. Servers are not order takers, they guide a dining experience.

Nothing says Chicago quite like some al fresco dining on a warm night at Tavern!  Really, there is no equivalent in my eyes. Completely and totally impossible not to run into every Tom, Dick, and Harry Chicago has to offer as this is where everyone flocks to when things start to warm up. Absolutely never gets old running into so many people I have come to know and love. Taverm is my second home! Hummus dip and chipolte macaroni and cheese are some fantastic starters.

Sunday brunch in the spring on Rush Street is definitely the way to bring in Spring.  The second floor window seating is a great way to watch people, take in the sights and enjoy the experience.  Service was good and wait staff was attentive.  I do not recommend the quiche though, it was rubbery.  Otherwise, not a bad way to spend a couple of hours with a friend catching up.

Love love love !! Went here for dinner for ladies night out with a few friends.  The food and wine were excellent and Benny took great care of us! After dinner we went downstairs to the bar for cocktails and I would highly recommend their blueberry lemon drop martini-SO good ! All around great experience, we will be frequenting there in the summer time!

Dropped in for the 15-year anniversary specials last night; my $15 wagyu burger with fries and a Stella Artois was a decent deal but the food was very average.  In a burger town, you have to really crush it to make an impression, and this burger was just okay.  The fries (both the taste and the portion size) were below par, and the desserts--a not-quite-tart-enough key lime pie and the banana/chocolate-chip cheesecake--were just okay too.  I love the space upstairs and I would go back to try the steaks if I had the money to do so.  Otherwise, a strangely A-OK experience!

Upscale place in Viagra triangle. Nice enough host. But once we sat down were severely disappointed.  menu is a mix of 'steak house' and bar food fare. group of five of us went, 2 of note wearing suit and tie from work, other 3 of us in causal dress on a weekday night. waitress takes drinks orders, but then quickly fell short. Returned and ask the two of us wearing suits if we wanted food, they ordered, and as the other 3 of us had menus out and prepared to order, she walked away, never to return. About the time our friends pizza came, we hailed her from a nearby table to ask to please order food. recommended the kobe burger to me.  left before we could order drinks, then returned with our friends pizza and replenished their drinks, again forgot to ask us. Food: my kobe burger was terrible. overdone, flavorless. Fries no better than any dive joint.  Pizza's were the best fare.  overall: good ambience, terrible service, bland food. not nearly worth the price you pay.

Very solid steak. Not quite as good as Gibson's or Hugo's but very flavorful and cooked to perfection. They come around with a platter of steaks when you're ordering and are helpful in explaining the different cuts and picking your meal. I went with a Kansas City Strip, which is a cut I had never had before. Perfectly red and juicy with a good caramelized crust. The Brussels sprout side was great too. Also, the bartender downstairs made a perfect dirty Hendrick's martini on the rocks for me before dinner, I had to give him props for that.

Went by for lunch this past Friday and it was a beauiful day to sit outside, soak up the sun and people watch.  The food was excellent.  The entertainment even better.  If you haven't been here, everyone should experience it once.

Yummmmmm! I'd give this place 5 stars except for the girl seating me was a complete bimbo and gave me the wrong menu and was kind of rude about it. But then once I got the right one and ordered the tuna, I was suuuper happy. It was tasty. The place itself is also really cute, in a great location, and had a nice bar. It looked like the perfect oyster/bloody mary on a Saturday morning type bar. I will be back!

A Chicago staple for sure! A great place to go for brunch or a night on the town! The bar area is always hopping and the food is always on par. Most of the meat dishes come solo and any sides have to be ordered ala carte, which can get pricy, but the taste is spot on and worth every penny. Everything from the salads to the steaks is worth raving about and anyone who visits Chicago must make a stop here!

First time dining here. I must say, I was impressed. For a busy Friday night the staff was friendly and accommodating. The manager seemed to know everyone and welcomed the new faces like my friends and I with enthusiasm. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and his recommendation to try the pork chop with asparagus and a sweet potato mash was spot on because I really wasn't in the mood for a heavy steak. The pork chop was delicious and moist. Excellent. He was very attentive considering he was serving a few large parties. The only slight negative I have is the price. This place is expensive. But I guess the combo of the people watching and tasty food is worth it.

A good time. The staff are always prompt, and friendly. Waitresses are good looking. The only downside from time to time are the "workers" that you see from time to time, especially morseo when the recession was full swing. I mean an old White guy talking to a young Black girl in a miniskirt, boy, I bet you guys have a lot in common. Or the random girl in a low slung top with the same drink the whole time glancing around. Ya. One woman gave my friend the $ signal. =\ I like the way the bar is set up though, the food is good, and Tom the bartender is really nice. Cool place.

Tavern on Rush is a great people-watching spot. The outdoor seating makes for a great lunch/dinner. The drinks and appetizers are good, as is the food; however, this Tavern is certainly about the beautiful ambiance, more so than the food.
Bottle of wine and 7 layer chocolate cake on a Sunday around 1am do it ! need I say more. I will return to actually try food lol

I don't know if we always luck out when we come here, but my husband and I have never had bad experience here in the 6 years we have been dining here.  All of these negative reviews just can't be right, can they? Food is top notch (I highly recommend the Filet Oscar!), though it has gone up in the past year, but you get a complimentary salad and bread with your dinner.   We usually order a bottle of wine with dinner, but here and there we will get drinks downstairs--drinks, however, are very, very expensive.  Their new infused vodkas are amazing, around $10 for on-the-rocks, not too shabby I must say.   If you can, request a booth for your dining experience.   They are high and it just feels so intimate.

I love going to Tavern on Rush in the early mornings for breakfast and sitting outside during the spring/summer . Their breakfast is delicious. Ingredients are fresh. Service is great. Price is totally reasonable. Portions are big. Ive been here for lunch as well and it was great. But am a huge fan of their breakfast.

We were visiting from Cleveland, Ohio and heard many good things about the famous Tavern on Rush. With it being down the street from our hotel we just had to go. We started off with the calamari which was grilled and so tender.  What I love is when they bring out the meats and different fish out on a tray and explain each one, and all the different marbling each cut has. We both got a filet medium rare and it was cooked to perfection.  Our server was good not great but the atmosphere and food did make up for that. We will be returning to Tavern on Rush on our next visit to Chicago.

Love this place.Great location.Great stakes,good wine selection.Always have friendly waiter.Downstairs bar area its getting realy crowded so it might be hard to get a quick drink specialy on the weekend.I love this place.

Personal favorite restaurant in the city. Start with a cocktail downstairs, granted the clientel are usually a little facey in the bar. Then head upstairs for the best bone-in filet I've found in my 10 years of searching here, oysters Rockefeller also rival any acclaimed seafood restaurant around, add a couple sides and a bottle of wine, and aim for a table with a view or a booth and you got yourself a perfect dinner, in my humble opinion of course.

Well, what can I say.  We chose this place because of it's close proximity to our hotel.  There are plenty of options in this area but we decided to go with it because we had walked by it a few times and it looked nice and the menu seemed like just what we were looking for. Firstly, we were told there would be about a 5 minute wait for a table upstairs and that we could have a drink at the bar and they would come get us when our table was ready.  Twenty five minutes later my date went to the hostess and inquired about our table.  She apparently had forgotten about us and we were seated shortly after.  We were greeted by our waiter, who seemed to be a little strange.  I don't know why but he was just a little weird.  He kind of hovered over us.  Anyway, we received a bread basket and all of the bread was really cold.  It was almost as if it was frozen and just had thawed.  When I asked the waiter, he explained that they keep the bread in the stairwell and that is the reason why it was so cold.  Huh?  Really?  We then ordered the fried calamari app.  It was mostly tubes, hardly any tentacles and the marinara sauce they served with it was just pulled from the fridge.  On from there, we decided to split the 18 oz bone in NY.  We ordered sides of creamed spinach and a loaded baked potato.  The dinner arrived and the waiter cut the steak in half (we were splitting it) but then proceeded to cut the ENTIRE steak into pieces.  As he was plating the steak, a piece dropped onto the hotel tray and he just picked it up and put it on the plate!  GROSS!   Having a restaurant background, those hotel trays don't get washed every night.  Completely disgusting. I took one bite of my steak and it did have decent flavor but it wasn't very hot.  We told our server and he explained to me that "it's a medium rare steak, it's not supposed to be hot'.  Really?  Not only was he rude and condescending but he was wrong!   End result, manager came over and apologized but never made an effort to make it right.  He seemed a little pissed off that he was having to buy the steak and sides.  We sat for another 15 minutes before the waiter decided to stroll back over to ask for a dessert order.  Not no but hell no.  We left. Never to return.  With the American steakhouse being somewhat of an ubiquitous concept you would think they would try to separate themselves as one of the better ones considering its location. Don't go.  Save your hundreds and take your business somewhere else!

Really cool, trendy place with fantastic drinks and service.  Cocktail servers were very sweet.  My friends and I were in town and went to check out the drinks, which were great. While we were there, we also tried a couple of appetizers which were very tasty.  It is a bit of an older scene but a very great-looking crowd. I definitely enjoyed my experience there!  Would love to go back for dinner sometime.

Awesome environment, great location. Food is expensive for dinner but that what you expect going into there. Amazing service, manager stopped by our table a couple times to make sure out experience was great. Food was amazing. Everything was perfect and would definitely go back.
Oe of the nicest on the Viagra Triangle. Do not go here if you are starving because you might be disappointed with the food but this is a great place to meet with friends post yuppy age and catch up.

I had my birthday dinner at Tavern this past Saturday Jan.12th with 4 other couples.  We were seated promptly.  Our wait person Melinda was fabulous!!! I had a 12oz. Fillet that was perfect Everyone of our meals was perfect and Melinda and the Host made it a perfect night.  The deserts were amazing. The chef stopped at the table to share some stories.  Dining like it used to be! Tavern On Rush has become my favorite restaurant...Sorry Gibsons!

By far one of my favorite places in the triangle, I live around the block and frequent here often.  I love sitting in the bar part of the restuarant and enjoying one of their delicious pineapple martini's (I'm sure they have a special name).  Absolutely AMAZING, the bartenders are quick and very friendly.  The wait staff is also extremely friendly.  Food wise... The salads are all massively huge, but so worth the price.  Recently my mom had the burger and thought it was delicious.  Great place for breakfast as well.  I work as a leasing agent in the neighborhood and recommend this establishment to EVERYONE!

Six of us for dinner and no one was impressed.  One order of lobster was as tough and appealing as a baseball.  Two orders of Dover Sole were tasteless and messy.  Some of the appetizers were okay - crab cakes, calamari.  Tuna tartare was also tasteless.

My review will only cover the drink part of Tavern on Rush (I know, the drinks are the only part). I had a couple of glasses of wine; Malbec and Cabernet. Both of which (maybe more. I don't know) were very good and very reasonably priced. The crowd was a bit older than myself but made for very good people watching.  However, the best part of my experience there was the service. The bartenders were bar none the best. These guys take their jobs seriously. Fast, courteous,  and to the point. I will be back for more... and maybe to try their food

I LOVE this place! I'd been to Tavern on Rush several years ago during the "summer" and even though it was still chilly, I got to sit outside which was lovely. I was in Chicago a few weeks ago, and loved the food so much I went twice in one weekend. Unfortunately, it was so cold we were forced to sit inside, but the food made up for it. The first time I went I ordered the breakfast burrito with chorizo. It was wonderful and perfectly spicy. I also had a doublt-shot cappicuno which definitely hit the spot. My brunch companion had the griddled pancakes which he throroughly enjoyed. On our next visit, I ordered the salmon benedict. Although it was good, I couldn't finish it because the portion was so big. He ordered the burrito with chorizo since he'd liked mine so much at our last visit, but said it wasn't as good as the time before. Overall, i'd definitely go back to the Tavern on Rush as their menu selection is varied and the food is consistently good.

I was really nervous after reading such awful reviews, but I was actually quite happy. We had reservations for 7:30pm on a Saturday night in December when it was very busy. We did have to wait about 10 minutes past 7:30, but the hostess suggested we wait in the bar so we did. The service was prompt and the server took all our requests and made them happen. My only concern is price; $12 for a caprese salad (which was delicious) seemed like a lot. Everything is also a la carte, which I am not a fan of. However, my salad and my pizza were amazing as was my dessert!

I came here around 10:30 on a weekend morning, not by initial choice, but because Butch McGuires wasn't open until a little later and I was hungover, hungry, and wanted a decent breakfast with the option of an irish coffee. I was seated with a smile, but everything kind of slowly went downhill from there. For one, my waiter had such a DGAF attitude, it was pretty unbearable.  We didn't get menus right when we sat down, and he seemed annoyed when we weren't ready to order right away.. hmm..well it would have been nice if we had menus so we could order.  When he asked what I wanted to drink, I asked for an irish coffee and my companion a bloody mary.  After 5 minutes of not so much as a water, he came back and sluggishly told us thye aren't allowed to serve alcohol until 11am.  I have no problem with this, but I wish he (as a waiter who is paid to work there) had told us that when we ordered the alcoholic drinks. Still hungover, I asked for a coffee.  Then he stood there for about 20 seconds, and finally said..wait...so you don't want your irish coffee?  Well, you just told me it was unavailable so no I guess I can't have it right? Anyhow, it was like 10:45ish when he left our table, then proceeded to try to "make nice" by coming back to tell  my companion.."10 more minutes until 11.." "just a few more minutes" "just bear with me some more.." about 4 times or so.  Okay..way to make us feel like the craziest alcoholics in the world because we apparently can't sit for 10 minutes without knowing about the imminent service of alcohol... The food itself was alright and the price was reasonable, but the whole time we were there, we had to listen to the next table complain about how our waiter had messed up their order and as a result they were going to be late for their flight because they had to wait for the correctioned entrees. Then it took about 10 minutes to get and pay the check. ...just spectacular.

Eh, everything I've had here is really average. I've been here about 5 times and seriously nothing stands out to me. The only good thing about this place is that there is a lot of outdoor seating, so it's nice to people and car watch in summer. This place doesn't get as full as the other spots on Rush, and it's big, so there's more of a chance that you will be able to find seats without reservations. I also hear from my guy friends that a lot of Cougars hang out around here...soooo if you're up for that, then yes, go here.

Me and  my girl and another couple all had fantastic food and service! The men had fish and the ladies had steak.  Fish was fresh and  steaks were cooked to perfection.  Our server was great.  We were busy chatting at the start so instead of "rushing" or "pushing" us to order (which I fu@king hate)  he allowed us time to carry on our conversation with wine and cocktails  at the beginning. After salad course the table was perfectly prepped for the main event.  Desert and coffee,  again delicious and served professionally. We also loved our seating.  The four of us in a wrap around high back leather booth.  Awesome!

Coming from the Tree Lighting Parade, we just stopped by to grab a few drinks before heading home to nap before the club. I like that it's all open seating so we can choose to sit next to cuties and avoid creeps. When we came ini t was about 6pm and there were quite a few tables open to choose from. When we left around 7:30, though, it was completely packed. Two guys actually rushed over to hover over us in hopes of grabbing our table when we got up.  We initially came in hoping we could score some mulled wine, but bars and pubs clearly aren't starting it yet. We did two rounds while we were there. I started with the seasonal Apple Spiced Martini, which I really enjoyed. I followed with an Agave Blossom, and I couldn't finish it because it was too strong. I switched out with my friend's glass of Malbec, which was the perfect temperature.  I might come back, I might not. It was a nice place to stop, but it wasn't special in any way. If I do come back, I'll make sure to try some of the food because it all looked really good on everyone else's table. I might come back to oggle the waitresses, too. They're some of the prettiest.

Went to this restaurant for a business dinner on a Monday night, the place was packed!!!!  It may have been because there was a convention in town but it was very busy.  We also had to wait over 30min to be seated for our 8pm reservation.  That was a little annoying.  Also, the tables are very close together so there isn't much room at the table which was a little annoying.   The service was very good attentive.  The food I would give 3 out of 5 it was good but for the price I've definitely had better.  It was a pretty good atmosphere, but noisy so just know that going in, all and all i would say it's just ok, there are better places for the money.

Went because its one of those Chicago places that people tell you is a must. This place is a disaster from start to finish. With plenty of open tables, was told to sit at the bar for 10 minutes. After $12 bloody Mary's, we were seated. The waitress was a child and totally uninformed about the menu. And every time she left us, it was 20 minutes before we saw her again.  After finally getting our food, the cole slaw was the most disgusting I've ever seen. Clearly several days old with wilted lettuce. After telling the waitress she just shrugged and said sorry. Stay away from this place. Way over rated and over priced.

The way my family and I like to eat is by ordering a few entrees, appetizers, and sides, and trying them all. That's exactly what we did at Tavern On Rush. The first time I went there, I fell in love with the Bellevue salad. The goat cheese, shrimp, hearts of palm, and other fantastic elements were like heaven in a bowl--I highly recommend this. The tuna and mango tartare appetizer is super fresh and light. The kobe burger was just phenomenal. My mom is not a big burger person, but raved about this one! Perfectly cooked, amazing brioche bun, and melt-in-your-mouth tender. The brussel sprout appetizer was not my favorite, but that is probably the only thing on the menu that would not please me. My sister, a selective eater shall we say, even found several things on the menu that sounded good, and enjoyed them. Service was incredible, and our waiter was conversational, funny, helpful, knowledgable, and informative. I would come back here again and again if I could afford to on a college girl's budget!

Came here for a late dinner and more drinks with a group of friends, sat upstairs away from the cold. Highly enjoyed their spinach salad, filet mignon on top was just alright. I could live on that spinach salad and their sparkling rose for quite some time though... Boyf enjoyed his burger very much. Their patio is a place to see and be seen, as evidenced by all the leggy blondes and men in suits out there all day, every day, speaking in all different languages. Now could someone just tell me who in the world decided to put "AN EXCITING RESTAURANT" on their sign? Weird.

We showed up around midnight and were led to a beautiful room upstairs overlooking a wet, glistening Rush street.The bread basket with 5 different offerings was worth the trip all by itself! Delicious burgers with house made chips. Very good service.
under rated, bar service rocks, great service and never disappointed.

The  "Best Overall" restaurant in the Gold Coast/Viagra Triangle area.  Perfectly cooked steaks as good or better than nearby famous steakhouses. Good Italian/pasta.  Excellent steak burgers. Try the fresh buffalo mozzarella flown in from Italy every day.  Good service Dining room upstairs overlooks Rush St.   Bar downstairs also serves food in a more casual atmosphere. Sit outside on the "see and be seen" sidewalk patio.   Burts says - Highly recommended.

We went in because we had a gift card.  On a Monday night, it's not super busy.  We sat upstairs and had a nice window seat to people watch.  Very city-esque.  When we walked in, however, they made my boyfriend throw out his Starbucks coffee that he had just bought.  That didn't sit well with him.   The food was okay.  The basket of bread was cold (and for us, there's nothing like warm bread...yum).  I ordered the soup of the day (it was okay).  Then I had a steak sandwich which was pretty good (steak was cooked right, chipolte mayo was yummy, and veggies were fresh)...but the fries were subpar and a bit soggy.  My boyfriend ate a chopped salad with steak and chicken.  He commented that it tasted fresh.  I've been there once before only to drink.  An expensive choice for a bar night, but I wasn't picking up the tab.  That scene was considerably better than the dinner scene. As for the service, good.  The waitstaff was informative and nice.

I came here while visiting Chicago. I heard the locals refer to the area as "The Viagra Triangle" and it lived up to its name.  Lots of well to do mature gentlemen and ladies who seemed interesting in meeting them.  Without a doubt, the hottest women in the room were the servers.  All of them very attractive. The crowd was generally pretty well dressed. TOR fills up quickly, but the bar tables are first come, first served.  And bring your wallet.  This place is not cheap. I had some wine and the ahi sliders, which were superb.  All in all, I would go back, but I think it's a bit overpriced and that's why I deducted a star.

The London Broil was tasty, but a bit rubbery.  I don't have London Broil very often, so maybe this is just the quality it has.  Sparkling water served in bottles.  I'm fine with good ole Lake Michigan water, thank you. Fancy but not too posh Mostly alacarte, which can be annoying and taxing on the wallet. Good coffee generous size, perfect clencher after a meal. I will come back and try another dish!

Great location, mediocre food dishonest people. I went for dinner and the server we had was good, the salad I had wasn't, not a big deal. My girlfriend and I left not realizing she had forgotten her Norstroms shopping bag behind. I called the next morning and left a message. Hours later with out a return call I went to the restaurant to try to retrieve the bag. I explained my mission to the first hostess I met who then told me to go repeat myself to the inside hostess who then went to the manager who quickly dismissed her and didn't even bother to look up at her or me. Obvious to the fact that he couldn't have cared less. Also obvious that someone decided to keep the contense of the shopping bag for themselves. Thumbs down!

Great place to get have good conversation, people watch and enjoy a tasty meal.  I typically go for the lighter fare when visiting Tavern on Rush.  The salads are great and the sammies are good as well.  Stop by while strolling on Rush!

Went to Chicago recently with my family, and we ate at a few upscale steak places. This one was by far the best. The service was absolutely amazing. The wine list was great. The steak was perfect. But the dessert was the best part. We ordered a slice of the BIG chocolate cake. Well actually, we ordered two at first but the waiter just laughed and said he would bring one and let us decide if we needed another. We didn't. They don't lie about the BIG part! It was huge, and delicious to boot. I will definitely go back the next time I'm in the area!

I'm sorry I do not know how anyone could give this place less than 5 stars. Tavern is on of the crown jewels for Chicago steak houses. The service is IMPECCABLE- as is the food- especially the steaks. I have been there twice, both times I left I felt I had more than dinner- it is an experience. Everything from drinks, to service, everything is amazing. Whether you live here or are visiting- it's worth at least one visit, but you will definitely come back for more!

Went to the Tavern on Rush this morning for Brunch. We had the Crab Cake Benedict and Sunny Side up Pizza. The food was excellent! If you like spicy bloody's, you need to try one here, very good!  Service was great & the people watching was even better. Overall for being DT, the price was good.

Found Tavern on Rush while we were walking down Rush street and was very pleased with their food and service.  We decided to sit at the outdoor patio and I thought service might take longer because they seemed really busy but everything was timed perfectly.   They have a great selection of wines and even though food is a bit on the expensive side, it was all worth it.  I wish I remembered the name of our server, long brown hair is all I can remember, because she was very helpful and patient since we did take a little longer to decide on what to order.  The calamari is definitely something I would recommend.

Wandering around on Rush Street looking for a place to eat; this place is not bad.  I sat at the bar, got served right away and ordered a pizza.  Really good sauce, the crust was thin and cooked perfectly.  Interesting place to people watch.  I'd come back. Came back the next night with the wife and sat outside. Great people watching.  Service was very hood.

We thought this place was pretty decent.  We decided one day spontaneously to go have some brunch, but it was late enough that it became lunch.  We initially planned to sit outside, which would've been 20 min wait on a late Sunday morning, but finally decided to dine in the dining room due to the imminent shower coming (which ended up not coming btw). I had a breakfast burrito and my wife had a sandwich (which I don't remember it was).  Both were pretty good dishes with very generous portion.  Also it was too much food, so we ended up taking most of my wife's sandwich as leftover (lunch next day). Looks like the ambience, both in and out, is great.  I would totally recommend this place for a late Sunday morning meal.

Great location, beautiful patio (skipped it because we ate here during a heat wave), and lovely interiors. Unfortunately our service was terrible. We though perhaps it was a busy time for the restaurant until we caught our waiter checking for water spots on the glassware rather than checking on our table. Admire the attention to detail but would have admired ketchup for my fries more. Additionally, they had AC guys int he dining room working on the units RIGHT on top of our table. Elbow to elbow with my fiance. Not what you'd expect from a place like this. We both got the burgers, which were good but were no different than any other angus burger. The beer selection was extremely limited, surprisingly, but a Sierra Nevada's always fine. If we could do it over again we'd probably get the crab cakes or anything other than the typical burger, but we probably won't be back. The patio looks like the perfect spot for people watching, but the whole restaurant really wasn't that different from an upscale chain restaurant in South Florida, and the poor service unfortunately blew it for us. With so many great options in Chicago it's hard to put this place on a repeat-visit list.

Tino Antonacci is Extremely Rude! My friend and I went to the hostess stand and asked for a table outside and we were seated right away.  After spending $100 on food and wine, the hostess came up to our table and told us our 2-hour time limit is up and they have to turn over our table.  My friend and I looked at each other in shock.  We had no idea what she was talking about.  We had just ordered dessert and were waiting for it when our waitress then came over to our table and also told us our 2-hour time limit is up.  We told her that we just ordered dessert and we would like to see the manager.  The Manager, Tino Antonacci, came over to our table and also told us our 2-hour time limit is up and we have to leave.  We told him that no one mentioned a time limit to us.  He then said:  "You mean to tell me that the hostess didn't tell you about the 2-hour time limit".  We said "no".  He then asked us if we were lying to him and he was yelling at us in front of all the guests.  He said: "Are you lying to me and if you are not lying to me I am going to fire the hostess".  We decided to leave and will never return to Tavern on Rush ever again.  If you are looking for a place to eat outside, go next door to Carmine's or across the street to Gibson's where there is no 2-hour limit!

Once again, never ate here when I lived here!  But it is close to the hotel and I was hungry. Had a burger and it was juicy. The fries were decent as well. Nothing to rave about but the weather was nice and it felt good to dine al fresco. They were also open when other restaurants had already stopped seating which was helpful.  I also ordered the adobo grilled corn because it is so yummy at corner deli in NYC. It was disappointing. It did not come on the cob. It lacked the grilled taste and I couldn't taste any spices. Just the mexican cheese. Don't get me wrong, I ate it. Did I mention how hungry I was?!? Not my favorite place. With all the options in Chicago, I doubt I would go back.

three and a half stars, for now. Went with a couple friends on a weeknight. Two of us ordered burgers and one had soup and salad. The gazpacho was refreshing, delicious, and full of huge lumps of crab. My friend seemed to enjoy her salad too, but didn't finish. My kobe burger was pretty good. Fries were so-so. My friend really loved her primerib burger and said she'd order it again. The table shared an order of the chipotle mac n cheese, which was spicier than I expected and probably the best thing we ate all night. We also shared a dessert... but shouldn't have bothered. I usually LOVE key lime pie, but the key lime pie here is not up to scratch. My mouth was NOT singing in tartness at all. I've had better at chain restaurants like Red Lobster, so... c'mon. Service was pretty good, but I wish they were just a bit quicker. I also wish they made sure people sitting outside had ICE water and not just water from the pitcher on the table. They might also want to refill these pitchers when they are empty. Great spot for people watching though! Dinner: 4 stars Dessert: 2 stars Service 3 stars

Great people-watching and a very popular hot-spot in Chicago.  The service was fantastic and I enjoyed the Vueve Clicquote.  We ate outside and it was fun to watch the people in the area. It was also fun to watch the hot cars delivered from valet to guests.  The food was ok.  The ambiance, atmosphere and service are better.  I always go to this place when I'm in Chicago because it's so "happening".  (PS: The crowd is older, they don't call it the Viagra Triangle for nothing)

The food is good,but nothing that special. What I like is the outdoor seating and that is all. I went with a friend for launch,and the waitress was very unfriendly.We never received our bread sticks and she just threw the food on the table and never asked if we need anything.We felt very discriminated(we are from Bulgaria and we speak Bulgarian to each other) just because the table next to us( english speaking couple) got all the attention: how is the food, can I get you anything, bla,bla...my friend an I felt that is us she doesn't like. So I don't know if I am going back there...I thing the staff should treat everybody the same.
1) Great crab cakes.  2) Friendly staff. 3) Prime location (Gold Coast). Add a sprinkling of charming, friendly Midwesterners, and you've got yourself a solid 4-star hit.
Solid steakhouse, the bone-in ribeye was quite good. Oysters were ok, and everything a bit overpriced.

I'm a fan of this place, it's located in the gold coast which is a nice area of downtown to grab a quick lunch. I came here with my mom a while ago and we shared the salmon club sandwich which was a huge portion so it's a good thing we shared. We then got the creme brûlée which my mom is a huge fan of so she really liked that and I thought it was just okay. The place is semi causal semi fancy with both indoor and outdoor seating and unfortunately we sat inside when all the action seemed to be outside but during prime hours it's hard to get a table without reservations. So overall it's a nice, a tad pricey place for a quick lunch or you can make it a whole lengthy meal if you get drinks and enjoy a beautiful Chicago day. Is it anything outstanding or out of the ordinary, but def in the heart of downtown so I would go again sometime. The service was also pretty good from what I remember which never hurts a place.

Was able to place a very helpfull open table reservation at 7:30 on a Thursday night. Walked in and was seated quickly. The waiter was helpfull we were going to each order a baked potato and the white cheddar augratin potatoes he said" allot of starch" so we only ordered the white cheddar one. This was a good choice as they were very yummy. I had the big porterhouse my wife had a fillet. Both were very good. When I eat a prime steak there is nothing like it. DELICIOUS!!! The price was I am sure on par for all the other prime steak place in Chicago 40-50 bucks. Dinner comes with salad. No side but many to choose. Desset we shared a very good creme brulee. I left there very satisfied and full!!

I had been to Tavern on Rush for the late night *boom boom* and sardine-like rush for vodka diets (it's low carb), but I had never been here for a regular sit-down meal until recently.  Rush Street has really built up a showcase of outdoor brunching that makes for great people-watching over scrumptious breakfast items and great, vibrant service.  I have finally seen ToR by the light of day....and I like it.

Before tonight I would have given Tavern a 4 star rating, until confronted by a bartender who needs to learn to keep her mouth closed. A friend of mine had an issue with her service while I was in the ladies room.  I returned to the bar to hear what went down and I immediately didn't want any part of it.  As I cashed out my own tab (a few drinks later) the bartender asked me what my friend's issue was with her and blah blah blah, none of which should have been directed at me since I wasn't involved during the initial occurrence.  I mentioned if she has an issue with my friend then she should discuss it with my friend not me.  Bartender continued to explain she loves her job and gives great service, to which I responded "yes you're in the service industry and it's your job to make others happy with their service".  Bartender continued to press the issue as I felt uncomfortable being in the middle of something that was not my fault to begin with.  My friends and I took this issue to a manager who asked what happened and seemed slightly concerned with making amends. My concern is my employer has dinner reservations with clients in 1.5 weeks at Tavern during our busiest trade show of the year, and I would sincerely hate for one of our customers to be treated the way I was tonight.  I feel the issue could have been handled directly by the bartender with my friend in question instead of getting me involved & as a result making me uncomfortable by asking me about the subject matter I initially had no part in. And while we directed our customer service complaints to the manager on duty, he expressed concern but I don't feel it was genuine.   I spent $60 tonight and work incredibly hard for what I earn.  Not sure Tavern deserves my money with service like this.  After all this is considered a higher end bar, but I cannot rate it worthy of 4 stars due to our lack of service.  The higher-ups at my company will be hearing about this while I provide other dining options. Note to service personnel: you're job is to please grumpy, thirsty/hungry,  demanding patrons while wearing a smile on your face.  If you can't handle it, don't work in the service industry or get a better attitude.  I pay you a tip for serving me promptly, correctly, not giving attitude , and doing your job.  I expect my own employer to hold me to a certain standard level too.  that's what work is.
Indoors was stifling hot, everyone was uberpretentious, everything was overpriced and it smelled fishier than a Jersey Shore jacuzzi. I don't get it.

We went to Tavern on Rush to get out of the heat, and were initially very pleased with our selection.  Since I was being a tourist, I was the only one in shorts and a t-shirt, the rest of the patrons were the business lunch crowd or "Sex In The City" / Wealthy Housewives.  But I wasn't there for the crowd, I was there for the food, All in all, it was pretty good.  My lunch was the best, a light (if one could possibly be) Pasta Cabonara.  The skirt steak sandwich and a summer salad with peaches and got cheese were the other dishes served at our table. The service was slow.  Granted there were a lot of people, but it could possibly be because we were the only casual table... That was the impression that I got.   The bar was huuuuuge, I'd love to come back at night when the DJ is spinning.  But as far as lunch goes, the food is good, just don't wear shorts or you'll get the shafted treatment.

Disappointing experience that I was looking forward to. Steak was overcooked, asparagus was burnt, potatoes were very bland. Service was very robotic. Occasion was for a birthday and I mentioned this but nothing was brought at the conclusion as expected and I decided to just skip dessert to get out of there. Cocktails were very expensive as was entire evening. Felt like I wasted over $200 when I left.  I thought that this place was supposed to be classy but people were dressed as if they came directly from the beach so I felt out of place dressed half way decently.

Went there today (Saturday) for brunch with my boyfriend and a friend. There was a wait outside, so we opted to sit right away inside. Water was brought to our table right away, but in scalding hot glasses. That was weird. Waitress introduced herself and then we barely saw her again for the rest of the time. If this review were just based on service, I'd give one star. No one came to check on us for about 30 minutes, and when I finally approached our server, she was not apologetic at all. The food, however, was pretty decent. We ordered the breakfast pizza, breakfast burrito, and I had the crab cakes benedict. The crab cakes were FANTASTIC! Everything else on the plate was average, and the English muffin was pretty dry. But the crab cake alone was enough for me to finish most of my dish. The pizza and burrito were pretty damn good too. Overall, atmosphere of Tavern on Rush is great, food was pretty good, but the service was so poor. I'll definitely give it another try in the future, but I'm turned off for now.

This little corner of Gold Coast is full of great restaurants.  In my opinion, Tavern on Rush is the best of them.  The service was impeccable (although some of their servers have thick accents, so you have to listen carefully).  They were unintrusive, helpful, and knowledgeable.   The upstairs dining area is great - large windows provide lovely views of the square and fresh air when its not too hot.  The dining room is long, so it never feels particularly crowded or large.  Tables are only two deep, the length of the room.   The steaks are predictably great - well cooked, with a large variety of preparation styles.  I liked the peppercorn sauce.  The best meal I had, however, was a tortilla crusted halibut, with a creamy jalapeno sauce.  It was a special of the evening; aside from being perfectly prepared, it was an interesting, yet approachable meal.  I think this is where Tavern excels - it takes mainstays of continental dining and twists them every so slightly into something innovative and interesting.  It's performing a service for the more conservative diners that visit by gently expanding their culinary horizons.   The wine list is robust, plenty of variety in price and varietal.  Cocktails were OK, nothing to write home about.   Of the half-dozen or so spots on this square, this is the only one I visit repeatedly when I'm in the area.

The place for people-watching extraordinaire.  Oh, and I guess they serve food and drinks, too. There is a restaurant up above, and I have eaten there a handful of times.  The food is pretty good but not remarkable.  My guess is that the restaurant exists solely as a brief refuge from the meat-market, see-and-be-seen atmosphere that is the first floor. Oh, and be prepared with a tip and a response to some witty banter if you visit the men's restroom.  The grande-sized gentlemen handing you the paper towels and turning on and off the water seems to be an institution in and of himself.  Some people probably enjoy that kind of service, but I try to time it so he's accosting someone else and I can get in and get out and do my business in peace.

While I have been to Tavern on Rush several times for dinner and had a great experience, I had never been for brunch until just recently.  I must say, this is officially my new favorite brunch spot.  I had a couple of friends in town from New York staying in a hotel not far from Tavern, so we figured we'd give it a go.  George, our bus boy, couldn't have been more wonderful.  Our waitress, Stephanie, was fantastic and surprisingly tolerant of our bizarre zombie apocalypse conversations that seemed to be brewing every time she came by.  I give her (and George) two very big thumbs up for being amazing. We all nibbled off of each other's plates, so I can attest to the fact that ALL of us had a stellar meal.  The crab cake sliders are made to absolute perfection.  The stuffed french toast was to die for - I have never liked french toast before and couldn't get enough!  The turkey burger and Azteca salad were both delectable.  I'd recommend the Kir Royal and Salty Dog if you're looking for a refreshing brunch cocktail (or 5).  It was a great experience overall and I can't wait to go back!

We went in for a late lunch, early dinner on a Sunday evening.  We chose just to sit at the bar is it is more our style than a table (or a patio table).  After a brief glance at the drink menu, my husband and I both selected beers that we enjoy that we cannot find everywhere.   My husband had a steak for dinner, and I chose a turkey burger.  Now, a lot of places have a turkey burger on their menu, but not often is the burger this fantastic.  Honestly, this was the juiciest, most flavorful burger I have ever eaten, I would HIGHLY recommend it.  The steak was also very well prepared and according to my husband, cooked exactly how he wanted it.  We shared a side of the chipotle mac and cheese and it was awesome. The level of service was very high, and we had a wonderful experience!

Came here for lunch because we wanted to sit somewhere nice outside. Not bad... I would say service was kinda spotty... Never got any bread sticks. A bug flew into my water and the waiter never really came around so I could ask for a new one. Food... decent, pretty average. I got a turkey club, turkey was kind of dry and my boyfriend got the steak sandwich and said it was pretty good. Prices are a little high but it is on Rush St.

I kinda know what I'm getting into before I get into it. I always have -- it's like an innate sensory gift from my forefathers.   So why do I like Tavern on Rush?  * For the items on its menu? Nope.  * Because they make really good/strong drinks? Not that either.  * The service? What service -- I'm always at the bar anyway. Well, I'm sure you're asking yourself, "then why the hell go?!?!?" I'll tell you! Tavern on Rush is an unintentional burlesque show with the most eclectic actors and actresses. You will NEVER meet a genuine person in this spot -- everyone has on their "game" face.  And by "game" face, I mean be "unintentionally interesting," "unintentionally pretentious," "unabashedly rich" and "slightly inhuman."  The common denominator is unintentional, but everything is INTENTIONAL here!  This is why I go to the joint -- I get to see everyone not be themselves and play dress up! I am entertained from the moment I enter to the moment I leave. It's a show and they don't charge admission.  Try it out for yourself, and be entertained! Order a Maker's Mark on the rocks or a Macallan 25 -- spark up a conversation or two -- then sit back and enjoy the show. Don't view Tavern on Rush as a restaurant or a bar -- view it as Second City on pompous colored steroids -- starring the best actors and actresses from Corporate America!

Expensive? Yes; crowded? Yes; worth the price and wait?? Definitively!! The place is really cool; if you want a peaceful dinner you can get a table upstairs but if you want to watch people and have some drinks with your food while surrounded by good music and a lot of activity just find yourself a table in the bar area. We had the tuna puree for appetizer and a pizza to share. The tuna was really really really tasty and the pizza was really good even thought it was a little burn in some parts but still good. The drinks are very good as well and the service was good keeping on mind how busy they were. We didn't bring the car so we didn't have to deal with finding parking or anything but I could see how difficult parking would be in the area so just be patient or park a little farther so you won't have issues.

Let's be honest, food is not the reason you come here. And maybe I'm becoming more discerning as I get older, but I've got to say that there were more attractive women at Wrigley Saturday evening than there were in this area Friday evening. Too much makeup, Botox and hair extensions. No curves, just boobs and flat backs. Service was outstanding. The staff is very attentive and knowledgeable. The food was pretty good by the way. Nothing to distinguish them from Gibsons and the like. But as I said earlier, your not there for the food. You're there to see and be seen.

Glacial speed of food arrival.  Glacial speed of drinks to the table.  Couple this with the next evening's aloof, disinterested and apathetic bartender and you've got a real "must miss"!  On my 2nd visit in 2012 the bartender focused his attention between 3 plastic-faced self-important chics and some "sunglasses at night" 5'4" lame sporting a dapper Kohl's suit.  Maybe those 4 were there to sustain the bar business all night, but a head nod and eye contact within 20 minutes at a busy bar still is within reason.  This place has enough business though to tell who they want to have sex with themselves.  Stupid me for leaving Gibson's bar after dinner across the street.

Decent place, and the table service was relatively quick for a busy Thursday night. However, it was nearly it was nearly impossible to get a bartender's attention due to the giant row that surrounded the bar, and the bathrooms are downstairs. And are attended. Blech. I don't want someone sitting in there staring at me while I wash my hands.

Seriously??  This place is all kinds of douchey, even for the Viagara Triangle!  So here's how ratings work for me:  everybody starts at a 4 because I'm a star whore and I naturally err on the side of higher ratings, then you get additions or subtractions based on location, menu, service, clientele, decor, value, and how drunk I got.  Start: 4 stars Location: DEFINITELY -1.  Parking sucks, traffic sucks, offerings in the area suck...3 stars Menu: nothing has really been that GOOD there so I'll abstain and remain neutral... still 3 stars Service: -1.  I'm not going to flash boob to get a drink, I just want to be served.  I really didn't appreciate it when I went in there a while back and they took my friend's cash all night and then his drinks still managed to make it on my tab.  Oh yeah, they went there.  Good thing I didn't sign the tab so it was promptly thrown out by my friends at AmEx... 2 stars Clientele: I'm not going to make myself look like a child prostitute to fit in here.  Everytime I go here I am amazed at how many recent college grads are shopping for sugar daddies...  or at least get free drinks out of the 50-something married men here.  The economy ain't what it used to be so the strategy doesn't work as well as it used to for them, wah wah.  I read another review that mentioned that she likes to go there with her best friend and make up stories to tell people and people watch.  It sounds like it may be fun, but you could also go to a place where you can be yourself and that's cool enough and you may actually meet some people that you wouldn't run across the street to avoid if you ever saw them again.  There's a novel concept! Negative 2 stars because it's that bad... 0 stars Decor: Actually I really like the decor here.  The layout is functional and there was a lot of thought put into the design.  +1...1 star Value:  There's no way that anyone can argue any sort of value here.  There are some of the best restaurants in the world in this city and they don't even have the balls to charge some of the prices (esp for drinks) that this place does... back to 0 stars How drunk I got:  I got ril drunk, so they end up with 1 star.  ...and you have the final score: 1 STAR Kthanksbye!

Never again. A local CEO business associate and I had a reservation at 7:30pm on a Wed night.  We arrived at 7:15 and were told that the table needs to be cleaned and could we wait at the bar?  Sure, the bar here is a famous hangout so why not.  Well, after a couple of drinks and nearly an hour wait we went to the front to ask what was going on.  The "ladies" at the desk seemed a little confused and befuddled looking at the reservation screen.  After a couple of minutes they informed us to wait.  So another 20 minutes or so goes by hanging around the foyer and I asked to see the manager.  The manger comes half way down the stairs (restaurant is upstairs) stops, and asks us what we wanted so I tell him about the wait for an hour.  He says he thought that we were eating at the bar (???) and that he will take care of it.  My reply was "then take care of it!" At that point he calls his pair of bouncers and escorts us out.  There are just too many excellent restaurants in Chicago for any establishment to behave that way.  I recommend you stay away from this place.

They really know how to make a steak !  the staff was friendly, the drinks were good, but this is steakhouse and the steak's are excellent ! It's kinda pricey but if you got the cash you can have a nice time and a great meal !!!

Had a friend in town who is a big steak fan. We attempted a steak restaurant in the area but it was too crowded.  We ended up here; not only was it the best rib-eye he ever had....every single person with us had a fantastic dinner (and I tasted them all).  It was a great night.
Like to sit in the roped off area. Like the calamari and people watching.

Reviewing after having BRUNCH on a early Saturday afternoon. Came in at 11 with a girl friend and got seated right away. Host asked if we were okay with a booth and we got seated in a huge half circle booth upstairs. It was great for just us two and we could tell that no tables were available.  She ordered a breakfast burrito and I got stuffed french toast with mascarpone cheese and blueberries. Everything was delicious! Came in a good amount of waiting time. Presentation was lovely and the food was served at a perfect temperature! Our waitress was great, attentive and smiling, and even made small conversation with us! She was working hard. It's a fast paced environment and it's a crowd full of tourists. Everyone was dressed up and it seemed like everyone was starting off there day at Tavern. I've seen more creative Brunch menu's in neighborhoods like Lakeview, but for the  North side, this place is a nice, classy place to have Brunch. They have a large menu featuring all sorts of food items you can here:  tavernonrus ... I recommend this if you are looking for a fine dining type of brunch experience and taking out friends or people from out of town. The prices are decent and the quantity size is great too. I can see myself returning back here for Brunch!

The Mister and I went with our families to celebrate.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their steaks.  I ordered the pork chops and they were dry.  That seems to be an issue with pork chops ANYwhere!  So why the 4 stars?  Because they had the very best potatoes au gratin that I have ever had in my life and potatoes au gratin are on the menu for my last meal.  Now, I want them to be made by theses folks.   I live in Huntington Beach CA, but will be coming back here for the potatoes.  Holy Tater!!! yum yum yum!!!!

I was here a few years back and thought the place was amazing lots of atmosphere at the Bar the staff was amazing!  I had the Filet Oscar style and it was great I would come back and do it all over again!

Best steak anywhere. Fantastic, knowledgable wait staff. This is my 4th meal upstairs at Tavern on Rush, and will keep coming  back. Everyone we take with us agrees, favorite restaurant in Chicago, for that matter my favorite restaurant anywhere.

I went there this morning for brunch. I scoped the seating and there were at least 15 outdoor tables empty.  I asked the hostess for a seat for two. She said there were none available.  I said there are 15 empty tables. She said she had a lot of others to set first and showed me her list. She said come back 20 minutes.  We stood around for a few minutes ton watch and see how things were run..and they weren't running. The young hostess clearly had no help and no idea what she was doing. The management needs to take a cue from the pancake place around the corner that has the most efficient service ever, never has an empty table and a line out the door.  We left and went to RL which has way better service.  With all the great choices in the gold coast area there are better options than this poorly run establishment.

Anger is the word that comes to mind when I think of this place. In my mind, one star reviews should be reserved for a place that should not ever serve food for health reasons. So maybe this is a 1.5 but I won't round up because I don't owe them anything. Our brunch club picked this spot because of the great patio and good word around town. But let me be quick - the worst. service. ever. I will never go back. Not worth my money, time, or patience. We were seated, but not even spoken to for about 15-20 minutes. Then, our food took FOREVER. We had a few drinks but noticed that a whole table had flipped AND the second guests that sat had already placed an order before we received our food. They messed up a few orders at the table, and they came cold. I can't even make this up.  At this point, I was getting pretty antsy and was trying to give them the benefit of the doubt, but asked to speak with a manager. I did this quietly, went to the bathroom and tried to grab his attention. This clown didn't apologize and simply asked for my check (I thought he would comp it). I came back later - and my friend had done the same thing and spoken with the manager. He comped A SOUP. And then proceeded to talk to the server right in front of us, quite uncomfortable. Don't hold your breath for this spot - there's much better, less expensive restaurants, and ones that care about their customers in Chicago. I'm trying hard to erase this experience from my memory.

If there was a way to give zero stars, or negative stars, I would choose that option. However, to write the review you must choose a star first. I'm really sad to write this review because I know the family who owns the restaurant and they are lovely people, but I am so enraged by my experience today that I feel it would be an injustice to people not to write this review.  My boyfriend always jokes that "the only way for you to get good service here is to pull up in a Lamborghini Gallardo and wave money around" and I constantly laugh and brush it off. However, after today's experience made me realize he may not be so far off. It was the first beautiful day in a long time, and Tavern had their outdoor seating set up. It was an obvious choice for a "first warm/sunny day in a while" brunch spot. We showed up at the restaurant at 1:45pm with a party of five. The hostess told us it would be 45 mins to sit outside. She told us to check back every 20 mins or so and see where we were on the list since they didn't give out pagers. While we followed her orders and checked in often, it seemed like there was no end in sight. Every time we checked in, she told us "check back in another 20 mins..." until it added up to longer than 45 mins. Finally, she told us the reason we had waited so long was because we were a group of 5 and only a few of their outdoor tables can accommodate us.  Fine.  The hostess then told us that she spoke with the manager and he felt terrible about our wait and the first round of drinks were on him. Well, it was now 3:00 on Sunday afternoon, so drinking was not the first thing on our mind. We kept our cool until we were seated at 3:10. We sat down, opened our menus, and realized the menus we were given were dinner menus. I stood up and walked over to the hostess to ask why we received dinner menus. Her response was "well, we stop cooking breakfast at 3:00pm."  This is when I lost it. I brought a group of friends together. I chose this restaurant. I am the reason my hungover friends have stood here waiting for over an hour.  We finally rejoiced as we sat down. BOOM. Dinner?  I asked the hostess to send the manager to our table. When he showed up, he again reminded us of his offer of free drinks. We said all we wanted were eggs. He said he couldn't do anything to change that, and that we should just relax and order something off the current menu. With that, I said we're leaving, and he said "ok" as he quickly walked away. My boyfriend reminded me that there are 1,000 douche bags on that list waiting for our table, and they could care less about us non-lamborghini folks. When the five of us all walked away shocked, we all agreed that we only went there for the outside seating and the food isn't anything to write home about. All in all, I have worked in restaurants before. Restaurants exist for customers. I worked at Nordstrom for almost two years. I learned about and practiced some of the best customer service in the world. I know what running a business is. This, my fellow yelpers, was pathetic and embarrassing.  If you are a tourist coming to Chicago, don't waste your time here... unless of course you roll into town in your Lamborghini.

Right in the heart of the Viagra Triangle.. Great scene and bar setup...bartenders are heavy on the pours and  above average pub grub... Always the highlight of the night is watching the creepy old guys perve everything that is wearing a skirt...Then making jokes at their expense when they sink badly. Yes my friends and I are still that childish.

As a very young adult, Tavern was what I imagined high-class eating to be like.   Then, I ate other places.   Tavern is fine, overall.  They just aren't amazing.  The service is not good (they check once and really don't come back) and the food is just okay.  I am trying to think of who I would recommend Tavern to and the only group I can come up with is out-of-towners who could be duped into thinking that this place is amazing, but I don't do that to people.  A good recommendation is a good recommendation.  A girl needs to have standards.   I want more from Tavern.  The thing is: it is in one of my favorite locations in the city (outside from brave old men hitting on you), so I will probably end up eating there again at some point.  Hopefully, it is a better experience the next time.
Foods fine. Drinks solid. Crowd is pretty lame
I've been here a few times and it's been consistently quite good, although a bit crowded for my tastes.

I was entirely underwhelmed. The seafood special I ordered was the definition of average. They told my father his fish would be Chilean sea bass, but instead they served him butterfish and laughed when he tried to tell him they made a mistake.  My brother's carbonara was awful.  The bread was cold.  My sisters steak was meh.  Overall.. Not even close to being worth the money.

I've never had a better time at a bar... anytime, anywhere, any place. Yes, it's in the Viagra triangle. Yes, old men are preying and being creepy everywhere. But ignore them! There are likely plenty of fun people around. The bar itself is HUGE and full of people just having an absolute blast. Make this a later stop if you're barhopping and don't worry about grabbing a table... station yourself at the bar and be prepared to talk to a ton of folks. My best friend and I like to create new identities and get really good stories going and see if we can keep them straight - pure entertainment. That's really about it... it's nothing more than that to me. Good times, fun and upscale atmosphere, and strong drinks. Super fun spot in the 312.

We went to Tavern on Rush with a group of people from work.  We ordered a lot of seafood apps and almost everyone had steaks for dinner.  The portions were decent and the quality of the meat was good.  The drinks were very strong, which in my opinion, is a great thing.  Our waitress was great.  We never had to ask for a refill on our drinks and the food was delivered promptly without error.  The place is very nice and I recommend it for semi-special occasions.  I wouldn't be able to afford this place every weekend because I think the bill was approximately 1,000.00 for a group of 9...  Some people are ok with this, so maybe this is their kind of hangout.

If you have nothing else here, have the chateaubriand. The first bite always makes me close my eyes and make inappropriate noises. My friends usually nudge me to remind me that we're in polite company and to bring me back down from carnivore heaven. The chateaubriand has to be shared between two people, which makes it a perfect choice for a date. And if you're here on a date, kudos to the man 'cause he knows how to treat a lady. I can honestly say that I've never had anything bad here. Even their grilled vegetables are superb. Keep it healthy and have them with your Flintstone sized steak. I can also say that the service has always been impeccable. The waiters know their beef and wine and I'd expect no less at a steakhouse. I especially love when they bring out the raw cuts of meat for your inspection and choice. Nice touch. Makes me want to growl.  It is a splurge ($$$$) but I usually make it a couple of times a year when my craving for a great steak just won't subside.

I didn't eat anything here but the drinks were good and the vibe was chill. The music they were playing on a Monday night was great. Our server, Megan said that there's a DJ every night starting at 9pm (we were there around 6-8pm). They play the recorded set from the night before during the earlier hours when the DJ isn't there yet. If that's any indication... I'll be checking this place out again.

We pass by this place and look like it was pretty popping. The service was good and food came fast. Didnt try the drink or dessert but the seafood combo for two was a good choice. I had the tomato bisque Which was good and very filling. Overall was a good experience but nothing too spectacular.

I went in on a wednesday night around 12am where I was greeted with a warm smile by the hostess. The place was packed and very very loud. If u want some quiet time I suggest upstairs where its like 2 other guests..i guess thats a good thing though because the waiters have no excuse for shitty service. Overall the food was quite bland but the highlite of my life was the $25 dollar martini...deelish! I only give it four stars because of the awesome staff and great service. But the food was average

Last winter, I came here with a group of girlfriends for a ladies' night out in the city. We sat at a large table in the middle, surrounded by posh booths and wealthy couples. We enjoyed generous servings of bread, bottles of wine (it was cheaper to share bottles than get individual glasses), and lovely dinners and appetizers. I ordered an organic mixed green salad with candied walnuts, bleu cheese and balsamic vinaigrette. When it arrived, it was much larger than expected and very yummy!! I also sampled my friend's tomato bisque and fell in love with it. We all really enjoyed our time here (the waiter was awesome) and the view out the window! Come here if you're looking for a fancy meal or a place to people-watch.

Had my worst restaurant experience EVER at Tavern on Rush last night.  My wife and I had an 8:30 reservation, arrived at 8:20 and were told they were a little behind and we could expect to be seated at around 8:35-8:40.  We were eventually seated at 9:30.  The two hostesses were very unprofessional, rude, condescending and impolite.  They never once said they were sorry, and each time we asked how long we should expect to wait, they just said "we don't know, it's up to them upstairs.". When we got upstairs, Benny was very apologetic, offered a free drink and appetizer.  We ordered and two additional appetizers showed up at our table (we didn't order them).   We didn't want to eat them b/c we ordered others and sent them back.  Benny stopped by our table twice more to apologize but the two hostesses already had ruined our evening so it didn't really matter.  The wait was awful, but had they dealt with it in a nice way, I probably wouldn't be writing this negative review right now. We won't ever go back - too many other steakhouse options in Chicago with far more courteous service.

Located right in the middle of the Viagara Triangle, Tavern on Rush is more of a show than a restaurant.  Come here any major night of the summer or during a weekend day, and you will see some Ferraris or Lamborghinis parked right infront of the place.  Women all glammed up.  It's really like a big spectacle and great for people watching. The restaurant? Well, they have some good stuff, but I don't see what's so special about the place.  Oh right, the location.  If this place were on Grand and Wabash, I guarantee you they wouldn't have that much business. Don't get me wrong, they have some good stuff here, but it's nothing out of the ordinary that would cause rich old guys with Ferraris hunting for 22 year old women with fake boobs to come out JUST for the food.

This place is great if you can find a few seats at the bar or outside for some excellent people-watching. I've tried the food three times and have never thought much of it. Most recently, I had the filet mignon flatbread. It was incredibly bland. Service is generally friendly and prompt but can get a bit flustered during rush hours.

If I could give this no stars I would. Worst restaurant experience I've ever had. Came here with my family , had reservations for 6 and did not get seated until 7:30. The staff was pompous and unfriendly. We were treated very poorly and we decided to eat elsewhere. I will NEVER return to this restaurant.

worst experience ever, my african american family of 6 people had reservations & we arrived atleast an half hour earlier but had  to wake an hour til  after we saw many being seated & I asked someone.  Then we spoke with the GM,who didn't care. We decided to go give our $300+ to Devon's & had a nice meal & enjoyed the atmosphere.  Discrimination is a ugly thing; but watch yourself Tavern on Rush because you'll never know what black person you are mistreating. God Bless America

It's great for people watching no doubt and would be good with a group of friends.  It is a sharp contrast to the bars just North of here where jeans and a t-shirt rule... here only the nicely dressed show off their wares.   Drinks were typically expensive but you are paying for the atmosphere.

I went to Tavern on Rush with my partner and we were greeted and seated by a nice European gentleman who served up with good food and nice conversation. The ambiance was nice and we had a view on the second floor overviewing the park. We ordered the crab cake as an appetizer and, boy do I tell ya, it was fantastic. It was chunky and creamy, quite large in size and filling might I add. For the price, you would expect it to be huge and delicious and it was definitely just that. We ordered some wine but I don't recall which particular one we did, I think it was a zinfandel and a merlot. I ordered the Shrimp Cipriani for my entree and my partner ordered the Ribeye. I was quite stuff with the crab cake that I barely touched my entree. From what I remembered, it was creamy and the shrimps were delicious. The pasta was nicely seasoned even though I had to add extra pepper. This dish tasted much better as left overs because all of the herbs and spices got enough time to marinate and blend together. The ribeye, from what I was told was good but not big enough as it should of been. All in all, I would go visit this place again.

So, came here about 2 weeks ago w/my friend for a much needed "after work" martini and dinner but were given (no joke) the waitress from hell.... First of all it took her about 25 minutes for her to come over to us. Secondly, I ordered the dragon martini, which usually is my fav. drink there, but when it came (another 25 minutes later) it was very very very strong...which okay - not her fault, but when I asked her to have the bartender remake it she got in my face and said, "Why did you even order a martini? I should have just brought your ass juice."  Umm...then she proceeded to go "THESE DRINKS ARE $12 DOLLARS - THESE DRINKS ARE $12 DOLLARS." Like.... look lady, no shit they are $12 dollars which is why I want to enjoy it ... hello. Anyways, she brought the drink back and of course like I had expected it had 0 alcohol in it. At this point I didn't even want to fight with her. She had ignored me and my friend all night ... she never even came back to see if the drink was okay & if we wanted to order. Morale of the story is we threw down some $ and left ... spending our $$ elsewhere.  So, I'd love to review the food but I can't seeing as our waitress never wanted to take our order. I will say that it looked delish from far away but who knows. God forbid you want you send your steak to get cooked a little more...they might just not cook it at all.

Honestly, it was just OK. But, I will say that their seafood platter appetizer thing was really good. The place is pretty big with 2 floors, but it felt really cramped upstairs. The portion was pretty big, as well. According to my co-worker though the onion rings he got were the best ones he's ever had. It's not too memorable of a place for me though.

Hmmm...I guess it  was ok at first.  I came here for a business lunch, and although I made reservations for 5 people, they took us to a table of 2.  Not the most impressive thing to do. I let this slip, and when we ordered our wine, it came in chilled just like I like white wine, but the server did not pour a sample to either of us to taste it and see if it was ok.   Food was ok, can't really complain. Not sure if I'll stop here soon, though.

Good food, excellent service.  It's steak...really... not much to say about it.  Oh, yes there is... learn how to cook to order.  EVERYTHING here is served rare.  They ask how you want it, but then it will come rare.  We had people order medium rare, medium, and even well done.  They all looked the same... and that was pretty close to raw.  Super red and bloody in the middle.  I was hungry, so just ate around the outside of my steak.  tasted ok.  nothing amazing here.

So the place has a great Patio view I had a Carbonara pasta and my friend had a pizza ,A bit expensive, My waiter she took forever please do better with the waitstaff they are friendly but take forever!

I had a drink there before dinnner with a colleague from overseas, they had no finger food, nor any nusts to go with our drinks. We were dissapointed, for this kind of place, they shozld have some small things to eat.
Always a good time at Tavern. The food is great, the staff is awesome and it's always great for people watching....
Hey ladies if you like rich white horny middle aged men come here. Which is a fact but no biggie. Tavern is pretty chill place and interesting place for people watching.

Always wanted to stop here, so iconic and the weather was awesome to dine on the sidewalk. Oh so popular and we had choice of brunch and lunch. Lovely fruits on hand, special requests, "sauce on side" not tolerated well. Getting brunch took nearly an hour after the kitchen put the sauce on the eggs. Quality of food was great, some cute servers, I would suggest some better management and kitchen staff.  P.S. Had they got our order right, they could have turned that prime real-estate table an extra time during peak service.

Everybody better take advantage of the last few beautiful chicago days left and grab lunch or dinner outside at Tavern!!  Always great service with good food and eye candy.  Its like a fashion show and a car show all rolled up together in the heart of the Viagra triangle

When I'm paying these prices I'd much rather be paying for a good satisfying meal rather than some pretty faces to look at. The meal was quuite disappointing! Being a special occasion, dedided to go all out and order the lobster. It was tough, dry and had way too much cumin(or whatever they sprinkled on it). My husband had bone in filet which was nothing to brag about. Creamed spinach nothing special, potatoes nothing special. Come to think of it, nothing was special, just terribly over priced.
