I thought the meat was a little tough, even though we ordered it medium. When we ordered, we asked if the steak came with any vegetables, our waiter offered to bring us complimentary house salads. That was nice, but the salad was bland. It was warm and the vegetables were just average, not your freshest. The bread basket had a lot of variety so I got all excited, but it looked better than it tasted. In general, the other tables' food looked delicious, I will definitely return to try something else. However, they really should get the basics right (bread and salad).

3 stars is for the people watching primarily.  If you can manage to score a table on the Rush St. side of Tavern you'll love the views - some of the best in the city.  However, I'd recommend going to Gibson's if you want a meal that's actually delicious. Stick to basics at Tavern and prepare yourself for a round of uptight, 20-something hostess' that have an attitude as big as their Joliet hair and wait staff that are hit & miss with their own set of attitudes.  I've had great servers (Woody) and awful ones as well. My most recent experience with salads has proven disappointing btw. They seem to keep their lettuce outside the refrigerators - hmmm - new concept - and serve salads on room temperature plates. Something in a salad needs to be chilled Tavern (just an idea).  Something to indulge in here is the desserts - I ordered a simple scoop of vanilla ice cream with chocolate sauce and the presentation as well as taste were both divine.  If only for the coffee, desserts and people watching - go for it! Btw, skip the oatmeal if you do brunch - ick.

I think the location of this place made me have higher expectations than were met.  It was our first night in Chicago in a beautiful setting. The patio was a bit chilly and our menus were blowing all over the place but it was fun to be outside and people watch on fancy Rush Street.  The bread basket stood out the most, it was a delicious assortment of five or six baked goodies.  We had the crab artichoke dip as an appetizer and it was okay, kind of had a weird aftertaste. The food quality was good from the london broil to the salmon to the chicken, but the flavors were nothing special.  I expected tastier dishes for the prices they were charging. Dessert looked amazing (giant over-sized slices of cakes) but we were too full after the bread, appetizer, salads, and entrees to order any.  Overall the ambience was great and it was a fun dinner with old friends but I'm not sure I would go back.

So the place seemed super busy, but we were there on a saturday night, so that was to be expected.  We opted to sit outside since there seemed to be open tables and we were able to sit down without waiting.  Unfortunately we were seated on the street side away from the building and no where near the space heaters.  It got a little cold, but it wasn't unbearable. The bread basket they brought out was pretty delicious.  We had the crab artichoke crab dip was ok, but nothing amazing.  Each of us had a standard priced item.  But after drinks and everything the bill was still pretty large.  So overall, for the money it wasn't amazing, but the food was pretty decent.
Very nice and massive brunch with an equally-endowed side of surgically enhanced breasts walking all over the place. T The regular menu looks a tad ordinary

Loved it! Nothing to complain about! The upstairs restaurant had a beautiful view of the street below.  The food was absolutely fabulous.  The service was great; our waiter was very friendly and had a great sense of humor.  And, they had a amazing wine list, including on of my favorites, Flowers Pinot Nior. Will absolutely be back!

I have been walking by this place and wanting to go there for months..I finally went last week and was HIGHLY disappointed. We ordered a bottle of wine and as the waiter placed the wine glasses on the table he broke one of them. He apologized, didn't wipe up the shards of glass that burst all over the table and just got a new glass. I proceeded to not notice a very tiny piece of glass and my arm was cut and began to bleed. The waiter told the manager what had happened and all the manager did was bring me bandages.  He wasn't apologetic, we got horrible slow service, no comp because of my injury and the bill for 4 people was well over $300. I will NEVER go back here again.

Fuck vitamins - after deciding I needed a boost after a hard day at work, my friend and I decided to grab some bar stools and see what Tavern on Rush could do about that.  I went w/ the tried and true bartender request of -  "Can you make me something fruity?" - cuz my drinking habits are totally gangsta.  Anyways, the bartender suggested a hybrid pear/awesomeness martini.  He said he'd mix it for me, I could try it, and if I liked it, it was a go.  Can you believe that shit?  Seriously?  So if I don't like it I can just say bite me and not have to pay for it? Needless to say, with a money back guarantee like that you knew that shit was gonna be good.  Liquid candy I say!  So of course I to grab a second one to keep me company on the long train ride home.  PSA:  Have you ever tried Sudoku when you're drunk?  Seriously, I had nothing else to do on the train, but I swear to god I'm a Sudoku master when I get a few martinis in me - my writing is a little off, but I swear vodka makes my puzzle solving skills fabu.  End PSA.  On the food front I didn't venture far and like the burger whore I am, I stuck to what I do best, and ordered the mini burgers - tasty, tasty!  And, drumroll please, I had a drink comped - and I wasn't even wearing a slutshirt.  Operation Fuck Vitamins = Success.

I love people-watching here, but I truly cannot recommend the food. It is just not good.   I had the cobb salad and it was just "ok"....the chicken was so plainly weird, that it seemed as if it can from a package of some sort.    The blood mary and mimosa were really not that good.  The clam chowder was almost awful.

OK, sure....why review a place that's been around forever and that people will go to no matter what the rating? Because even though I will probably be back (I live right in the neighborhood) I have to say the patio service as of late has really pretty much blown. Male servers, as a rule a table of women don't generally like to be referred to as "little ladies". I'm just saying. Also, the "everyone must order an entree on the patio" rule although sensible at prime time perhaps adjustments can be made when the patios half empty and the kitchen closes in under 45 minutes. To be fair, the hostess did seat us after a few minutes. Not to mention with my crew what we sometimes lack in food we always make up in drink. We're not new. The food is always consistent if not overpriced. But you're in the heart of V Triangle and the people watching practically makes it priceless.  Getting back to the service though, last time we were there said male server above not only was condescending and borderline obnoxious but we had to ask for EVERYTHING more then once. It was serving 101 apparently as he literally was bringing one thing to the table at a time. Even the bottle of white we ordered just got plopped down on the table after he poured, not put in an ice bucket as requested. And really, at a place like Tavern should you even have to request? So again, it's a place that people will go to. That's all there is to it. But a little pick-up on the service is definitely in order.

We stopped in for lunch and it was terrific.  I had the blackened Tuna sandwich and my boyfriend had the skirt steak roll.  Both were cooked perfectly and well seasoned.  The food isn't cheap, but I definitely felt like the portion and quality matched up to the price.  Besides, it's great people watching.  I'm putting this place on my list for dinner.

So this place is like an evening of dinner and theater all rolled into one neat, not so little package. This is the 'see and be seen' of the V triangle. Lots of ridiculousness to be had. If you're a Trixie then you probably honestly love this place. I am no Trixie so I get some looks here but fuck it, it's all a part of the fun. The drinks here are stellar, so make sure you hit up the bar. The food is solid. I've had better for less money, and worse for more so figure that little conundrum out. If you're in the triangle on a sunny afternoon, it's totally worth some cocktails at the outdoor patio. The food's good, but you're definitely gonna pay for it. Service is kinda snobby, but I think the waitresses think that only Trixies tip.

Randomly downtown and looking for a bunch spot walk by and like sure lets do this.  Turns out really good brunch (didn't do buffet, never would).  But even better people watching.  So review only for sunday brunch and didn't realize this was such a "name" spot.... new to the midwest.

I have no idea why I keep coming back here. I think it's more a tradition for all of us visiting Chicago to meet up based on one great night five years ago... In the four years since then the generally poor service, try-too-hard crowd, and below par food have taken their toll. Frankly I think this place missed its calling, they should be in Vegas with a strip club on the top floor.

Every time I've walked past this place it's always packed, which makes me wonder, what am I missing out on?  I was in the area doing a little shopping and decided to take a break for a cocktail and appetizer. I sampled the seared ahi tuna it was delectable. The tuna was slightly seared with the perfect portions of ginger and wasabi. The bartender was very attentive and quick with the food and beverage.  One note of caution ... the barracudas are on the prowl!  Ladies be sure and take backup or visit before 5PM.

Lunched late and outdoors on the sidewalk after shopping on Oak Street.  Both the Tavern Chopped Salad (with salmon) and the Azteca Salad (with chicken) were huge, perfectly dressed (moist, but not wet), and crispy-delicious. This is probably the best restaurant-cooked salmon I've had in a long time.  It was a thick piece, grilled perfectly, with a crispy exterior and moist, perfectly cooked interior.  The chicken was similarly well-grilled, with a nice seasoning and perfect char.  They were good additions to the no-meat salads. I also liked their iced-tea.  It was light and perfectly brewed.  I thought the prices were good, considering the quality of the food, the view, the neighborhood, and portion sizes.  I could have shared one salad and been really full. Service was a little slow with bringing the check, but otherwise fine.  Our water and iced tea were refilled constantly.  I would definitely eat here again.  I usually don't like restaurants that attract customers because of the atmosphere or outdoor seating, but the Tavern has good food as well.

I can't believe how packed and hectic this place is. It might be kind of fun for a night out if you're looking to be stared at and talked about as you walk past. The place is so busy that it stressed me out, and so loud that I left with a pounding headache. I agree with others that the service is on the prissy, upity side. Nice but i felt like I was intruding in some way. I went as a double date and we were seated upstairs after over an hour wait. The decor is pretty nice. We were seated around 8:30 and didn't get out of their until around 11. I ordered the Caprese Salad which was on special that night. It was over-priced and the flavor was one-dimensional and boring. I've had my fair share of Caprese salads and this one was mediocre at best. My date had the Teryaki beef appetizer which was four bites worth of food. Tasty but almost aggravating at how small a portion it was. We also tried the loaded potato which was nothing special. Our friends ordered the baby back ribs, which were ok.  All in all, the food was nothing impressive and somehow we ended up paying an arm and a leg for it. I left feeling kind of angry that we wasted our money. I'm glad we tried it, but I would only go again if someone else planned the night. If you enjoy loud atmosphere's and people watching, this place is for you!

Three and a half stars is pretty right on for this place.  The food is really good.  The staff is kind of snotty though.  They could definitely tone down the attitude a bit.  I might return when I come back to Chicago but I'm not going to seek this place out.  Most likely only if it's convenient for me.

The fact that this place is situated in what the locals call the "Viagra Triange" made this place awesome before we even stepped thorugh the door. My first stop was the bathroom where they had a lovely woman waiting to open doors for me, turn on the faucet and give me lotion and mints. I love places like this! Step a little further in, go up the stairs to the table and... horse racing memorobilia! I LOVE IT! I love horses and I love horse racing. I was on a business trip and definitely missing my retired race horse, Molly. It was really great.  The other reason i love this place ie because how late it's open. We were seated at 11pm and when finished upat 12:15 they were still seating.  I had the tomato bisque to start and it was one of the best I've ever had. For dinner I had the BBQ chicken pizza which was also really good and even better when I ate it cold in my hotel room a few hours later.  My boss, whom I went with. had the planked salmon which looked excellent and it must have been because she finished it all and it was huge. She had the heriloom tomato salad which also looked yummy. I ate her mashed potatoes and they were divine.  The best part of the whole experience? Aside from the fine service, it was the bread basket! They brought out a delicious selection of breads and butter that were defintiely much needed, much appreciatd, and much enjoyed. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice and somewhat pricey meal.

This is a great spot to hit up if you're looking for a drink and some silly flirting at the bar.  The bartenders are fast and efficient and the drinks are very well made.  When patrons get out of hand the bartenders will kick them out before you can think twice.  While I don't have plans to become a regular, it's a good fall-back spot in the neighborhood for drinks and something that always turns into a good story.
This place was pretty damn good. I ate wayyyyy to much!!!! I would recommend it again and defintiely go back

i use to live down the block from this place and also work down the block from here and there is a bunch of things that id love to recommend. 1.  make sure you hit up outside when its nice out...its a hot spot..good lookin people and lots of good times..come on its viagra triangle why not 2.  make sure you hit up the grilled portabella on focaccia for lunch....big big fan of this..its massive and tastes awesome..either split it or take the other half home 3.  if you go for dinner..make sure you get reservations and sit upstairs..class it up a bit..they have a nice wine menu and great selections..i tend to go with the lake superior white fish which is doused in butter...its really really good..you know what...i just changed my rating from 4 stars to 5 while i was writing this review..i love this place 4.  if your headin out at night and its between 9pm and 3am...the bar downstairs is a nice spot to be seen..often famous people are there and the girls are super hot...the best part is the older dudes hollerin at them 5.  the service has always been top of the line..they really go all out to make you happy and thats at both the bar and upstairs go hit this place up often any day of the week and you will be very pleased

Most people only know about Tavern for their bar scene which, let's be honest, is awesome. I don't care if you're looking for nice, older women and watching creepy, old dudes mack on younger girls (both are totally awesome, by the way), it's always a great time. But, joke's on everyone, because their food is wildly underrated.  Now you might have to sit upstairs to truly enjoy it, but I'm telling you it's there. It's actually quiet up ther. Tavern has nice, extensive menus. They have great wines (not that I really care because I go right for the gin, but for people who like, they have you covered). They always have great specials. Great fish. I mean, come on, what else do you want me to say?

While I know this restaurant is a huge tourist trap, I love it! The customer service is always great, I love the outdoor patio, and the food is always really good. This is one of my favorite brunch place, and the mud pie dessert is to die for!

Dear Tavern on Rush, I love you!  I had hung out at the bar a couple times with less than stellar service, so I was a tad pessimistic about eating here. But my food was so amazing I must give you props! First, you're so polite and quickly took myself and my friend upstairs to an awesome table.  Our waiter was super professional, polite and down to earth!  Before he took my drink away, he asked... "Make sure you get that last sip!"  I appreciate your consideration! Now... the meat platter.  He came out an explained the vast array of steaks that you offer, and wow it was impressive!  You almost changed my mind of my meal, then I realized I am still on a diet and need to keep it cool. What else did I love?  The bread basket.  I'm not even a big bread eater because I'm on a perpetual diet, but I absolutely loved the tomato bread that you had in the basket.  It was delish. For an appetizer, I had the most amazing Tuna Tartare.  Being the pickiest of parties about Tuna Tartare (I'm also an a Francophile), I came into this kind of pessimistically.  And it was so fresh, tasty, and had the perfect balance of avocado and tuna.  The presentation was beautiful, especially the little cucumber and field greens thing you put around the dish. For my meal, I had the swordfish.  I've never ordered swordfish before in my life, but you've made me a believer.  It came on a bed of veggies, and had this fabulous dijon sauce.  The meal actually looked like more of dessert than a hearty seafood dish! My friend had the warm spinach salad, and now I'm going gaga for that too!  The idea seems a little gross, but the execution was fabulous!  I might go back just for that. The grand finale... chocolate tiramisu.  AMAZING!  It was so good... not soggy, not too cold, not too heavy.  It was just right. I'm stingy with my 5-Stars, but Tavern on Rush, you earned it.  I will be back, the next time I can convince a guy to take me here on a date :). Love, Tiffany

So part of my little relaxation day included lunch at Tavern on Rush.  After waiting for the hostess for a few minutes, we were seated in the bar area.  The boy and I decided to have a little international lunch with potstickers and pasta.  The potstickers were perfect! Not too doughy with three different sauce options, the traditional soy was my favorite. We had the same pasta, I don't remember what it was called, but it was super thick, long noodles in a cream sauce. I think I died and went to heaven...it was delicious. Our waitress left something to be desired, she was sort of gruff and could have been a little more attentive.  Although, I noticed she was super friendly to other diners, so maybe she just didn't like us...I dunno. Anyway, I'll def be back for more potstickers and pasta!
Simply Amazing Good For any nice occasion

It is a great atmosphere.  The upstairs is small and intimate, which I love.  The only complaint is that it is fairly loud and hard to hold a conversation.  I had the fillet and it was superb, granted I am not a steak person, I still thought it was fabulous.  A few people had pasta and it was delish.  It is a great place to go with friends or family.

A solid lunch spot.  On the day we came, it was sunny and warm outside, but the wait for outdoor tables was so long, that we just gave up and went inside.  A spot in the window was the next best thing. Our waitress was very friendly and I really appreciated her honesty that the lobster bisque would be "fishy."   I ordered the grilled cheese with avocado, bacon, and tomato and it was perfect.  Exactly what I needed.  The fries were good, but helped out by the chipotle aioli that I requested for dipping.   For some reason, however, the whole restaurant smelled fishy, which was a bit of a turnoff. An easy place to get a good, filling, and affordable lunch.

What can I say other then PERFECTION.  Love the KC Bone in cut's for Steaks.  Service and wine list are both fantastic.  In the summer if you happen to be in the neighborhood I recommend getting a seat out front and grab little pizza.  Top Notch!

just went for appetizers and drinks after first friday @ mca.  TOR was pretty crowded which was great to see, but was still easy to grab a table in the bar. Drinks were perfect (great to still see a bar that brings you tonic water in a little bottle to mix at the table) and our pizza and soup was very tasty.

Everything you would expect. The service is completely professional and upstanding. While the food is not exactly as dynamite as some of its competitors, the main reason to go here is the rush scene. Outside during the summer, or even dining in the bar area is always accommodating and entertaining.

This place is the biggest joke ever. We went there for lunch and it literally was 85$ for 2 people. The food was no better than something you'd get at a local applebees. the server was completely out of it the whole time, possibly on drugs, and there were about 4 people in the whole place. What is going on at these restaurants?! I mean you just dont get what you pay for anymore. But I will never go back in there again. Oh and there was a dead cockroach in the bathroom on the floor. Just bad stuff.

Food was overpriced, however it was very comfortable environment and good place to go to chill out for lunch. might be good place to spend time with your friends for good converstaion and to people watch,as if you can sit at a couch area plenty of room and nice experience

After my first experience at TOR, I was definitely not blown away.  The food was good, but definitely overpriced.  The service was just okay, not great.  Considering the prices, I expect the service to be fantastic.  We ordered the salmon, ribs and pork chop.  The ribs and pork chop were good, and the salmon was ok.  The beer on tap selection was extremely limited, considering the downstairs looked like a high-end sports bar.  I will go back again, but if I'm not more impressed next time I will move on.

Man this place sucks!!!  It is the essence that is the "Viagra Triangle."  If you are an older dude with money looking for women looking for older dudes with money, this place is your heaven.  I wish i could remember the name of the MTV show that followed around an old rich guy and his young stripper-looking girlfriend that would frequent this place (the MTV show actually shows them inside Tavern on Rush); find the show on YouTube and you will see an accurate representation of the patrons. If you are a cosmetic surgeon, you might consider hanging out here to find some new clients.    If i go out in the Viagra Triangle area, which isn't often, i go to Lux Bar.

3.5+ Drinks and drinks only here. The crowd is very Rush street. If ya know what i mean, maybe you do but maybe you don't. There were some friendly people there but really I felt a bit out of place since it was more a place in the evening to scope out eligible trixies and eligible "V" cocktail people. I don't know, I will have to go again to get a better feel but this place was just ok. Maybe I should come back for lunch and the evening scene is just "meh". The decor was very nice and open.

Spending Christmas Eve in Chicago is a happy and festive time. Shoppers rushed around for last minute presents, taxi's sped around picking up passengers, now, snow and more snow. We ducked into the Tavern on Rush for a pre-dinner drink and found ourselves in  nice little old-world winter wonderland. Service was fast and friendly, even if we did arrive 10 minutes before last call. The drinks were strong and the atmosphere put us in the Christmas mood. Great job guys!

I've been here a couple of times and somehow I always expect more. The food is OK, the service OK, the clientele dire. It's a medicore choice for lunch but there are many better options in the area for the same price. The outside seating is nice though. Skip this place at night is you are not made of plastic and looking for an old guy jacked up on viagra with one foot in the grave and the other on a banana peel.

While not a classic steak house in the traditional sense of the word, TOR is definitely an old boy's club with great people watching and they serve a decent steak.  I've been here countless times and can tell you there is a lively, thriving bar scene full of gorgeous Gold Coasters and a few stray tourists thrown in for texture. Service is professional and fast and cocktails are potent! In the summer, the people watching from the sidewalk cafe is some of the best in the world and I use for comparison the Champs d'Elysee in Paris and Via Veneto in Rome. Its that fabulous!  Upstairs it has a clubby feel and updated racing stats from the best tracks in the States. Service is refined and knowledgeable and the food is really decent. The menu is kind of scattered but there is something for everyone. They will do the dog and pony show with the cuts of meat if you ask, just like the neighbors do. Share the sides, they are giant but the Chipotle Mac and Cheese is wonderful as is the spinach.  Wine list runs the gamut from inexpensive Benzinger to La Fite Rothschild so have an idea of where you want to be or you could be overwhelmed and caught up in the "money" vibe and overspend...  One of the best steak sandwiches in town and the Pot Roast Sandwich is a little piece of heaven. Make reservations though or the wait can be draining. Both physically and financially.

I should start this review by saying that I am a vegetarian, so I can't really comment on the meats, which are the prime focus of a steakhouse. I was initially attracted to this steakhouse because it had an extensive menu of sides, salads, pastas, and pizzas for me while my friends could enjoy filling their bellies with dead cow. And while none of the meat eaters were disappointed, I certainly was. I started with the Tomato Bisque. It looked delicious, but was way over-salted. Then for an entree I decided to try their warm spinach salad, because it seemed like something different. It wasn't horrible, but it was one of those things that after a few bites you really just don't want anymore. It was completely bland with no dressing or sauce aside from the olive oil drizzled on the spinach.  And after looking at other sides, I really feel that this restaurant puts minimal effort into making anything tasty aside from meat. This may be okay with out Midwestern folks, but I like a bit of flavor and spice.  Finally for dessert, we split their brownie ala mode. All I can say is that it was so bad, we didn't finish it. The brownie had the texture of a Little Debbie snack cake minus the moisture that would have made it delicious. And instead of a warm fudge sauce, it appeared to be topped with Hershey syrup. The only part we found edible was the ice cream, which was light and fluffy. So basically, if you don't mind bland boring food or really just want meat, this might be the place for you. If you are like me and looking for something more, I would go elsewhere.

So I need to update my review to include my take out order for dinner: I ordered the single chop (which comes with apple compote) and the warm spinach salad.  I was a bit disappointed in both.  The chop was cooked perfectly, tender and juicy, however, the apples were dissapointing as they both looked and tasted like something you would find at OCB (that's Old Country Buffet, a place senior citizens love and frequent, for those of you that aren't familiar).  Very dissapointing for a place that boasts high quality food.   The spinach salad was unique with roasted tomatoes and red onions, however it was the extreme amount of garlic used in the dish that threw me (and the taste of this dish) off.  I only ate about half of my meal, figuring I would give the reheat another try.  However, it was still just as bad.  Maybe it's my fault for ordering out, but I think the restaurant is overpriced for the food you get.

If you want a good steak this is the place to go!!!  The restaurant is really pretty and located upstairs.  The Bar downstairs is a fun atmosphere but more for people in their early 30's, but still fun to go to.  The whole area there on Rush street is a lot of fun.

Food very average. Server has been excellent each time I have dined there, but just average meal. The bar is always a zoo, while a fun zoo, a meat market. Glorious people watching, I am guilty, trust me. Cocktail servers in bar can have a serious attitude, not all, but most. Definitely Viagra Triangle's finest people watching spot. I don't even bother with outside seating, there is a time limit and you have to stake your table like you are trying to get tickets to a sold out event. Not that important.

I still cannot believe the attitude our waitress gave us right off the start considering we were one of her two tables on a Sunday morning.  She was snappish and threw in a lot of eye-rolling and a curled upper lip.  She messed up one of the orders; one person in my group asked for the banana griddled pancakes and when the pancakes arrived with no bananas we told her that we ordered them with the bananas but her response was "No, you did not." Probably not a good idea to tell customers they are wrong if you want a good tip...Speaking of the tip, she wrote her own tip in ballpoint pen on the bill when she brought it out to us.  Yeah, we're really inclined to give you your 20% tip you think you deserve. The food was okay but was disappointing considering the price.  The granola and fresh fruit with vanilla yogurt was nothing special--they were also really stingy with the yogurt and granola for a $9 breakfast dish.  I think we would have liked the pancakes more had we not dealt with such horrible service.  Shauna's skillet scramble was decent and it came with this salty biscuit with dried cranberries, which was a really odd combination.   The food at the restaurant restaurant probably has a lot of potential, but the service we received during brunch was so bad that I do not recommend it.

Really good brunch! I can't say much about the rest of the menu other than it is kind of expensive. It is probably comparable to other restaurants in this area. The restaurants in this area are really not my scene; a wee bit pretentious. Though the food I had was really good, I don't think it is necessarily worth the extra money.

I was in Chicago visiting a friend last weekend and came here for dinner on Friday night. Coming from Wrigley we were definitely not dressed appropriately but the hosts still nicely seated us. We sat upstairs, which had a nice decor and atmosphere.  I think that we all ordered some steak and could not have been more pleased with our selection. I suggest the peppercorn sauce to go along with the steak as well as the garlic mashed potatoes.  Overall, it was a great meal to start my visit in Chicago.

I always wanted to try this place, but I thought it looked a little too expensive.  It's actually somewhat affordable.  The pizza I ordered was a little less than $10. I did think their wine list was a bit overpriced.  We ended up spending over $60 on wine.  We were having a late lunch, so over the course of the meal we had two waiters, since the shifts were changing.  The first waiter had been working since 8am so he acted a little brain dead.  He looked really tired and he even told us that he just wanted to go home.  My friend, the waiter and myself just sat in silence as he opened our wine bottle.  Very awkward.  He was replaced by a very sweet and attentive waitress, so that worked out nicely.   I would recommend eating outside if you can.  We ate inside because it was air conditioned and there was no wait.  However, I wish we had had lunch outside since it looks like a whole different experience.

One of my nearest and dearest friends is here from NYC, there are only a few weeks of summer left, and I wanted to show him the Viagra Triangle. I love the atmosphere and people watching, but the food has never impressed me.  I am a lover of tuna tartare. If it's on the menu, I'm getting it. I was so disappointed! It did not have any flavor... it might as well been sashimi with some lemon juice.  I had the chopped salad with grilled salmon. I asked for the vinagrette on the side, but it came in the salad. No big deal. Then the salmon was overcooked and dry. I didn't have much of it. Benji had the Bellevue salad. At first they brought out the wrong salad, but then corrected it in a few minutes.  Service was just ok. Everyone is so busy in the restaurant that the servers can't do a good job. However, our drinks were always replenished even before we finished them. So they were paying attention to something! Even though I didn't like the food, I love people watching in the area. Maybe I should stick to Carmines or Gibsons.

6:00 reservation and it's 5:00?  Time to hit a bar.  Despite it being a beautiful summer Friday evening, we walked right in and scored a table in the bar.  Downside: my compatriots were drinking Michelob Ultra and Amstel Light, respectively.  Ben P. doesn't drink Ultra or Amstel.  Ben P drinks Ketel One martinis.  And since I was buying, I helped myself. The waitstaff were attentive without being intrusive.  Two rounds later, it was dinner time at Gibson's across the street.  Tavern, you done good.

I think this is one of the great lunch spots. I used to work around here and everytime I went in for lunch I had a pleasant experience. The salads are awesome - especially the salmon one. I always had the same waiter and he was funny and looked super young. I always enjoy talking to the wait staff when I order and he did a good job of entertainment. I would definitely recommend it for lunch away from a busy day at work :)

Tavern on Rush is a perfect location for a little Sunday Funday and people-watching action in the Viagra Triangle. Their filet oscar was good enough to make my mouth water ever so slightly as I wrote those words, the drinks were solid and delicious, and the sidewalk tables on a sunny weekend afternoon are prime real estate!

I absolutely love this restaurant. Granted I'm not a steak aficionado, but I think their steaks are delicious and I couldn't imagine wanting much more. I have had amazing service each time as well. They are kind, answer all our questions, never in a rush, and very attentive. They have an excellent wine list and help lead you through the selection if you have any questions. And the crab cakes are to die for!! I love taking any guest here that wants a delicious steak and I would recommend it to anyone!

Tavern on Rush - my girlfriend used to be a hostess here and it's hilarious: The people who think the food here is mindblowingly amazing are people who've never heard of Moto, Avenues, Charlie Trotter's, French Laundry, Le Bernardin or El Bulli. The people who think the food here is disappointingly godawful are people who eat all too often at Moto, Avenues, Charlie Trotter's, French Laundry, Le Bernardin, or El Bulli. Yes, it's as middling upscale a steakhouse as they say. Yes, it's in the heart of the Viagra Triangle and uppercrust sketchiness ensues there as often as they say. Crowd: Forget 60-40's. You will definitely see 60-20 couples here. and the 20 year olds look like teenagers. Food: Most things on the menu are decent but overpriced. The one thing I NEVER regretted getting here: BIG CHOCOLATE CAKE. rich, decadent, chocolate, huge...mmm party in my mouth!

Three stars on Yelp means A-OK, and that's exactly what this place is. Not bad, not great. I came here for brunch on Sunday a couple weeks ago with my parents and sister when they visited for the weekend. We wanted to sit outside on the patio, but when we got there, the reservation I made was only for the inside dining room and we didn't have time to wait another half hour for an outside table. This makes sense, I suppose, but I was bummed. I ordered a breakfast burrito, my sister ordered strawberry-mango pancakes, my husband and dad ordered some kind of skillet dishes, and my mom got the salmon-brie-asparagus omelette. Everything was good, nothing fantastic. I'd try it again since I haven't been for lunch or dinner and the patio/dining room are both very nice, but my impression was it was OK. P.S. Also, when we got our bill, our entire credit card number was listed, as opposed to just the last 4 digits--watch out for this and alert them if it happens.

The food here is good but over priced.  However, the bar menu is not too over the top for what it is.  The service here is good in my experience as well.  This place is a great example of why they call it the Viagra triangle.  There are ALWAYS old men with young girls here.  The last time I went here I was talking to a girl.  After a long conversation I asked her what she does and she said she was a prostitute.   Oh well, I guess I am not as charming as I thought.  This is the epitome of a Rush street bar not great but ok.

Tavern on Rush is OK.  Food, drinks and service are fine, though for my experience nothing special.  The clientele can be either a bit young........old.........or too far out town to make it something a local could enjoy.  I have to say I never a saw so many striped dress shirts...untucked.......in my life time *evil grin*.   They do reserve section in the bar area, but this is basically your brass and dark oak bar located in a famous area of town.   Valet is good, though can get a bit overwhelmed at certain times of the evening. Is it a good place to take a date?  No.  Is it a good place for dinner?  There are probably other places near by that would make a diner happier.   But if you are looking for the V-Triangle effect, this is a good place to start the evening.

More like Tavern on Barf.  I've been here once for dinner, once for drinks.  Food was OK at best, somewhat nice atmosphere upstairs and the service was good (so 2 stars for that :)).  Then came here for drinks once for a friend's bday and I think we all felt like our bodies had a severe plastic deficiency compared with the other clientele.  It was straight up NASTY.  Old(er), probably married men hitting on skankified women draping themselves all over them.  Not to mention a waitress who was VERY inconvenienced by us sitting at her table and ordering drinks.  Just so you know, doll, 20-something women can tip just as much as 80 yr old men AND you don't need to flirt with us!!

We were in Chicago for a few days as we prepared to relocate to that city from San Francisco. We made a reservation on Open Table. It looked like it would be perfect for what we wanted for dinner - casual but great food. I was wearing jeans, nice shoes and a shirt and tie. We walked in and immediately were given attitude. They claimed they didn't have our reservation and asked - "did you make it on the Internet?" Then it was - "Are you sure you made the reservation at Tavern on Rush?" Of course I was sure. I can even go back to Open Table and find it. What kind of customer service is that?? So the manager begrudgingly gave us a table. There were plenty available but he gave us the worst one in the house. We asked to be reseated and he said if we weren't happy we could leave - and we did. We asked for the owner's number and he told us he didn't know what it is.  I don't know what their problem was. If we were not dressed appropriately, they should have just said so - but there are pictures on their web site with customers wearing football jerseys.  But maybe that was the problem. See, I am gay. Maybe they are just don't want gays there - it makes the sports fans uncomfortable. Whatever. So I am writing this to let everyone know this is a very unfriendly place. And they should be ashamed of themselves.

Avoid Tavern on Rush.  I was there last weekend for dinner and the wait staff is terribly rude. Let me give you a few examples.  First, we asked to sit outside at which point we were told that if it rains then we would not have a table for use inside.  Then the waiter made a point to tell us that there's a 2 hour limit when sitting outside.  Finally, the waiter was very insistent that we have appetizers when we stated that we didn't want any.  Tavern on Rush acts like they are doing you a favor by serving you.  Not only are the prices ridiculous for what they are offering but they are truly not appreciative of their patrons.  It's just another tourist trap restaurant that acts like they'll never see you again anyway.

There's a swag about this place. The envy to get old faster increases when you see an older crowd managing to fit so well with the few young and restless. I wonder what the subject of the conversation might be... Tavern on Rush is mix between lounge and restaurant. I have been here many times(Day or Night) and there's always a pretty good crowd with at least 1 or 2 celebrities. Cedric the Entertainer was sitting right across from us and before you know it, He took us all to Level for some dancing.  We always sat on the lounge section and easily blew more than $300.00 in a matter of 1hour. Definitely not a cheap place, but of course it's expected. Our waitresses have always been attentive and fast.  I could easily give this place a 5 stars rating , but while ladies are allowed to wear hats, guys are Not. Not a big fan of bathroom attendants neither! Let me do my thing.  This is a good hangout  spot conveniently located with many others.

I have to say, I like this restaurant, but only for lunch. I've been disappointed at dinner before. I had reservations once for a month prior to dining there and the hostess still made us wait and said something like "Our reservations aren't always official." Really strange. I thought the dinner took way too long to arrive, and I guess since I'm not a big steak eater I was totally annoyed by the whole "showing the cuts of meat" thing... But regardless, I've also been for lunch 2 or three times and it's much more casual with better service during the day. Good sandwiches and soup. Outdoor seating.

I have only been here once and I had a great time. I think you are more or less paying for the location than the food. Don't get me wrong the food was really good, but nothing outrageous. This place is popular because it's on Rush (so I guess that means it HAS to be good), but I had higher expectations. I would go back because it had a good atmosphere no matter what kind of night you are going for and the food and service were really good.

My girlfriend and I ran into this place after a long-day of city-seeing, and it definately looked like the place to be on a Saturday night. The atmosphere is classy and chill, and watching the rogain men wine and dine the blonds was great!!  Since we had drank enough the night before (and barely made it to the city) we laid off the martinis (though they looked abs delic!). The food itself was alright, nothing fabulously new, but not bad either.  Though our waitress totally forgot the fancy breads, the service was still awesome. The bar area was super crowded, but one of the waitors ran around looking for a table for us. While we were waiting we stood around the bar to avoid breathing down any of the diners' necks, waiting for their table. Unfortunately, the courtesy was not reciprocated. While we were in the middle of a warm, chocolate chip brownie (a real party for the taste buds) a couple girls asked for our table. We told them we would finish up in five or ten minutes, so they decided to lean up against our little round table, and watch us eat. Seriously, she was in my face enough to drool all over my vanilla bean ice cream. Grrrr... Naturally, we took twice as long. or thrice.

Dined here w/christine f. & some gal pals for a b-day celebration. I'd pretty much concur w/everything she said about the place, though I didn't sample enough of the Bellevue Salad or the Organic Mixed Greens to comment. Unfortunately, the London Broil was my idea. Was SO looking forward to it, and was SO disappointed. So much for "house specialty." I did, however, enjoy everything else AND the intense chocolate cake. Service was prompt and attentive. I left my wine choice up to the server, and he selected a lovely cabernet to accompany my lackluster meal. As far as restaurant bathrooms go, this one's pretty luxe--don't forget to bring a tip in with you. Overall, a pretty swanky joint that's not quite my style, but I certainly enjoyed it and would go back. If you like feeling like you're a member of a fancy VIP club that serves reliable, classic dishes, Tavern is for you.

Tavern is always a great place to get a drink and recoup after a hectic day of shopping on Rush St.  The pomegranate martinis are amazing!!!   Seriously, I crave them...the food is also quite good.  One of my favorite treats is getting the Grilled Cheese Sandwich,.. bacon, avocado..wow, def one of the best in the city.  Everything is prepared nicely, however, I'll pass on the chopped salad next time, as it was nothing to write home about.    All in all, I would definitely recommend Tavern for lunch or dinner...I'm certain we will continue to visit frequently.

Tavern on Rush was good.  Even though the host told me on the phone they had no tables, when I showed up 20 minutes later on a Saturday night I was seated immediately in the restaurant on the 2nd level.   Me and the BF had a huge white booth in the middle of the restaurant.  The waiter was good at checking on us without being annoying.  We ordered a bottle of pinot noir and the blackened cajun shrimp to start.  Shrimp was good BUT TASTED AMAZING WITH THE MUSTARD SAUCE IT CAME WITH!  I kinda want to go back and just order this! I ordered crab legs.  They were great.  The amount was less than I get at Shaws but I was definitely stuffed.  The BF ordered a filet and thought it was good but he has had better.  We also got a side of mashed potatoes which were awesome.  I am sure they were filled with tons of butter but they were worth any extra calories. (Not sure about the price since I didn't have to pay!)

I have eaten here several times in the last few months and it's finally time to give my review.  Let me preface by saying that of all the times I've eaten here it is only because my best pal loves the Big Chocolate Cake (as do I) and she HAS to have it at least once a month.  I don't much care for the neighborhood nor the crowd (see my review of P.S. Chicago).   The Bellevue Salad is fantastic.  Everything in it, from the rock shrimp to the hearts of palm to the avocado, is plentiful and is always fresh.  The Organic Mixed Greens salad with grilled chicken is usually also very good, but this weekend the chicken was ridiculously DRY, ick.   I went there this weekend with a group of 6 to celebrate a birthday.  The service was excellent, very attentive.  Our water glasses and cocktails seemed to magically always be full.   The Seared Sesame Hawaiian Tuna was very good, prepared exactly how I like it.  The sauteed spinach was a huge hit at our table.  I ordered  a Chilean Sea Bass with risotto.  It was phenomenal.  I only wish the portion of fish was bigger because everyone at the table had a bite!  It was cooked perfectly, we all agreed that it melted in our mouths.  Drool. The London Broil, however, was a huge disappointment.  It was a bit dry and tasteless and chewy.  Not good, especially considering it is listed as a House Specialty.  Avoid at all costs. The Big Chocolate Cake managed to help us move on from the disappointing London Broil.  Like the other restaurants in the area, the slice of cake is HUGE, enough to feed all 6 of us...but we ordered 2 anyway, so the birthday girl could bring home leftovers.  If you love rich, dark, fudgey chocolate cakes, this is the cake for you.

ICK. All I can say about this place is ICK. At first glance it seems like a sort of classy joint, after about 5 minutes I found it funny/entertaining, but after 15 minutes in the place I felt like running out before I caught some scary disease. They don't call this area the Viagra Triangle for nothing... this is a perfect example of why. If you're into fake fake fake - ness, this is your place. Fake boobs, fake personalities, guys faking like they're loaded, gold-digging bimbos... I could go on, but I think you get the point. I cannot comment on the food as I didn't try to eat there. All I had was an overpriced marini served by a bartender with major attitude.

Real Estate is the only reason to enjoy their outdoors in summer. Food is absolutely atrocious and I don't say that lightly. Last time I sent back my Chopped salad. Just inedible, tasteless, lettuce cut to a 1000 pieces and no add ons at all. The salmon served with it had been on the warmer since 7.00 am? or the previous day?  Service is a hit or mis, dependent whom is waiting on you. People watching is the best in the City when sitting outside. The one star given is for people watching only

Tavern is my go to spot for girl dinners.  Is it pretentious?  It can be.  Great sevice?  The worst.  There food is pretty stable in terms of being decent.  Its a block from my house and is great for wine and laughs.  You'll probably have some weird old men sitting on both sides of you trying to act cool which is always entertaining.  If you haven't been - go, just don't expect to thoroughly impressed.

Unfortunately I left my Bentley back at the dealership (eyeroll) therefore my service was a tad bit lacking, but the food was dead on.  More importantly, I felt the ambiance to be superb.  Especially the gentlemen's lounge esk feel in the bar.  Sadly, they need to change the glass flower display in the center of the bar.  It was hot the first time I saw it..........although, amazingly one year later it doesn't have the same affect.

After wedding dress shopping, my mom, sister, and I decided to have brunch at Tavern on Rush about a week ago.  The outdoor seating was packed so we decided to sit inside.  The hostess at the front was really rude.  However, all was forgotten when our waiter served us.  I got some freshly squeezed OJ while my sister got the strawberry orange juice.  They were both very good.  My sister and mom both had the blueberry pancakes.  They were psyched when they saw the menu have the half portions for the pancakes.   I got the blueberry french toast which was fantastic.  My mom agreed and practically started eating off my plate!  I did feel they were understaffed that day.  We waited forever for our check when we were done because our waiter was serving other tables.  Overall good experience and the food is yum.

Seriously, if the plate were big enough, I could roll around in a chopped salad from Tavern on Rush - like a pig in shi*t, feasting on all the tiny, cut-up pieces of fresh vegetables.  Lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, eggplant, asparagus, and more!  You can even add chopped grilled chicken!  No joke, the chopped salad is that good.  The Bellevue salad is also chopped, and it contains favorites such as chilled shrimp and hearts of palm.   Salads aside, I am generally a fan of the Tavern because its lively and great for people watching (and the occasional celebrity sighting).  The bartenders are always friendly and often cute.  And girls, if you show enough skin, you'll probably get some free drinks from the older male patrons.
Service was great we had a brunch reservation and wanted outdoor seating with an umbrella, we were promptly seated and our food was delicious. I definitely recommend this place for brunch!

A great place to see and be seen.  I have been there a few times and I have never really enjoyed the food. I thought I might have just gone on a bad night or ordered the wrong thing, but it never fails I always walk away from Tavern a little disappointed.  If you want to see R. Kelly, Vince Vaughn, Charlie Weiss, a Chicago Bull, Bear, Cub or White Sox, then this is the place to be. If you want great food, go somewhere else.

Went here with a friend for lunch during the week, and were able to sit outside at a really nice table.  The server was brand new ("this is my second day") and wasn't familiar with the menu.  We split an appetizer of the Cajun Shrimp, and for $15.95, there isn't a bigger rip-off on the menu.  I ordered the Firecracker Chicken as my entree, that, according to the menu, came with mango and a noodle salad.  Well, I guess noodle salad means pasta soaking in a pound of pesto-oil.  I was very disappointed but didn't want to make a scene so tried my best to eat the so called spicy chicken, and leave most of the oil-soaked pasta.  My friend had the goat cheese salad and thought it was really unfilling.  No dessert this time, decided to go to the Ghiradeli Chocolate shop and create our own sundae, which was a great idea.  Go to Gibson's or Hugo's across the street if you want real food.
I enjoy Tavern on Rush.  Their blackened shrimp appetizer is yummy. and I REALLY enjoyed their crab cake!!!!  a lot of crab meat!!!! good food and in the neighborhood.  sweeeeeeet!
For lunch this place is GREAT! The waiter was super nice. The price was good. The food was great.

4.5 stars...... for the bar part.  i didn't eat here..... I was told that this was not a place "foodies" would eat at.... so I went to Tavern on Rush AFTER dinner. HOPPIN' and HAPPENIN' place....!! There are all kinds here, from young preppy college boys to the techno-geeks in town for a convention, to the Italian Mafia types, to the "I own half of Chicago - what you got" types.... old, fat, ugly, hot, handsome, sexy, trendy, straight, gay, grungy, spiffy.... you name it, they be at Tavern on Rush.  The waitstaff was great. Nice waiters, pretty waitresses.....  I'm partial to the waiters given that I'd been gunning for an empty table when one pulled me aside and asked if I wanted a table, and when I nodded vehemently, he led me to a table that opened as we approached.  It was like following Moses through the Red Sea. In Chicago, single and looking for a fun night? Definitely head to Tavern on Rush.  I'd have a blast here doing Girls' Night Out, hahaha..... or you boys can have a feast hangin' out here.  But for dinner, do go elsewhere as the food I saw look unremarkable at best..... and if you're looking for some nice place at which to have a drink with some friends with just good music and atmosphere, head somewhere else.  Welcome to the Meat Market.

Come here for the tassled-shoe/khaki/glittery-tube-top scene.  It's like dinner and a show.  Totally is middle aged dudes trying to pick up young gals who want their money.  The essence of "Viagra Triangle".  That said, if you fit one of those profiles then this is probably your mecca. I couldn't get the f_ck out of there fast enough.

I heart this place.  I miss it now that I'm living in Boston!!  Sure it can get a little creepy after hours in the bar... all attractive 20-somethings beware, those miserly men will eat you alive! BUT, lunch, dinner... it's great.  The view is perfect for people watching and I never eat in the restaurant, the bar is the best area for lunch on a sunny day.  Drinks are stiff and the food is heartily portioned and won't rip apart your wallet.  Gourmet eats, strong drinks and great atmosphere, whether with friends, family...whateva.

Went on a date and made a dinner out of 3 appetizers. All 3 were just plain bad and tasted like they had been sitting under a heat lamp for a half hour. Soggy, not hot, bland. Server was borderline condescending. Just a bad experience.

Went here last night for dinner. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar and had a drink. Everyone is right, the people watching is GREAT! Definitely a lot of older men. Good place to frequent if you are looking to meet the sugar daddy of your dreams. The food is pretty good. I had the crab legs and tried a piece of my boyfriend's steak. The steak was very good and I generally do not like steak. The service was OK. Our waiter was very pretentious. I probably would not go back.

Located in the heart of the "Viagra Triangle", Tavern on Rush is one of many cookie-cutter steak eateries in the area. Me and four of my buddies headed here expecting a good experience. When it came time to order drinks, I was slightly disturbed when the waiter denied my request for a Mojito. If only that were the end of it. We all ordered our main courses and five minutes later our side salads arrived. I began scarfing down the portions of lettuce in front of me, when I noticed a strange item in my salad. Upon further inspection, it turned out to be a full white latex glove. The waiter offered a halfhearted apology and replaced my salad, but did not visibly inform the manager. I called the manager over to our table and explained the situation, to which he replied, "All of our food handlers wear gloves for health purposes". Super! I was comp'd the steak, but won't be going back to Tavern on Rush any time in the near future. All in all, it was a glovely evening.

People love to hate this place, but they still draw a huge crowd.  It's not my scene, but I can see why some people absolutely love it.  What's wrong with old men, with fake hair and teeth boob-jamming every woman in the joint with their eyes and trying to get a piece?    If the nature channel ever does a episode of the human mating process, they would start here. People are way to hard on this place and they should just accept the fact that there is a market for it.  Seriously, it's not as bad as people make it out to be;-)

On the most frigid night of the year, my girl and I went to the "viagra triangle" to try out Tavern.  We got there rather early and the crowd was a bit on the mature side, if you know what I mean.  As the evening went on the crowd got a bit younger and lively.  Nonetheless, you had your sleezy guys trying to win the favor of equally buzzed women.  It was a trip, just watching. Sorry, back to the task at hand.  We sat at the bar, smack dab in the middle, and just soaked everything in.  The bartenders did their jobs with professional zeal and I have never seen ash trays cleaned so often.  My Cosmo and seven and sevens were yummy and my girls macallans were just right.  How the hell can you screw up on scotch rocks.  Anyway, we had a craving for some sweets, so we decided on the $10.95 MUD PIE.  OMG, the portion that we had was meant for godzilla.  The oreo crust was the sh......t.  All in all, if you want a nice time lounging in a somewhat sophisticated atmoshpere, with eye candy to boot, this is your place.  Cheers!

Tavern on Rush is a cool hip place to dine for an upscale American dinner or hang out for a hip after hours atmosphere.  Reservations are best for this steak house, but as for us, we came here to have a few drinks... well more than a few... This Gold Coast destination features a cool bar area with multiple seating.  There is an outdoor cafe which is nice during the warmer months, but like us, we came during SuperBowl weekend and it was um... 7 degrees!!!  BUUURRRR....  Guests and wait staff aren't too shabby to look at if you are looking for some eye candy... Frank Winters from the Greenbay Packers was there hitting on this lady who sat next to us with her friend... Sorry for you Winters fans, but his mannerism was a bit on the annoying side.  Other than that, it was fun sitting at the bar talking to people and making random conversation.  The Chi-Town folks seem to be nice and easy to talk to... Just remember to say, "Da Bears" after a few drinks!

I'm gonna have to toot my own horn here for a moment, so bare with me: My girlfriend and I arrived promptly for our 9 PM dinner reservation. We were seated at a fabulous table overlooking Rush Street. The place was pretty packed; lots of chatter and hustle and it was all going very well. Then, things got awesome. Why? Because thanks in part to the ample cleavage I was putting on display last night, someone from the table next to us sent over a bottle of wine. Pretty sweet, right? But WAIT...things get sweeter. Guess who sent over the bottle of wine? None other than Charlie Weis and the manager for the band Chicago. Charlie's superbowl ring was blinging so hard it made my eyes hurt. It was mesmerizing. Not to mention, Chicago might be one of my favorite nostalgia bands of all time. I think I started singing "hoooooooooold me now" a little bit too loudly at one point. So just as I'm digging into my steak salad, our nice waiter man drops by again to deliver the next piece of awesome news..."The gentlemen at the table next to you would like to pick up your dinner bill." HOLY AWESOMENESS. This was music to my sweet little ears and my sweet little walllet...and I really must emphasize *little* wallet. So after a bottle of wine, an excellent dinner, 2 shots of tequila, and the promise of VIP treatment at Chicago's next concert, I left Tavern on Rush grinning ear to ear. I'm so happy I have boobs.

Sometimes I dream about their 7-layer chocolate cake.  I know Tavern gets some mixed reviews, but I like it. Yes, there are tons of dirty old men with their 20 year old gold-digging girlfriends. But it makes for really good people-watching - and I've really never had a bad meal here. Their Hawaiian Butterfish is pretty much one of the best pieces of fish I've ever had.  Ask for Joey for your waiter - he's the best!

Went out w/ some co-workers and had the NY Steak which was amazing!  The drinks are pretty pricey but I thought the food and service were great. I didn't hang at the bar so this review is just for the restaurant.

I went to Tavern this weekend for a friend's birthday, and let me just say that it was quite the memorable (or unmemorable--depending on your perspective) meal. Almost right as we sat down, each of us successively began began to shiver.  Soon thereafter, we were informed by our less than courteous waiter that the heat was broken.  However, rather than combat the mechanical problem with excellent service, our waiter chose instead to make snide remarks regarding both the heat and our open declaration of the poor service.  It was quite evident that he did not want to lose the table for he would be receiving the hefty tip of an 8 person meal.  Although we didn't exactly warm up to him as the meal progressed, he didn't have a second lapse of service. Needless to say, the food itself was suprisingly good.  We enjoyed the flatbread appetizer, and the steaks were said to have been tender--i would not know;  i had the pizze margherita because i am a vegetarian. I would reccomend Tavern for the food and the lively Lincoln Park environment, but the service, as mentioned above, was lackluster at best.

Tavern has always been a fun place for me!  I have pleanty of good memories drinking here.  The food is good and the Drinks are stiff.   I enjoy it more in the summer than the winter.  And for the boys who like them Tavern always has lots of cougars on the prowl.  Great place for a girl to go gold digging too!  j/k..... well maybe not

I can't really speak for the dinner scene here, because I can't remember the last time I came down here past 2 p.m..  But I really don't mind stopping in here for lunch. At my old job, I had one client who loved some type of salad on the menu and would always "suggest" (ok... demand) coming here. I had never payed much attention to the prices, as they were business lunches, but I never had a complaint about the meal and I tried a variety of dishes over the years.  Last week, I stopped in with a co-worker during an extra-long lunch break and I had a great time.  It wasn't too crowded (did catch that 60 business type thing though), the wait staff was excellent and the food was really good. The noise level was perfect, and nothing interrupted our conversation. I also, coming out of my own pocket this time, did not find the prices that unreasonable (just lunch maybe?), but we also did not order drinks.  I don't know that I would flock from anywhere outside the general area to grab a meal here, but if you are strolling rush street during lunch and trying to get out of the cold, I don't think it's a bad place to stop.

I went here for dinner one night awhile ago on a blind date.  The date didn't work out so hot, but that didn't effect the three star review.  Food was mediocre, and way too expensive for what it tasted like.  Also, the drinks were outrageously priced.  I won't be going back, because of how expensive it was, and the over 60 clientele that hangs out in there.

The only time I ever come here is when my parents visit for Thanksgiving.  Usually nothing else is open and I'm not buyin' so we will stop by here for a cocktail or two.  We even had T-day here last year and although they ran out of pie, the food was really good (especially their pumpkin soup). I like the bar.  And haven't seen any creepy old guys during my visits (Unless Vaughnifer counts.  Come on. Maniston can be frightening at times, no?).  The service is great (but probably because the waitresses were stoked that the old Viagra men were at home carving turkeys with their age appropriate wives??) and my martinis were TOP NOTCH.  It may have a rep, but Tavern on Rush has always been kind to me.
I've only been here for drinks, but it does provide for some great people watching. Lots of older guys talking to younger women. But hey, it's what Viagra Triangle is known for!

Pretentious with just average food at high prices. After we were screened by the "hostesses" at the door- 2 twenty  something bimbo types, we were escorted to a very nice table and served totally average food at inflated prices. I understand the draw here is to see and be seen but for those interested in fine dining look elsewhere.

Probably no finer after work spot.  Great service and cocktails waitresses that actually have personality (are you listening Cali?) The whole place just has a solid vibe, swanky yet friendly.  It fills up fast so don't leave without a plan.
If I wanted to get hit on my creepy old men, I'd go to a Sox game. Kidding.  I'd never go to a Sox game.

Wow, the people watching at this place is outstanding!  On a few occasions I went with a group of friends for the kitsch factor and played "which hooker will that guy leave with?"  However, people watching is the only good thing about Tavern on Rush.  The food and beverage selection is overpriced and boring.   Unfortunately, Tavern on Rush has gotten a reputation with some of my out-of-town friends as a "cool" place to go, but I make sure to set them straight when they visit.

Take the Levitra, leave the cannoli.. Thank God.  Finally, a place in the Rush Street area that serves shrimp cocktail, steaks, chops, seafood, and huge martinis.  That's exactly what this city has been lacking all these years.  Used to be a scene here, now it's elbow to elbow with guys and dolls from Oak Lawn and Niles.  I used to love it when Michael Jordan would show up and suddenly they wouldn't allow guys wearing baseball caps in the bar, like it's upscale here or something. Look out for drunk sportswriters hitting on anything that moves and smoking nasty cheap yet overpriced Dominican cigars at the bar.  Nice narrow staircase down to the bathroom, watch your step.

I've never been impressed with Tavern on Rush.  The food is pretty mediocre and it's definitely placed in the right spot of town (right in the middle of the Viagra triangle) as all the 60 yr old men escort 25 yr old women to dinner...at least the people watching is entertaining!

Cheese .. Cheese and more Cheese. Fun to watch the 60 year old men chase the divorced 40 year old "gold coast" women. I take out of town business folks here just to get a front row seat to this Viagra hot spot. Anna Nicole would call this bar home if she decided to go out in Chicagoland
yes, the drinks are overpriced, but it's not overrated here. perfect after a long day of work, there is always a good-looking fun crowd here.

I do like this place, although it can be a little pretentious.  It is definitely a meat market.  The food is great though, and i love the layout of the bar.  They do great oysters. It is definitely a place to see and be seen.

The prices may be a bit much for the budget-conscious, but it also ensures not only superb dishes, but also superb service.  The crowd is a bit older (which typically coincides with better salaries) and relaxed.  Try the prime rib sandwich, or pretty much anything with steak; guaranteed it will be perfectly cooked.  Like most places in the Gold Coast, Tavern on Rush carries a wide array of wines, liquors and beer.
Great steak here for a pretty reasonable price.  Their drinks are big and strong as well and the waiters are very attentive

This is the type of place I love to eat at.  Great food and drinks.  Upscale atmosphere that's not too stuffy.  The pork chops were perfect.  They're known for their steaks.  The waitstaff was top notch.  It's a tad pricey but if you're going there, you must be expecting it.  The menu is a la carte, and the sides are enormous.  The martinis are awesome here too.
